My friends got the pineapple upside down cake and it was quite the sweet treat! I am SO getting that next time and suggest you do too!

One down, I will say is one of my friends got the grilled cheese sandwich with apples on it and halfway through her meal, realized there weren't any apples on it. She didn't want to complain so she didn't say anything. I am sure if she would have, they would have offered a new sandy, at least I hope they would.

One other slight annoyance, is that when we got there, the seating seemed to be a bit unorganized and we were taken to one table but then it was dirty so then we went to another. No biggie but I will say while our server was certainly sweet, he moved a little on the laid back/slow side. We had to wait longer than I think we should have, given the lack of a huge crowd.

Overall, though I would totes recommend this place and I sent my sister and niece that way this weekend while they are in town. I hope they leave with happy tummies...I think they will y'all!

Oh look, another "I hate Comcast" post.

Seriously, wtf Comcast? 

I moved from NJ where I've had Comcast for several years. Since I was moving to Philly and that's a different state, I had to close my NJ account and open one in Philly. Okay! 

But wait! The people who used to live in my apartment ran up the bill and never paid it. Great. Now I have to prove I am not them. Excellent. That rep tells me to go to the office on Columbus Blvd with my lease. Okay! 

I wait in line for 45 mins with 30 other people who wanted to be anywhere but hanging out in the Comcast line. I get up there, explain my story, hand over my lease and I am told "Oh no we need your lease, ID, Social Security card, and a current utility bill from your old address" I'm sorry, what? Since I don't normally carry my SS card and utility bills on me, I question why I was never told this and the heffer behind the glass says "It's noted here that you were told to bring these items" uh, no ? If i was I WOULD HAVE BROUGHT THEM YOU COW. So, off I go, annoyed and ticked off.

I call Comcast the next day from work to drag some fax numbers out of em. I get 3, 2 dont work. WTF. Fine so I will go stand in line for 45 minutes AGAIN to deal with the heffer with mad cow disease behind the glass wall. Now I understand WHY there is a wall b/c I can only imagine how many people would chuck a cable box at their dumb heads. Anyway, I go, give the cow my info and Im told the security department will review and have a decision  in 5-10 business days. WHAT. I want internet NOW!

So I go home and send what I shall refer to as the EECB (executive email carpet bomb) to 80 Comcast Execs, asking why its so hard to continue to give them my business? Who calls me 20 mins later but Comcast to setup my account ? Score! Until I have to call back to tell them what equipment I wanted (had to double check with the roomate) and was told there were setup fees (yuck), and to get them ASAP (the next day) Id have to pay $30 for overnight shipping. Grr. Fine. Gimme the goods. So my roomate stays home alllll day the next day (Friday) waiting for our Comcast goodies. No show. So I call Comcast AGAIN to ask em wtf and oh my stuff didnt ship. YOU DONT SAY!!! And they "think" it will ship the next day. Oh. Awesome.

Saturday rolls around and I get a call from Comcast who says they cant setup my account b/c they need the dl/ss/utility bill of the other person on the lease. What. The account is solely in my name, to which Im told, the other person on the lease could not pay and stick Comcast. Uh, hello? Im the ONLY person on the account. So after I go back and forth with this woman, shes not getting that Im not having this crap and Ive given em everything they asked for & now a few days later its not good enough? I snapped, to be honest and told her to find whoever had the authority to fix my problems to call me back. 10 minutes later I get a call that my account has been setup and they have a tech coming out to do the install on Sunday morning. Free of charge I ask ? Crickets. Uhhh, yea, free of charge.

So Mr. Comcast man comes out on time (yippeeeeee) and sets us all up, minus a router since he had none. That's ok, Ive got a spare around here somewhere. 1 DVR, 2 cable boxes, and 1 modem later, we can has Cable and Internets...1 week late.

Oh and on the following Thursday (one week after I was supposed to get overnight shipping) Guess what shows up at my door via UPS ? 1 DVR, 2 Cable boxes, 1 modem, and 1 router.  

The thought of going BACK to the Comcast office to hand this crap in makes me want to jump off the Ben Franklin.

Comcast is sooooo lucky I can't get FIOS in my building.
OMG my very first Poke experience. It was DELISH. the fish was fresh and the entire meal was very light and flavorful. I cant wait to go back.

Jason, frontdesksman is absolutely on point. 
While I was waiting my turn , I observed him  handle 4 customers and greet a delivery driver. Each of those interactions was handled with efficiency and the utmost enthusiasm. 

As for my request, I needed a replacement key and restaurant recommendations. Got my key after ID and room check. Got recommendations and insightful anecdotes about 5+ restaurants in town.

(Facilities are solid, breakfast has slight variations between the days.)
If you come to and don't eat here,  you a fool!  This place rocks with unique twist on old favorites and your next new favorites.

We were able to get a seat outside and were quickly greeted with menus and our server. Warning... they do not have Mimosas...this is sad for a breakfast place. I had the Mexican skillet which was very filling and had a bit of a spicy kick. My wife had the steak burrito,  which for those who might be interested in this... it is ground steak more like burger or sausage. It is not flank steak. She was a bit disappointed based on this but still said it was good and filling. Would definitely recommend for a quick inexpensive breakfast and we will go back...just not for steak and mimosas!

This was my first time at this location. I was hesitant because of the mixed reviews but I had a great experience. We had virtually no wait to be seated. Our server was friendly and kept out drinks filled without being asked. Our food didn't take long to come out and the steaks were cooked correctly. I would return for sure!

food was surpisingly delicious, did not taste like cafeteria food although somewhat presented like that, no offense
All in all, will return with the family. Roast beef, green beans, creamed spinach, everything we got was soooo delicious! busy mom, gotta go....

Never been treated so poorly or heard employees complain so much about having to work past closing. Got there at 7:45 to hear both employees doing nothing but bitching that is was SOOOOO busy (two people in the whole restaurant) and that they couldn't finish closing before they actually closed at 8:00. Planned on spending $50...walked out after ordering. Won't be back!

Had some friends visiting from Orlando this weekend and they wanted to hit up some breweries. I was hesitant with everything that's going on but agreed. Went to a few places Saturday and they were terrible, they didn't seem clean.  But today at hidden springs was totally different. Happy bartenders, cool music and the place smelt super  Clean and sanitized. I could see the bartenders with their masks on and they were constantly cleaning. Im not really into beer but that had an amazing seltzer on tap that they recommend. Riot water? Anyways, By far the best brewery we went to this weekend! If you're feeling unsure about venturing out, go to hidden springs. Oh and most importantly,  my friends said they had the best beer there by far!

Met a friend here for breakfast. His name is Mark too...but he spells it with a K which is pretty ridiculous if you ask me. I decided not to punish the Oxford Exchange by taking away a star because my friend doesn't know how to spell his own name. 

Anyway, I could spend the whole day here. They have a really cool book store and shop with a lot of interesting stuff. For some reason they also have a section with glasses. I'm not so sure I'm going from breakfast to glasses in the same place, but I guess someone is doing it. 

There are plenty of places to sit and get some work done. It's an awesome place to meet someone (just make sure they spell their name right). 

And for the real reason you are reading this review.

The food here is great! They always have some interesting things on the menu. And as much as I want to point you in the right direction, anything on the menu is great!!! If you haven't already come here, you need to!!!

I haven't eaten fast food since my last visit to this Hardee's. You gave me food poisoning. Thanks for turning me into a healthy individual I guess. Wish I could give you 0 or negative stars for food so awful it makes you sick with poison.

Hutch's has gone downhill lately. 

If you're just paying for a basic wash, its not bad...or if you get a free wash with old change deal. But the last two times we made the mistake of asking for something more...once we asked for the deluxe service and found that the time spent on our truck was exactly the same as every other car in the place. Nothing was done extra.

This time we had a large problem with tree sap on the truck, so the attendant suggested that nothing but a hand wash would take care of that. So paid the $55 and waited an hour. The results were probably worse than just the basic wash. Mud was left under the doors and there were still bug splats above the windshield. More importantly, they removed 80% of the sap drops. So you know they can remove them...they just gave up on it. 

It's time for a new wash place....

My boss and I found Shaker and Peel recently and decided to check it out for a new work-lunch spot. Katelyn, the Unicorn-Care Bear hybrid, has changed our lives for the better. We didn't have a spot where we could call home for our lunch meetings, but God-in-Heaven, we found it. 
Here me now: If you have not tried this place out, do so IMMEDIATELY. Also - the manager, Jolene, is super nice and communicative. The food, quality, and experience is unmatched in the area. If you think I'm lying, go back to the Communist Party. This place is bangin'!

Sold my home, and went to cancel my account. They changed their policy and won't pro-rate anymore. In other words, I had to pay a full month because I called them 3 days after last billing cycle when the house was sold. Lousy policy, and this will continue to drive business away to others. I will never again subscribe to so-called "cable" service again. I guess they're desperate to get every nickel and dime they can. Surprised this is even legal. I smell a class action lawsuit any day now.

Super disappointed! We've been without air conditioning for a month! Apparently they don't know how to deal with American Home Shield, and didn't have the customer service to let us know they didn't know how to do it! Why sign up with a contract that you can't handle?! They even screened our calls to not talk to us when we called. BTW it reached 101 degrees today. Thanks Ross for nothing!!

One of the only free zoos in America.  Its a great free getaway right in the middle of everything in St. Louis. You can even ride on the train all day now for one price. Highly recommended as a place you visit.

I was visiting from out of state and always have to stop in to the Wild Muffin, when I am there.  I love, Love, LOVE their vegan muffins, so yummy.  The staff was so friendly, knowledgeable and so very helpful.  A unique gem in Nashville!

The place looks like a typical pizza joint. When you taste the food, The pasta, oh man is it ever good. It's so good it's worth a long drive.The staff is friendly and the coffee is very good. I think they do a great job and if you are in the area or feel like making the drive you will be in for a treat. Maybe you are lucky enough to live right around the corner!!!
The portions are decent. You get bread, soup, salad etc. The salad is made well and the soups are really good. There is flavor in this food, nothing bland here. 
Writing this review I am craving it now. Why are there not a million reviews up here raving about this place?!?!?!

really good salads and wraps! the staff is okay, some of them don't want to deal with customers which is odd because this is a food service/customer service based job. it is very expensive tho. i paid $13 for a salad and i wasn't the happiest with the price but the salad was delicious! i come here once in a while, when i feel like spending a little more money on lunch

I just did the infrared sauna which felt so amazing! They have fluffy towels, robes and even have a tiny refrigerator that has cold wet wash clothes with a beautiful EO blend on them to cool down afterward! 
Then I had a colonic with Esther! I have been getting monthly colonics with her for over 6 years! She is so knowledgeable and professional! 
I just absolutely love her new Buisness she opened up! Very conveniently located, easy in/out. 
Can't wait to try the ionic foot bath!
Highly recommend this place!
Solid local restaurant that never disappoints. A little higher priced for Mexican food in town, but well worth it.

Before trying Joe's Next Door for a lunch break, I was told that the BLT would change my life. That's a pretty high bar of expectation to set, but wooooow... yeah, I loved it. 

Joe's is located right on main street in Carmel, so you can't miss it. Stop in for a wide variety of spices, sauce, frozen meals, wine, sandwiches -- and obviously, meat. 

For lunch I've opted for the BLT twice and the Cuban once. Both were delicious, but they really do work some magic on the BLT. It only takes about 5 minutes for them to make it, and the staff is very friendly. 

Be sure to grab a small bag of Broad Ripple Chip Co with your sandwich... and definitely, opt for the BLT.
Muy Bueno Comida.  I didn't have time to take a photo of the food because it was so good it was gone before I could think to snap a shot.  Great for kids too.

Wonderful ambience and an incredibly warm greeting as we walked in the door. Beautiful place for a romantic dinner or a party with friends.  Food was very fresh and delicious.  Particularly enjoyed the table side guacamole, made to our taste.  The service was impeccable with everyone trying to make our experience enjoyable.  Would highly recommend this restaurant. Outstanding!

This is one of my all time favorite spots for a perfect Sonoran hot dog..
Clean, friendly & fast
Most of all great food

Harp & Crown is amazing! The minute you walk in, you will notice the high ceilings, beautiful chandeliers, vintage wallpaper, and funky decorations. The wait staff wears fashionable suspenders and are professional and friendly. They frequently check on you throughout the course of your meal to ensure your glasses are full and your plates are cleared. The menu is extensive and offers salads, cold dishes, hot dishes, meats, fish, and vegetables. I highly recommend the hearth roasted whole cauliflower. It is filling and flavored to perfection.

I loved the original Cafe European and was so excited when they decided to open a new location after selling the previous. This location is more cafe style- which was actually perfect bc I would always stop to pick up lunch anyway. The owners are such lovely people. Everything is homemade and tastes absolutely delicious, and I was glad to see them keep some of my favorites from the old menu (like the cilantro chicken sandwich). They're so accommodating too. They have a regular menu and specials that always sound amazing- it's so hard to choose! My only qualm is that parking in that little plaza can get terrible so sometimes I don't stop just because of parking. It isn't their fault so I didn't knock off any rating and I know they have an agreement with the lot across the street, I'm just a snob and I don't want to cross Westshore in my heels ha- but it is disappointing sometimes nonetheless.
What a concept!!! Wish we had this in Cali. We have access to some of the best food in the country in so cal and I've not seen a place like this. Amazing meatballs. Amazing service. Cool vibe.

Ok - so I was born & raised in the area but have since moved to FL ... When I get back this way, I ALWAYS get my cheesesteak fix & usually attempt to try different merchants.  Especially avoiding Pat & Geno's ... 

Let me start at my arrival.  Upon entering the establishment I was glad to see most of the tables full at 3 pm -- good sign.  

I was first in line to order ... And there were 2 gals present to assist w/ the order ... Surprisingly, I wasn't greeted or even acknowledged for 5 minutes!!!!!  The chick answered the Phone while I patiently waited ... Not even once making eye contact!!  That should've been the sign .... 

Two (2) cheesesteaks ordered; 1 American wit & 1 Provo wit/out .... They charge an extra buck for the cheese on a cheesesteak (what?!?) ... Ended up getting one as a combo which included fries & a soft-drink ... Total was $22 bucks!!  

Waited about 7 mins for my order.  Upon calling my number (same rude chick at the counter) I expressed my order was to go & politely asked for a bag ... To which her reply was, "you'll have to wait a minute!" Excuse the *^#¥ out of me ... But she did manage to hand me a bag this allowing me to bag my own food - how Customer Service is that?! 

Now on to the food review -- the sandwiches were average size.   Cheese was properly melted & distributed throughout ... The drip factor was present but the meat wasn't chopped up ... Ok, not a big deal ... But upon biting in the meat was a little chewy .... Flavor was mediocre but enough to fill the roll.  Onions had a decent flavor but that was about all I can say about that.  

Overall, I would NOT go back.  There are many better places to give your money for a better quality experience & service.   Try Campos nearby for a much better experience from friendly to quality!   In fact, I've got a better local location in Orlando, FL from a Philly transplant who opened his shop called Brianto's!!  Well worth it as he uses best quality meat & flies in Amoroso rolls to add that authentic experience!

BEST TACOS IVE EVER HAD. NOT KIDDING . They make their own tacos and everything is super duper FRESH. 

Don't be mislead by the outside appearance this place is super authentic.

If you find yourself stuck in Old City on a weekend and you are looking to dance...this is the best place to do it.  The DJ is decent and they play a good combination of pop and hip-hop hits that you can definitely boogie to.  Also the dance floor is not usually super packed and people are generally having a decent time. 

It is usually pretty dark in the whole place and I wouldn't recommend coming here to have  casual beer with your friends and chat.  This is more of a bar for the end of the night when you just want to let loose.  Drink prices are reasonable and they usually have some solid beer choices on tap.  I've never been here for the food...it feels more like a dirty dance floor club to me but I imagine it looks nice during the day too.  A very interesting building from the outside though I've seen one too many drunk girl fall down the stairs out front...

We stopped by here for dinner with some friends because the menu looked good and they have a good selection of drinks. 

The atmosphere of the place is great and fun and there's lots to look at! The service was fantastic, very efficient and our waitress was very friendly and even helped us with our meal choices as there is a lot to choose from on the menu and everything looks good. 

My husband had the Jambalaya that he said was really good, my friends husband got the Jerk Chicken which looked amazing and he said was delicious but the highlight was the Taco Salad! I got chicken and my girlfriend got beef and it comes in a huge taco she'll bowl and is filled with fresh lettuce, tomato, cheese and avocado and it was one of the best salads I've ever had. I give 5 stars just for that meal! 

It's also not too expensive so try it out with friends for a great night out.

I love this place so much that I don't even know where to begin this review.  I have dined or had drinks here at least 25 times over the last five years.  I have never had a less than perfect experience or less than perfect meal.
     Starting with the atmosphere, what can I say that has not been said before?  The place is gorgeous, no really.... it is stunning.  The old converted church is lovely in every possible way and exudes charm from every corner both inside & out.
     This is an elegant establishment and I just don't think we have enough of those in a world that is becoming ever more casual.  Check in with the host, check your coat and hang out at the bar.  They have a nice wine list that will surely have something for your enjoyment.  The bartenders have been the same for years & will create some of the finest cocktails in New Hope - I recommend the classic Martini.  The host will come get you when your table is ready and whisk you away to a romantic dining room on the second floor.  Look around as you climb the stairs, there is a lot to see in this beautiful old church.  
     The grand dining room is large, complete with stunning art and magnificently high ceilings.  The tables for couples will be adorned with red rose petals.  
     The food has always been exceptional, understand it is Southern cooking, Creole to be exact - lots of seafood, lots of classics such as jambalaya & gumbo.  The fresh French baguette they bring over is always warm, flakey in the outside and delicate on the inside.  The service has never been less than five stars.  I always like a little banter with whomever is serving and my last experience here was no exception.  Our server both entertained us with his quick wit and informed us about everything we considered on the menu.
    We both ordered the beet salad with spinach & goat cheese as our starter and as a vegetarian I got the Eggplant Napoleon as my meal.  Creamy, buttery, fresh, flavorful with just the right spice to make an impression - delicious!!!  Naturally dessert had to be ordered and I got the carrot cake, be warned - it is a very large piece and is served with a scoop of homemade ice cream.  I couldn't finish the whole thing & I never leave dessert unfinished on my plate.  
     As I said at the start, I have never had less than a five star experience at Marsha Brown's and will be back again in a few weeks.
I'm addicted to this place. They sell the best Tacos!! They are delicious. Tamales and sopes too
Great tater tots and finger foods. Expensive but tasty drinks. Fun night of bowling.

Truthfully not as good as my first visit on opening night.  First off they were told us that they didnt have any monkey bread at 6 pm on a Monday night no worries that happens.  But all the items we ordered were just not as good.The brussel sprouts were over cooked with a little too much char on them.  The cioppino seafood also was overcooked too.  We asked if the Restaurant upstairs was open on Monday night for a night cap beacuse we dont care for Itailan wine.  Two different employee told us it was open and surprise it was closed.  dont your employees know your hours?  Service was fast and friendly.

Holy moly, this was an amazing lunch. Ordered at the bar and sat down at a booth, got the Grilled chicken mushroom and Swiss sandwich with an appetizer of chicken quesedilla egg rolls (flautas). DELICIOUS.  Shot a game of pool in the back of the bar.  21+ to enter. Great moderate noise level, friendly staff, good lighting, cleans bathrooms, stocked pool table.
This place is still amazing. I'm. I'm unsure what else to add.

I wish I had thought twice before signing a year contract. From the beginning they tried to upsell me on various training programs which were quite costly. I found that parking was difficult if not impossible  at the 12th street location. When I tried the spring garden club, the fellow next to me on the treadmill had a loud phone conversation and the staff did nothing to stop him. Getting out of contract  is a $50 charge and a thirty day notice totaling $100. All in all, I went twice and paid $550. If you think this club might be for you, try it for a month before making a long term commitment. They have a strong sales pitch and from what I found seemed more interested in emptying my bank account with different tiered clubs and fancy plans. I was definitely not their audience and have found decent gyms with better parking for a fraction of the prices they charge.

UPDATE: 7/10/2019

Today I got a burger with American cheese, bacon, and extra onions. I've got to say, I have found my new favorite burger place and that goes for all of US as far as I'm concerned. I don't know what they put in it but it's got me coming back for more.
Just look at the photo and you can see the pickles are perfectly sliced thin, crispy, they're not too thick, the onions are sliced perfect, tomatoes are sliced perfect and all laid out in the right order. The shredded lettuce is just enough to hold it all together and keep things from sliding off. The buns are toasted perfectly. All together every bite was great. I hate when you buy a meal like a burger and every other bite, or only three or four bites, are good. Every bite of this burger was balanced with everything. That's a hard thing to do.
Keep up the good work!

Ok, I do not understand how this place receives 3.5 stars. 
Staff are amazingly friendly and professional. Food is fantastic. Easy in and out. Big diverse menu. Real quality meat. What else could you ask for?
I have hade the classic cheesesteak with extra cheese about 7 times now. Always great. Hot, fresh, packed with yumminess.
I tried the French Dip recently and it's now my absolute fav in Boise area. The AuJus is rich and piping hot. Good flavor, not watered down. 
I will share a "mishap" that happened yesterday though. 
I ordered this sandwich and got something that didn't even look close to what I had last time. Meat was fine, as usual, but the provolone cheese was grated and lumpy. WHAAAAAT?!?! No go. 
I took it up to the counter and explained politely that doesn't even look good. 
They gasped exactly as I did then after apologizing hurriedly remade a new one. They explained why that happened, which usually I don't care about but because I really like this operation I appreciated, then brought me my delicious masterpiece. 
Ok, maybe not masterpiece but it was fabulous. Juicy, cheesy, bread was so soft and lightly toasted it was as if it came out of the oven two mins prior. SO fresh. 
Incredible meal. 
Don't forget to get a frequent buyer card and always ask for your military discount (if applicable). They'll ask for proof so no fakeys or posers. 
Get ther
Enjoy

First time in Nashville and was recommended to check this spot out. Awesome casual cantina feel and stellar tacos. Cash only so come prepared, but well worth the visit if you are craving some delicious tacos. Amazing value for great food.

Was looking for something good to eat and Peí Wei hit the mark. Peí Wei is awesome as far as airport food goes. Everything was delicious and well prepared. Service was excellent. Great dining experience.

My daughter attended summer horse camp here- we picked it because it was closest to our house, but we love it! It's a shady ranch and the owner is super friendly and makes you feel like part of the family. Loved the dogs running around  (Veeda was my favorite) We we're impressed with the level of training they gave and they even provided snacks and breaks during the daily trail rides. I look forward to going back for a sunset trail ride myself!

Thankfully, you don't rate Chinese restaurants according to the sanitary status of their bathroom....
   That said, the bathroom now is about 20x better than it used to be 10 years ago. 

Joy Tsin Lau is a frickin' Philly Chinatown institution. 
  I've been going here since I was a wee lil tot. And lived in Delaware. 
     Yes. People live in the state known as Delaware.
    Even though we've moved since, we still return back to this place. 

My family has seen this place change ownership several times, endured fluctuations in the quality of food, watched Whiteys flood in (and then trickle out)...
   and I'm now glad to say, that Joy Tsin Lau seems to be in a solid place now. 

Haven't been back for dim sum in years, but we usually grab dinner here whenever I fly home into Philly (so several times a year at least). 
   Thankfully, the white:yellow ratio has slowed down and reduced recently. Not to hate on my white brethren. But seriously, I get nervous when too many of those kind show up in groups at Chinese restaurants. In Chinatown. 

Some 8 years ago, this place took a turn for the worse. And whites and their Lemon Chicken dishes flooded in. Needless to say, we stayed away. 
    But the food's gotten a lot better since. Thankfully. 
     Always a fan of their chow fun, fresh steamed shrimp, and fish. 

As mentioned, with the traditional Chinese decor, this place draws a lot of wedding banquets. Although unfortunately, it also seems to draw a lot of tourists. 

I hate way too much.

This was my first wine bar after moving from Atlanta to St Pete. What makes this place so freakin awesomely versital is the layout and multiple seating options. It has a nice but small bar around the bartendar that seats about 10 people. It has another ledge and stool chairs that acts as a bar (but no bartender there). It has multiple tables and sitting areas to accomodate groups of people. And it has a couple of handsome sofas (and not something that looks like it wasa reject picked up on frat row) that allow for an intimate experience that great for a date where you could actually carry on a conversation. They even have a very small patio area too - only big enough for a small group though.

There are waiters assigned to the seating areas, so this is not one of those help-yourself to a wine spout on the wall establishments. They also have beer here if you want to be that way but no open bar. 

The reason I chose this as the first wine bar was because it did look elegant and not like some hole in the wall but also b/c it was the only one open until Midnight on a Friday. Most of the other wine bars in the area close at 10pm! Wussies. 10pm is a pathetic closing hour for a wine bar on a Friday night.


What also makes this place kinda cool and they seem to always have events or specials or something going on here. From the calendars I've seen they seem to consistently have a "SUPER" happy hour every last Friday of the month that last from 4pm to Midnight.

My only complaint was the music. No, the volume was fine; it was suicide-inducing theme that ran with every song selction. You know - sad Adel songs, Bruno Mars songs and the like. I'm like - are they purposely playing these depressing tunes to engage you to drown more of your sorrows in more wine?

We'd go back though. Hopefully Pandora or whatever they decide to play will be less depressing.

I had another great experience getting my tux from Rudi's Formal Wear.  The staff did everything to ensure I looked good for my event.  Everything from initial sizing to second sizing and the pick up went extremely smooth.  I fall under the Big and Tall category and the staff ensured I looked very neat and put together.  I received many compliments on my tux.  I will always take my formal wear business to this family owned business.

Just left this Kroger and revived very poor customer service as family was trying to do the scan as you go service and a lady was very rude to my family and I instead of trying to help us she was horribly rude. Then turned around and was nice to the next customer she helped I am in the hospitality industry and was appalled with the service received.
This is an updated review after trying their gluten-free shroom burger and fries. The gluten-free bun was thick and soft, but a bit crumbly. The fries were very good. Overall great GF burger.

The bomb for sandwiches. Long line day I was there but it was worth the wait. Gambino sandwich great. Sweet potato habanero sauce gives everything a tasty kick. Friend had the cubano sandwich.... Also very good. Only trouble was finding seating. Limited spaces on a busy day. Nevertheless it's a place not to miss in Nola.
Considering this is actually a chain, their pizza is fairly decent. They have a very thin crust option and the prices are reasonable.
Awesome customer service! Will definitely be back. Didn't have a long wait on a Thursday afternoon.

This store is definitely a store for high schoolers who need books off their book list for the semester. (They also have a used book section that is quite limited - more mystery and romance books than straight up lit.) The books are organized just like the bookstore I used to grab books at when I was a high school student. I still would have bought a book anyway (some books that high school students are assigned are great books! Amerika by Kafka? Never read it. Should read it.), BUT they are cash only! At a book store!! Where a typical purchase is probably more than $10! But cash only. So I put my books back, apologized for not having cash, and walked out (probably never to return). If you're a high school student near Franklin or a parent of such a student, this store is probably great (so long as you have cash on you), but for regular readers/book lovers, it's not a great store. B&N in Cool Springs or Landmark Booksellers are probably better options.

It was my first time in Nashville and Rae's was the first restaurant I stopped at and can now say, I made a good decision. The staff is friendly, knows regulars by name and order, though welcome newcomers and make recommendations upon request. Conversation is abundant here, as friends, not as staff and guests. And the food matches the service; my choice was the wicked chicken- flavorful with soft bread...so good! If you are downtown looking for lunch, Rae's is your place.

Wow Reno has a great new Japanese Steakhouse. My wife and I decided to try the Teppanyaki  style  tables where the chef cooks right in front of you and puts on a bit of a show. the service was very attentive and the chef was funny and did a wonderful job. Five other people joined our table and it was fun talking with them. We exchanged business cards at the end of the meal so that was a bonus too. I highly recommend this new restaurant. i saw too that if one goes for lunch the prices which were reasonable for dinner are discounted at lunch by about 40%. Yummy.

Well, the low stars may be our own fault. We didn't realize they aren't always open and we came during low-season. So, when we went in the only options for us to choose from were ribs and pulled pork. We also got the baked beans and cole slaw.

The ribs were good, very moist. The pulled pork was nothing special. We did like the hot BBQ sauce (mild was very bland), and the sides we ordered. They felt bad they were out of all their food and did throw in extra ribs and pulled pork to help make up for it. Because of their great service, we will definitely come back during a busier time (maybe Summer?) and give them another shot!

Home away from home, Fat Dan's is one of my favorites! 

Love the bartenders, love the wings, Wednesday's they have a killer meatloaf sandwich, great rotating craft beer selection and of course all of the Chicago sports games your heart desires!

Go Cubs!
Amazing. I have never had a better Reuben in my life. These guys are awesome. I highly highly recommend them and am looking forward to returning for something tasty,
Guided me in then left me there without acknowledgement for so long that I left. Will stick to Woodbury location.

I want to apologize as I begin this review because I know some people put some time and money into opening this restaurant, and they could stand to lose it just from the words I say.  But, every business, even restaurants, must offer a reasonable amount of merchantability with their product, and we did not find this here.  I will give them the benefit of the doubt in saying that we did show up later in the evening, but, the night we showed up, they were supposed to be open until 2:00 a.m.  They should have closed much earlier.

To start, the service was slow, slow, slow.  When we got there, there were just two other tables of people there, and we thought they were already finished - just sitting around talking.  They were not.  They were still waiting for their food.  One table had three, related couples sitting at it, and each couple received its food separately.  It was as if the place was preparing each and every order one by one.  They were.  I just found that kind of unusual since there were at least four people in the kitchen that we could see, and it seemed that they could do more to expedite the process.  

Well, we finally got our food, and we were both wishing we hadn't.  I really don't know why I ate mine.  I guess I was just hoping it would get better.  It didn't.  The entire time I was eating it, I kept thinking two things.  The first was, "Why didn't I go to Rouse's and get a can of Chun King?  It would have been better."  The second was that joke by Ron White when he talks about his wife's cooking and what happened when they tried to feed it to the dog.  They later found the dog in the corner of the kitchen licking his butt.  Ron White commented, "He was probably trying to get the taste out of his mouth."  I was wishing I had that kind of flexibility.  The only time I ever had a worse meal in New Orleans was at the "Moon Wok" down the road on Dauphine.  That time, at least, the food tasted pretty good "going down," but not so much coming back up.  The food at CreAsian didn't have that head start.  

So, what was wrong with it?  I had Vegetables with Tofu.  The vegetables may have been fresh, but I couldn't tell.  They were way overcooked.  Also, the cook used way too much oil.  It was pretty much a mess of oily, overcooked vegetables.  The Tofu wasn't too bad, and I don't really care for the "soft" tofu, cooked or otherwise, and I did like that they offered brown rice on the menu.  As for my wife, she had the eggplant.  She loves eggplant, but her's, too, was overcooked, and greasy.  To show just how greasy, they served the dish in a partitioned, "to go," styrofoam container.  All of the entree was in the large partition.  The other two partitions were half filled with grease.  My wife kept having to pour grease into those extra partitions just to make her food edible.  It didn't work.  

I feel real sorry for these people, and I am real sorry to have to write this review, but there are so many good places to eat in New Orleans, I don't want anyone else to waste their time or their lives spending time at this one without knowing about it ahead of time.  Now, if you like greasy food, and Chun King Chinese, you might like this place.  I, on the other hand, have had much better, and know what much better tastes like.  I would never be happy with the food we served no matter the price, and not matter the locale.

Sorry to say we ordered prom flowers for my daughter and date. When we arrived to pick them up, there was a sign on the door saying they were running behind due to a death in the family. Totally understandable. I asked if we could pick up around 4 and was told they would be ready for sure by 3 pm. Sent my husband at 4 to pick up and they weren't ready. They called at 5 and said they were ready. We had to pick up and deliver to where pictures were already in progress. When we opened the box, we were very disappointed to see what we paid over $60 for. The boutonnière that cost over $20 was 2 of the smallest miniature roses on a stem with nothing else but black ribbon lace wrapped around the stem. My daughter's corsage didn't make it through dinner. Every flower fell off within 90 minutes of doing nothing but eating dinner and taking a few pictures. I really wouldn't have cared if they had apologized for the lack of quality due to the circumstances or offered to take a percentage off, but that didn't happen.  I really wish I could write a glowing review, but this was not a good experience.

Highly recommend going to this place! Bill was an excellent physical therapist. I had the pleasure of working with two other PTs at this location when Bill was on vacation who were extremely helpful as well. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. I came in with headaches that I have been dealing with for over a year and a half and I feel like I improved while going here. Bill really knows what he is talking about and taught me a lot of skills so I can continue to stretch and strengthen. I am very grateful to have found this place with such a wonderful staff. Thanks for all of your help!!
They workers here are always so nice and professional!! We've had to go there to get things notarized as well as ship items. They have a pretty good value for price too1

OK, I grabbed a seat at the sushi bar. it's self seating at opening at 11am. This is one of the few places where the bar seating is open. Here you don't have to put in that stupid little check off sheet to order or wait for a server to get to your table. Just tell the chef what you want. There were like 7 chefs on duty!  

I will say the sushi is very good here and the pieces are a little smaller than average, but that's a good thing!, you should be able to eat each piece in one bite. The fish quality was good on all of the species that I tasted. I like nigiri better as you can get the taste of the actual fish and see the skill of the chef in making the cuts and forming the rice. The rice was good too, not pressed to hard and not falling apart either. 

 Sitting at the bar you can make special requests easy and they'll do it for you. The service was fast enough that I wasn't waiting long for my next selection to appear in front of me. I gotta say this is probably the best sushi place I've found in Reno. The prices have gone up recently to $22 for lunch and I think $29 for dinner ... no difference in menu selections, just eating later for dinner will cost you more. I will return. not for the dinner price tho ...

This place is super popular, so if you don't want to wait, get here at or before 11am and wait by the door. When they open, just go in fast and grab a seat, as there is no hostess seating anybody at that time.

We've all probably been to a Subway once or twice. I normally wouldn't write a review, however this one is worth the write.  I was here last week and they had only one employee (Brianna), with about 4 people waiting. I've seen a lot of people get frustrated when it's like this. Brianna was exceptional, she never missed a beat.  She was friendly and gracious to everyone, calling them sir or ma'am. The guy in front of me even complemented Brianna on her superb attitude and ability to handle stress.  

I returned today because I was in the area, (business).  This time they had two employees on.  Great Subway to visit.  I meant to review it last week and didn't so thought I'd do it today

A&W Restaurant on East Fowler Avenue in Tampa is a great place to go for all things floats and burgers. I had never been to a A&W location before and was happy I tried it out. Everything was delicious and well prepared. The staff here was friendly and took care of everything. Good overall experience.

Doesn't look like much when you walk in but this place is a gem. Its is my go-to deli when I am at work. Best/freshest salad around and I am very fussy about my salads. Produce is incredibly fresh and delicious. A typical garden salad has two kinds of cherry tomatoes, multi-colored carrot slices, cucumber,  red cabbage, sliced green peppers and red onion. I normally get tuna salad on top (not overly mayonnaise) but today I got a chef salad. Beautiful presentation. Great prices. Suggest you order in advance and pick up as it can get busy and slow during school lunch breaks.

Still hunting for a Ramen Shop that can top Tokiwa at the Brewery District.  
Had the Tan Tan ramen, the broth was flavourless, only ground pork and green onion for fixings. 
Not worth $15

Dick and Jenny's used to be one of my favorite restaurants.  It fell out of my rotation when I couldn't count on being there before opening to secure a table or late enough to avoid an hour or more wait (no reservations accepted).  I had heard that the restaurant changed hands and intended to revisit.  Finally I did and was happy with the results.  Despite there being no cocktail list on the menu, I was able to impress upon the waiter my interest in a well crafted cocktail and was rewarded with an ingenious beverage involving gin, cilantro, muddled cucumber and other things.  It was rather delicious.  The appetizers including crab cakes, portabello blue cheesecake, and something resembling a pasty were phenomenal.  My lamb shank was very good as well.  I could give this restaurant 5 stars, but a couple of the sauces were not quite as good as everything else.  I will definitely return.
Absolutely the best burger ever. Staff is very friendly. Place is very clean. Love that they have real milkshakes.....First time there and will definitely be back. Worth the 20 minute ride.

Delicious!  I only tried their cake ice cream.  It is yellow cake batter ice cream with chocolate icing ice cream!  How can that not be great?!  They have numerous flavors and allow you to try before you commit yourself to a particular flavor.  The shop itself is great because it is in an old railcar along the Monon Trail in Broad Ripple.  Definitely a place to try if you are walking through the Broad Ripple area!

I would return here. It's great for a quick fix or pedicure on a lunch break. It's not a 'spa experience' but my technician was meticulous and courteous. Implements were clean and not handled questionably.

I had green curry chicken and requested just medium spicy. Wow!  It's very good but perhaps more spicy than I expected. But don't let that stop you. Just order the mild spicy if you are worried. It's too good otherwise to miss. 
The atmosphere is quiet and pleasant. Prices reasonable. I will recommend this to friends who enjoy Thai food.

This is the best meal I've ever had in Philly and one of the top 3 ever.
Yes, there is best steakhouse, and best Italian, etc.. etc, but for an American/Continental menu this is tops.
I lost track of how many tastings they brought, but they were all wonderful.
Fried Turnip strips with powdered sugar. Liquid ravioli with crab. Something with bacn foam on top. It just went on and on every 10 minutes and each was perfect.
Salad with 5 lettuces' had a wonderful dressing and the Pork app. was wonderful. 
Poached lobster was as good as anywhere and the lobster bisque in a small cup was the best ever. Not thick like most, but more of a hearty type broth. Hard to describe, but if it's on the menu, get it. The chicken was a type of bird from China that was on the small side, but pure white when you cut into it and had a wonderful taste.
My only complaint , and it's minor, was the choice of dessert. The donuts with dipping sauce were not on a par with the rest of the evenings food.
They were a little chewy , not light like I thought they would be. The dipping sauces were good, but next time there were other desserts that I would try.
Service was attentive, parking is what you can find on the street, and at night the place can be a little hard to find, but just look the sign at the corner of 45th and Larchwood.
If people asked me for a BYO in downtown I would say this first and Fond second. If you're in the suburbs then Sycamore, or Lotus Farm to Table in Media.

Yummers!

I went for dinner on a Tuesday and while it was fairly busy, I was seated right away indoors. The outside seating looks great, but it was a tad too chilly for my liking.

While the menu isn't really extensive, the food is particularly good. I got the pasta of the day (the last one) and it was BEYOND delicious. The noodles were house made (!!) along with the sauce. The dish was topped with perfectly cooked chicken and goat cheese. It was delectable. 

My guest had the BBQ brisket and was fairly pleased. 

Several reviews say that the service is a tad slow, and I can agree and disagree to that. I came for brunch a few months back and it was really slow. However, on my most recent trip, I was very pleased with our waiter. He was very good about checking in with. 

I'm sure I will return.

This is my first time here. I was very pleased with the General Tso chicken. The combo was enough to fill me up and I could share with my baby(bonus)! The chicken was heavy on breading and light on chicken. I did like the sweetness of the sauce... it balanced out the saltyness of the soy sauce. The price is average for this type of take out place. The service is ok. I went an hour befor closing and they looked like they were ready to go. I will return as I love some chinese food...soon to be a regular!

I'd definitely skip this place for better buffet like "Hokkaido Seafood Buffet and Grill" in Swansea, about 15 minutes away. They have better choices and much better treatment of their customers. While slightly more expensive; it's still under $30 for 2 people and their lunch buffet is also better quality too. 

Bamboo Valley is really generic Asian Buffet meal, cheap and subpar food. They have a Mongolian BBQ as well that looked questionable too. The "sushi" here was the cheap cut and slap together kind that is seaweed paper, rice, and fish toppings that seems just barely bordering on the passable. If anything this place doesn't deserve a "Grade 'A' food" rating needs to be revoked and given a B or C instead. 

The customers were moderately noisy and seemed like the local divey for late lunch crowd. Several parents and their children clustered for a group meal at one of the larger tables. The wait staff brought us drinks in a haphazard fashion and seemed more interested in specific tables to wait upon, rather than equal treatment of all customers. It's likely they were more interested in pleasing those customers then attracting new clients.

Ehhhh. The 8 dollar student admission was too much. It's a 5 story building but only 1.5 floors have any photography available. One of the exhibits was borderline child porn, and made us all very uncomfortable. Believe me, I love art, and my appreciation stretches quite far having lived with an art student for a year, but half naked 4 year olds in suggestive positions kinda creeps me out. Other exhibits include LiveJournal shots of someone's eyeball with a cell phone camera from 2005 and a non air conditioned hallway which is sure to doom any real art in months time. Don't get me wrong, we saw good stuff, like that one of the woman getting a tattoo. There's just not enough art. Maybe 5 dollar's worth. Not ten.

I ordered the nachos pictured because they looked so good. I wasn't incredibly impressed. The beef was kind of salty and the salsa didn't really have great flavor in my opinion. I did really like that it came with the Pico de Gallo, guac, lettus and salsa. Definitely not dry, they had plenty of meat, cheese and beans. I would be interested to see what their other, more traditional dishes would be like.

I've been waiting for this event ALL year!!! I saw the reviews from last year and was so excited to go, I was a little disappointed that there was not a pre-party mostly because I was hoping to have a large group to go thorough the hunted houses and everyone took their tickets and went inside. But Chris came to my rescue....Thanks to him I was able to navigate the park without walking in circles like I usually do.  So to the hunted houses. I can't remember them all. A few call my attention but I was not scared by any of them. Something about having people screaming and hitting stuff in my ear was not scary but annoying. The clown house was cool and some of the effects in the other houses was surprising like the guys in the ceilings. One particular character got so closed to my face that he actually hit me in the nose with his mask and it hurt for the rest of the night so after that I wasn't getting scare but ready to tell them to get out of my face. Anyways having VIP passes and not having to wait in line was great, not to mention the drinks tickets. The Instagram contest was cool even though we got all the pictures I decided not to enter. Honestly I was mostly scared of riding the coasters at night.... Go figure!!!! Can't wait for next year.

Granted I've never been to another soley based vape shop, I'd have to say this was a good one for a first experience. John (he is AWESOME! Never let him go), an employee started helping my friends and I upon arrival. He was very personable, down to earth, and most importantly: honest and straight forward with his reviews on the products I inquired about (which was greatly appreciated). The variety of juice flavors is pleasantly overwhelming, and as this experience was new to me, John remained very patient with us as we tasted different flavors until we found some we liked. As far as I'm concerned, I have no need to go to any other vape store. This place is literally a one stop shop that does repairs and all. See you all soon!

I used to live near the intersection of Bay to Bay and Macdil and the thing I miss most about living there is being walking distance to Datz. It is one of my favorite restaurants in Tampa and where I chose to have my birthday dinner there this year (it fell on a Sunday which would have been a problem in the past, but they are now open until 8 on Sundays).

For drinks, they have a full liquor bar of course. I've had their Bloody Mary before and it's fantastic. However, I'm a big craft beer fan and Datz always has a huge selection of good beers to choose from. And it's not always the same which is even better.

Food is where Datz really shines. The menu is always changing and I always like to try something different when I come here, so while I can't recommend one specific dish, I can pretty much recommend everything. I have never been disappointed by anything I've ordered here. And as if I hadn't had enough to eat already on my birthday, they gave me a free cupcake for desert which was, of course, delicious!

I am very torn.  On the good side - - the room was very clean and new.  I thought the bed was comfortable, my wife did not.  My wi-fi worked and continued to work.  The location was really good, for the tourist things we were doing.  The concierge was helpful in explaining hiking trails near the hotel.  Now for the not so good: getting to/from room took forever, and I thought the staff was not very friendly, excluding the concierge.  The front desk clerk was nice, but gave us a little attitude when we asked him to explain again the best way to get to our room (we were almost as far as you can be from the front desk; had to walk outside to another building, take one elevator up; walk down a hallway; then take another elevator up; then walk down a hallway).  When we ordered a drink from the bartender on New Year's Eve, she did not say a word, other than "do you want to run a tab or pay now."  How about, hello, thank you, have a good night, Happy New Year.  We checked out via the tv, but had a question about the bill.  The person who answered the phone to answer our question was very nasty.  

I do not like "resorts" where exercise room and/or spa are not in main building.  You should not need to walk outside to get to exercise room or spa.

Views are amazing.

I question whether it is proper to charge a resort fee.  I question even further whether it is proper to charge tax on the resort fee.

Read the menu, order at the front, get a number. This adorable little gem has great breakfast lunch and dinner. I highly recommend the Tumeric Latte. They also have WiFi! You can walk around the town afterwards as well

Visiting from Dallas and wanted it to be so much better. Let's start with the positive. We received very good service at the bar and it's a nice environment.  Sadly, the food is mediocre at best and for the price just not good. The wedge salad and the Mac and cheese are very good. The steak, oysters and baked potato no better than what you'd get at Outback. The spinach, or cheese with green stuff mixed in, is truly awful.  I'd say go to the bar for drinks but avoid the food.  Somehow 2 of us managed to spend $265, including tip, for a $75 meal. Sadly, not going back.

Oh my gosh! This brewery may be tucked away, but they're putting out some great beer and awesome food in this little unassuming place.

Parking available behind the building (on the west side) with doors in the front and the back. The bar takes up a lot of room inside, but there's plenty of seating available. Mark and team is making some great brews.. I'm a big fan of the Coconut Porter and the Big Ed IPA (throwback to the days of ATA) is always a winner. I've heard they're currently making the third batch of this IPA that was originally supposed to be a limited release.

Now, you could stop just with the beer and be quite happy, but if you're hungry, you owe it to yourself to take a look at the food menu and grab a bite to eat. The kitchen is in the basement and the chef puts out some killer grub. Nope, no simple fried bar food here. Instead, you can get a great salad or a sandwich or even an entree that will go great with whatever you're drinking. 

I'm keeping this place on my radar.. I think they're gonna explode before too much longer in popularity and it'll be tough to get into.

I really want to like bryn and dane's because their concept is so great, but every time I go to any location I am disappointed. I agree wholeheartedly with some of the prior reviews expressing that this place delivers anything but FAST food. I went to the Bryn Mawr location for breakfast on a Sunday morning. The place was deserted and yet they still took about 20 minutes to make two egg wraps, one smoothie, and sweet potato hash. Totally unacceptable! No sense of urgency and overall, the staff seemed like they had no idea what they were doing. No greeting when I arrived and no apology when they took forever to make my order, looking like bewildered, incompetent idiots the whole time. Very frustrating and irritating experience, and I won't be back to the Bryn Mawr location ever again. They really need to work on training their employees and making sure they know how to make what is on the menu quickly. I don't think that's too much to ask.

Excellent service, reasonable prices, reliable. CP was referred to me by my daughter. Since then, I have used CP 3-4 times. I have never had an issue with an appointment being missed or late arrival. Communication and the  quality of the job done has always been stellar. I highly recommend Carpet Police.

Ordered 2 sides of naan only.  Arrived at restaurant 20 mins after order was placed.  Waited 10 mins for the bread to come out.  When I got home,  the bread was burnt on the outside but the spinach and cheese was cold inside.  Won't be back,  at least not for takeout.  Despite there only being  3 or 4 seated tables,  apparently they were too busy to simply put naan in the oven when I called it in ...  I wasn't the only person waiting for takeout either.

We had just spent all day at jazz fest, the four of us were exhausted from travel and festing.  T&T is near the house so after showers we walked down to find them closed.  We were 20 mins late.  As we are walking away/ making a new plan.  A lady opens the door and lets us in.  Open for us.  Holy cats!!! This never happens.  She did not bat an eye to our order and even let us bring our dog in.  We order 4 poboys and in a short time we were on our way.  The food amazing.  What a true gem in the neighborhood.

I saw Journey in concert here and it was pretty amazing. Was my first time here... would def come back. Nice arena, roomy, staff was ok. 

Funny, I dont know if it was reno or just this drunk guy that kept trying to pick a fight with me. 

Either way... had a great time... but it was probably mostly my company.

My boyfriend and I love this place for a low key dinner out. It's great when you can't decide where to go, because this place has everything! Literally the most extensive menu ever. Yes, it is often full of senior citizens, but I don't mind that lol! It tastes like home cooking and the portion sizes are large enough to get two meals out of it. 
Recommend getting the soups, any hot sandwiches and the strawberry cheesecake is to die for!

Had so much fun here while visiting my friend in SB!  Right on the pier and they have a deck with great views.  I love how they had different options for wine flights too.  Sat outside and enjoyed the view and some good vino.  Would come back!

Yeah I will never eat here again.. The burger was cooked just enough not to be totally rare like... ewww?! and they put stuff I specifically asked not to be on there! Not to mention I how I asked for my baked potato with sour cream and cheese amd bscon bits and it came totally naked and hard. I spent a lot of money for this food and ended up throwing it almost all away.

Don't hire! The owner can't even maintain his own schedule let alone keep bigger commitments...like your pool resurfacing!

Called to get a quote for a pool resurfacing. The owner, Mark called and gave me the whole schpeel on how he is on every site and blah blah blah blah. Mark made an appointment with me for a Sunday morning, his convenience and I obliged. Mark did not show up for the appointment. Mark did not call to say he was not going to show up. Mark did not call afterward to attempt to apologize or reschedule. Is this the type of owner you want on your job site??? Thanks for not showing, Sir!  Saved by your unprofessionalism!

If you read this same review on Google you will see the owner literally call me a liar...my caller ID has my business name...not my personal name. Google hasn't allowed me to post a screenshot of the INCOMING CALL from this shitty company and extra shitty owner who has attempted to cast shame onto me. Shame on YOU Marc!! Shame on you!

Couldn't be happier with the service I received. Quick delivery. Clean dumpster, and all the rules I needed to follow were made clear to me. I had my dumpster for a week and was able to fill it and call them on teh 6th day for removal.

Tender, fall off the bone ribs were top notch, and sides were solid!  Smokey Bandit BBQ has a good thing going and we enjoyed our bbq takeout!  Two platters gave us enough for dinner, leftovers for lunch, and still some ribs for snacking!
My first time trying both dishes because i saw them in a food competition show and i was not disappointed!! So good. literally nothing to complain about.

Wow.  I cannot believe it took me so long to find this place. Body Tech massage is a little therapeutic massage studio on Edmonton's South side located in a little strip mall. Walking in you already start to feel relaxed with their calming decor and comfy waiting room. The reception lady was super friendly and made you feel at ease. 

I did not have to wait long before my 30 minute massage with Janna. After a quick chat about problem areas she went to work on my chronically sore back and neck. It was amazing. She really targeted my painful areas without sending me crying which I find happens normally in my massages. The pressure was perfect and I could just feel my muscles melting.

My neck had the most pain and when she found the spots that were causing me all he trouble she did some trigger point stuff and I could literally feel the muscle just submit to her magic. I really left that appointment feeling more relaxed and euphoric than I had in a very long time. My head actually sat where it was supposed to as a bonus!

Amazing massage place that really can help you out even if you only have a half hour for an appointment. I cannot wait for my next appointment!

I've been here many times and I loved it. However I visited just recently and had the worst smoothie ever. It's a shame because they are so expensive and would like to at least receive consistent quality. A young girl clearly in training made my smoothie. It ended up being chunky and tasting only like coconut water. All for 9$!! I don't blame her though. Two girls who looked like they were supposed to be training her were standing in the back on their phones. One even came out and leaned on the counter scrolling through her phone. Sadly this has ruined all my good experiences at nektar and I don't think I will be back for a while.

Fresh ingredients executed to perfection! Great value as well. The oysters were amazing and not slimy at all, and the maki rolls were tasty! The eel was cooked to perfection. The biggest surprise was dessert, the fried dough was soft on the inside and crispy on the outside, and the chocolate sauce paired perfectly. Would highly recommend Umai Umai for a casual dinner with superb service and food. 5/5 overall.

A trip to Alpha Pizza is like going back in time to the 1970's!  Posters advertising an Elvis impersonator on Thursday nights adorn wood panel walls.  Mozzarella is liberally baked into the meals.  Pizza is good.  Greek specialties are better.  The baked Italian dinners are best avoided.  The dinner crowd sometimes looks like they just left a Trump rally.  Enjoy Elvis, a Greek salad, and the best people watching in town.

Great experience. The staff was wonderful. Loved Dr. Ronzo, he spent a tremendous amount of time explaining the procedure and expectations. My husband is doing great, surgery went smooth.  Thanks Doc!

I highly recommend Empire Today. I hired Empire to install vinyl plank on the entire first floor of my house along with vinyl tile in two bathrooms and carpet on the stairs and second floor hallway.  The installers were scheduled for four days and installation was completed as scheduled.  I received a call each morning indicating a window when the installers would arrive.   Each day they arrived on time.  The installers cleaned up the house very well each day.  I cannot say enough about how well all the flooring looks, the installers were very precise.  If you are looking for flooring, I recommend getting a quote from Empire.

This was my first In and Out experience and I'm so lucky I tried it out here!  The double double "animal style" was quite amazing and I think it was really wise that they're giving peppers (2-3 each) in individual plastic containers.  Overall, a solid burger priced appropriately meant to be good fast food.

My son had a membership and hadn't used it in 10 months as he was sent to prison in December.   Due to covid 19 by the time I realized  they were charging him per month still, everything had shut down .  After a couple of months I was finally able to speak with someone explained the situation and was told to send an email stating I was canceling his membership since I am in charge of his finances and bills now , and they wouldnt charge his account but it takes 30 days to go into effect .  Well it just so happens on the 30th day they charged his account 49.99 and when I called t hem they said its basically a cancelation charge but I was not told this when I spoke with the manager.  They had been taking money from his account since December 2019 and he hasn't even been there in the fitness center since oct.2019. Wow!! That's how they do business??? I will tell EVERYONE I know to NOT start a membership there as they are very wrong!!!!  They even charged him when they were closed due to covid 19!!! Sorry ass business!!!

So incredibly delicious! My husband and I never venture out and try new things, but our friends invited us to eat at Bakersfield and I'm so glad we got to! I got the carnitas taquitos and they were so good. Our friends got all kinds of tacos and they looked very impressive! 10/10, you should definitely try this out if you're ever downtown.

What an absolute wonderful office to deal with! All of the receptionists are fantastic, so kind and always go out of their way to assist you. Dr. Baratta is also an outstanding doctor! I highly recommend this dermatologist office! Thumbs up for having an outstanding staff. Wish I could put more than 5 stars!

What a neat little family and dog friendly area downtown Tampa! It feels like a festival all the time. Different food "trucks" lined up in old shipping containers. And at the end a Bowling alley with great food! Beer, wine, grassy area with corn hike boards. Shade umbrellas, and security for safety. Check it out!

Me and my wife stopped in for happy hour on Weds night @5:30. The place wasn't busy yet. We sat there for 20 mins before anyone came to our table. I ended up waiting 45 min to get a beer. The first beer I ordered  came after 15 mins of ordering it and it was flat. I took it up to the counter to let them know. The rude waitress told me to go sit down and they would pour me another beer. When I told her that I thought ther must be an issue with the keg. She repeated harshly for me to take a seat and they would pour me another of the same beer . I then went and found our actual waitress and told her I wanted a different beer. The other waitress came over and told her to pour me another of the same beer . Again telling me to go sit . We got our food and I tried the Caesar salad. The salad was drowning in dressing that  was like watered down mayonnaise. There was something in a small condiment cup that looked and tasted like it had been scraped off of the bottom of the fridge. Finally after 45 mins my beer was delivered to me. We had ordered the " special which was falafel plate .It  was deep fried to the point where it was hard to bite into. I opted not to eat any of the food . My wife was hungry so she nibbled at the gross food. I wanted to send it all back , pay for our drinks and leave but instead we left most of the food on our plates finished our drinks. Paid for the disgusting food and left a nice tip for the poor service. Not going back to this place . It's sad because we like the atmosphere and it has been fun taking friends from out of town there. Never again. Our actual waitress was nice and friendly and was juggling tables while the nasty waitress chatted with a table of friends , she also almost did a faceplant because of the inappropriate shoes she was wearing.
Very helpful vet.  Entertained my request even when I wasn't a customer.
Their chocolate caramel tart is to die for. Only go if you're craving sugar, because those tarts pack a powerful punch of deliciousness!

There are many landlords in Philadelphia, but Greenzang is easily the best I've ever encountered. I've lived with them for over five years. They offer great service--maintenance requests are handled quickly and efficiently. They are easy to work with and flexible. Heather, the property manger, is a gem. You can have your packages delivered to the management office and they will drop them off at your door--no Amazon boxes left outside. There's free wifi and they don't gouge you on rent increases. They own buildings throughout University City, Center City, and other Philadelphia neighborhoods. If you want to move to another location of theirs, you can do so without breaking your lease and they just transfer your security deposit and last month's rent. They invest in the apartments and take good care of them. Highly recommended.

Wow, we really like Kwok's for refined Chinese cuisine! The flavors in the dishes are distinct yet harmonious; the char on the rice noodles in the gravy chow fun come through and enhance the dish but do not overpower the delicate noodles and silky beef slices. The special greens (pea shoots when we went) were cooked perfectly, retaining their bright green color and a bit of crunch. 

When we first went, we were a little put off with the extra cost of rice and perhaps we ordered the wrong thing. But, after reading the rave reviews, we thought we'd give it another try, and I'm glad we did! Kwok's is a bit cozy, seating no more than 32. But, the food is definitely worth it!
I'm so sorry they closed!  I had only wonderful interactions with the owner, the facilities, and, of course, the flotations themselves.

So I had to come back and update my review after getting in to try some of this food......MY GOODNESS!!! I wanna curl up and just lay on the plate with the food! I'm from Atlanta but I promise, I'm coming to this place every time I'm in town.  I wish they could mail me some of the wings!!!! The women were very friendly even after I fussed before!!!!  Dope!!!
I love the variety of bagels they have. There's something for everyone. I try to come on Mondays  for the $7 Baker' s Dozen.

Tried Applebees again after a long hiatus due to bad service and I was reminded why I should never have gone back.  10 min wait to be seated, no big deal, but after we were seated, we weren't even acknowledged!  Not a single person came by to take our drink order or even to say they will be right back.  No manager in site, so we just left.  I have never done that before but more than 15 min waiting at the table is ridiculous.  People who came in after us had their drinks already.

With the poke bowl business becoming more abundant throughout Reno, it's difficult to pick a place! Bluefin stands out (at least out of the other poke bowl places I've been in) by having their regulars and large having an extra scoop of protein. For example, Poke King's regular is 3 scoops ($10.95), large - 5 scoops ($13.95). Whereas Bluefin offers 4 scoops for their regular ($11) and 6 scoops ($14) for their large! An extra scoop of seafood for the same price? Sure! My go-to sauce is always the spicy aioli with the unagi sauce. Their variety of toppings are for the most part pretty similar to other poke bowl joints. 

We've come here to Bluefin on a multiple of occasions; location being the main reason for we live close by. The service is fast and efficient and most of the time we come here for a poke bowl on the go to enjoy at home. 

Also, certain days they may have specials! This past Monday [6/25/18], they had a Unagi Bowl where unagi was the protein of choice with pre-set toppings. 

The fish is good and reminds me of home. Coming from Hawaii, poke bowls are addicting and to have a couple of restaurants in Reno is great to have! It's no place like home, but it's pretty damn close. 
I'm no taste expert to what's fresh versus what is frozen, but as long as my taste buds don't taste anything too fishy then I give my seal of approval. 

We'll always be back here whenever we have our poke bowl on-the-go cravings.

There is a reason this place is called Dan Dan! The Dan Dan noodles here are a must try! The food was all delicious, including my pumpkin seafood tofu soup, and the blackened string beans! I would recommend all of the above and more. The only item my friends did not enjoy was the Kung Pao Tofu, which I didn't get to try, but it didn't look as flavorful. But overall, the service was fast, friendly, and kind. The place was a bit packed, but clean and could accommodate a reservation with a larger group (we had 8). I recommend being on time for your reservation because they only hold a 10-15 min grace period, and are VERY busy. I definitely recommend trying Dan Dan-- don't forget to get the noodles!

Had a hankering for some kalbi and nengmyun after a hot hot eagles game. The food is not bad it's on par with the surrounding Korean restaurants in the area. Their service game is lacking though, we pretty much had to ask for everything and there was no smile or any warmth with the service. It's kinda off putting when you're eating and you have to ask for simple things constantly with a cold ok. I felt like I was bothering my server and usually I don't mind if my server isn't very talkative but this was more like she was not wanting to be there. Oh well maybe it was a bad day. Regardless if you're in the area it's not a bad place to get food just don't expect exceptional service.
Well I did try to order from here. But they don't take credit cards. Which is a big thumbs down for me :(

The people are so nice here. 


The food is consistent, and I always know what I'm getting when I come in. It's quick and convenient good for the price!

Overpriced tourist food. If you want overpriced overcooked meats with boiled vegetables, salads drowning in dressing to the point of inedibility, a waitstaff completely unfamiliar with dishes and drinks, all under the guise of "fine dining" then come on down! Worst meal I've had in the city.
This is a favorite for birthday dinners or special events. Entertainment and dinner all in one. Food is delicious and huge servings, come hungry.

My husband and I stopped into Flipper's last night to sample there pizza. We just moved down to the area from Long Island NY and we are vey familiar with "NY PIZZA". We ordered the cheese bread and medium size pepperoni pizza. We were pleasantly surprised with both items. The crust was not too dense and very fresh. As soon as we sat down we were greeted by "Grant" who was extremely friendly and offered many suggestions being that we we first timers at Flipper's. They also have happy hour specials on wine, and craft beers. It truly was an enjoyable experience!! Thanks again Grant!!

As a long-time fan of Restaurant BT and impeccable Chef BT, I was initially a little skeptical of this casual "to go" concept. But I have now enjoyed several lovely meals at BT to Go, and everything has been terrific.  This is a great spot for a quick bite, or a lite lunch, or some healthier alternatives to take on the boat. My favorites are the bahn mi sandwiches and the chicken cabbage salad. Teas are good, as well as wonderful fresh rolls, what more could you ask for? This place is fabulous.... Thank you, Chef BT, we love you and really love your food.

I'd give them a 0 if I could. The owners were completely rude and asked us to wait outside in the cold with a 5 month old baby. We opted to leave and go to Sitar instead where they are very family friendly.

I ordered take out even though everyone had pointed out how terrible their customer service is. They were nice in my opinion, placing the order and picking up the order there really weren't any problems. the food was what i had a trouble with, I order Pho Ga, it just felt like something was missing in it... not sure what but there was an overpowering taste of star anise and cloves in it which was a big turn off... also when they gave me condiments, they put siracha (even though i asked for chili sauce that had the flakes) and hoisin sauce all in the same container so it was mixed together and it just didn't help at all. so for me the service was good but the food was okay.

El Vez never fails to impress. This place seems to be crowded all the time, but we were able to get a seat at the bar and have a margarita before dinner. The margaritas were excellent. I had The Perfecto up with salt and my wife had the El Vez up with agave instead of triple sec. Both of them were very tasty. Bartenders could be a tad more attentive and have a semblance of a smile versus the "I don't want to be here" face. All in all, we received what we expected. Always a nice experience at El Vez.

Recently I was sent some flowers from Cerise Floral Studio.  The arrangement arrived and was absolutely beautiful, and very fitting for fall.
