The arrangement was contained in a glass vase, which was within a birch bark vase, and included sunflowers, tulips, roses, and lots of unique decorative greenery.  

Unfortunately, the next morning when I got to work the flowers were mostly dead, and when I looked in the vase there was no water.  I called Cerise immediately when they opened, and they were apologetic and offered to deliver a new bouquet later that day.  There were really no questions asked, and I was happy that they were willing to re-deliver since my office location is a significant distance from their shop.

When the new flowers arrived, the bouquet wasn't quite the same and not quite as nice, and a note was left for me not to leave the flowers near the heating vent.  I think I was being blamed for why the flowers were dead- little did they know that the heaters were actually broken the previous day, and thus they flowers were not overheated!!  I think the no-water situation was probably the root cause of the dead flowers.

Overall, I am happy with the quick and easy response from Cerise, and I would probably use their services if I needed to order a modern arrangement in the future,.

I brought in 2 robes to have "mother of bride" and mother of groom put on the back, along with their respective initial on the front. To my dismay, when I gave them as gifts, they mixed up the initials. I emailed them to discuss the issue and have not gotten a response in over 4 days. 

Do not do business with them.

Wow! We have been wanting to try LuLou's for a number of years now, for a special occasion since it is so expensive...so we went for our anniversary this past Saturday. Wow, again...everything was excellent from the beautiful but trendy/hip/chic/mighty cool decor to the wait staff and most especially the food! Sezmu used to be my fav restaurant in Reno, but sadly they recently closed. 4th St. Bistro is really excellent, too, but something about this place....is making it my new fav. Too bad it is so expensive or I might drive down to "Draino" more often to eat here!  Since we had some martinis at Roxy (gotta love their happy hour) prior to dinner, we skipped wine with our meal here. For starters: I had the chile "relleno" (1/2 of a pasilla chile - at least I think it was a Pasilla - stuffed with tempura FL rock shrimp and served with a citrus salad), which was spicy and incredible tasting. I especially enjoyed the citrus flavors with the spice of the chile and the crunch of the shrimp! YUM! My husband had the Baked Lobster, served escargot-style. I tasted that, as well, and it was also very flavorful. For mains: I had the BBQ'd Quail with harissa sauce, a lovely spring succotash, and a truffle mac & cheese that was to die for - in fact my husband finished mine off! My husband had the veal tenderloin for his main dish, and while it, too, was wonderful, I was on a spicy kick that night - so I liked my spicy choices better!  Can't wait until next year's anniversary to return and try some new things on their ever-changing menu. They don't have a website or an online menu, but if you call them and ask them to fax you a menu, they will.
Place is good for drinks.Kieran is clueless by best.Wouldn`t come back to this place again.

Since we were new to the area and it was our first day at the Madeira Beach.  We went to Yelp to find a place.  The Boardwalk Grill had amazing reviews, so we decided to check it out.  We were not disappointed. Great very friendly service.  AMAZING FOOD.  Decent Beer selection (has local options).   I highly recommend the Fish and Chips, Grouper Sandwich, Onion rings.

The people who work here are so friendly, and they have a great selection of organic food! The menu can be a bit confusing as to what is actually vegan and what is not, but the food is delicious. Only thing that is a bit off is the fact that they sometimes run out of a lot of things and also don't appear to be well maintained when it comes to cleaning unfortunately. However the food is still amazing and the people working there always try and help you out.

Such a nice theater. Clean comfortable. Reclining leather seats... Love this place!
Prices are awesome! You can buy beer, wine that I think is a little pricey, but their sodas and snacks are good priced! Free refills on large popcorn and soda!

I have been to west Keg (with wife/friends/coworkers.. always looking for an excuse) many times and always enjoy the delicious bacon wrapped scallops,  perfectly cooked and seasoned steaks, decent wine selection, and the incredible atmosphere created by the venue and staff.  Easily the best place I have been in town for steak.

In a town where BBQ seems to start and end with pulled pork, Jacks stands out from the rest (and has on Broadway since 1994.)

They say it is "pit to plate"  and I believe it because the meats are flavorful and smoky. A no-frills kind of place in the middle of the broadway strip, you will experiance the whole spectrum of Nashville; from the Woooo girls out on a bachelorette party, to the hungover honkeytonk cowboy about to start his next no pay gig around the corner, it is an event just walking in the door. 

It's not the best BBQ in the world, but if you can stand the line it's a best bet in Nashville.

Me and my friends went to this nice Cafe down on 4th Ave in Tucson. Once we paid they made the Crepes right next to the register so you can see the process. The cashier was also really nice in explaining everything to us since it was our first time in this cafe.

While we waited They had a few board games to let the customers play at their tables which was really nice. Out of the 4 people in our group, we got two breakfast crepes, and 2 desserts, and they were well worth the visit.

EDIT: I forgot to mention. The portions are huge. As you can see from the photos, you do get your money worth,

If you are near any other Steak 'n Shake go to it. This one has really gone down on service and cleanliness. The sign said "Please wait to be seated" so we waited five minutes for someone to come and give us a table. We then waited for fifteen minutes for someone to come to our table to take our order along with a drink order. We never did get any water. 

He ordered a steak burger with thousand island dressing on it. I ordered chili Mac with a steak burger with mustard and onion.   Of course his burger had no dressing on it. My steak burger with onion was laughable.  It had one piece of onion on it. NO, NO!!  Not a slice of onion - one piece of onion. After waiting a while for our food, we were not about to complain about anything and have it taken away to get it fixed. 

As we paid our bill at the counter, we both looked at the floor behind it and it was horrid. French fries and trash all over the floor. I'm amazed no worker slipped and fell. 

Would I come back here?  No, I'll go the extra miles to the one on Hampton Avenue. I won't catch you on the flip side here.

5 stars for fresh pressed juice. There were so many different kinds and they are all delicious. If I lived here I would be a part of their rewards program. The girl working was friendly and have some good recommendations.
OMG. This is an awesome place. It was my first time have a cheese steak and I'm glad I went here. I got the large cheese steak hogie and I'm very pleased.

I am in Nashville for a bachelorette party. My flight arrived a good four hours before everyone else and I decided to check out Five Points for a few hours. I was told by Uber driver that we were going to the 'hipster' part of town - East Nashville, and according to Yelp, he also dropped me off at the most hip coffee place in the city. Thank god I didn't wash my hair today and chose to wear a black wide brimmed flimsy hat and combat boots (seriously). 

For what this place has to offer, it does its job well. Great coffee, and a good place to read or laptop browse for a few hours. I would say this isn't the best place is you're looking to study intently- People watching is distracting and in general there are no nooks or crannies that you can stick yourself in to have some privacy. 

It is great for what it is- a little hide away to grab some coffee to start your morning and do some reading with a generally quiet crowd that keeps to itself. The baristas weren't assholes to me but maybe it was my hat that helped me blend in ;)
Amazing hospitality. Evacuated here during Hurricane Irma.  The staff were the kindest to my stressed out family. I have been totally impressed with everything.

We got there on a $10 steak and jazz/blues night. Everything was delicious. I believe they were a little understaffed that night, so it took a long time to get our food. Also, our waitress rarely showed up to check up on us. Other than that, the steak was delicious. 

You guys should definitely try the crab and shrimp dip. It's to die for!

Top notch local food!  If you like hole in the wall restaurants with fresh local food, this is your place.  Super veggie and meat entree options.  Unique food and drink combinations.  Highly recommend & I eat out a ton! Small restaurant with limited seating. Worth the wait.

Sunday afternoon five of us decided to try this restaurant for the first time. Several of the group had one had homemade Indian another had never had eaten Indian, two were very familiar with Indian. We opted for the buffet, that had multiple options, to include butter chicken, tandoori chicken, Nana, 2 rice options, desert, salad, and other dishes I can't name. Service excellent. Waiters refilled drinks, brought extra Nan. We all loved it! One of our party was 88 years old and a work traveler. He said he will be back. This is a hidden Indian gem in Oldsmar.

I'm never disappointed when I come to Tierra. The portions are huge and the food always tasty. The service can be a bit slow once it's time for your check so don't go when you're in a rush. Some delicious plates I've had have been: avocado and mango salad with either chicken, churrasco steak or salmon (all delish), mofongo, sampler platter, Cuban sandwich, medianoche sandwich, garlic shrimp, churrasco/skirt steak with sides, fruit drinks, breakfast platters and more. Come with an appetite and be satisfied.

I'm kind of shocked this place has such bad reviews. I decided to give them a try because of how close they are to my house, and I've had nothing but positive experiences. I've been using them for a few weeks now for winter coats, my husbands suits and clothes, and everything has come back looking wonderful. Especially the suits, which were a crumpled up mess from a recent move. They do seem a bit more expensive, but nothing crazy, and the convenience of being right next to my grocery store makes the extra cost worth it. I will continue to use them for all my dry cleaning needs!
Really enjoyed dinner Friday night and they have live music. Very underrated place and would definitely go back.

So how do you tell the story of a building that houses multiple venues for todays varied performers, performances and audiences, that was originally constructed over 100 years ago?

In my best Elmer Fudd, verwyyyy carefuwyyyy, hahahahahah! So pay attention and I'll tell you the story you've longed to hear.

It was 28 Feb, 1910 when the Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine replete with Potentates, Nobles and Ladies, opened the state-of-the-art Murat Theater within the Murat Temple at the corner of E Michigan and N New Jersey streets.

The Indy Shriners named the ornate building, complete with Islamic, Arabic and Egyptian architecture, after Joachim Murat (Mur-ah), a general serving Napoleon in Italy and Egypt back in the day.

The original theater of those Potentates, Nobles and Ladies, the venue that so many of todays theater goers love to hate, has had the Indianapolis Symphony and Indianapolis Opera Company call its original 1,950 seats home over the years.

But wait say you, todays' web-o-matic says there are 2,600 seats in that space. S'up wit dat?!? So this is where the pissing and moaning starts!

In '95 the Indy Shriners saw income decreasing and refurbish costs skyrocketing so in an attempt to stop the madness, they struck a deal with Sunshine Promotions, todays Live Nation. A-HA!

Now I wasn't there, but i imagine it could have gone something like this...
"Tell yous what...yous guys pony up da dough for da fixes and we's 'ill give yous a 99 year lease... AND yous can even jam in anudder 600 or so's chairs... AND charge des mooks anudder saw-buck just fur da prillage ta buys a ticket.  What say's yous?!?

Well, maybe not like that but you get the picture.  Money was tight and this was a way to save a truly historic theater! Give and take and... get took so to speak.

As Pharaoh said in the days of Yule Brenner... So let it be written, so let it be done!

And all that, brings us today, to reviews with "bad sight lines, big heads in the way, narrow seats, no leg room, no slope, poor acoustics, bad signage, expensive booze, steep stairs to long pee lines, crowded intermissions, chaotic clustersf*@!"(wow that IS harsh) and finally...neanderthal patrons who can't tell time or understand the words "your, don't, electronic, turn, talk, off and device" no matter how they are arranged and regardless of punctuation!?!

And now for the the other side.  After 2 decades of supporting this venue and its myriad of shows and performances from Widespread Panic to Radio City Music Hall's Rockettes High Kick'en Christmas Extravaganza with live Camels to Little Feat post Lowell George, to Friday nights' Book of Mormon and all things in-between, you too can survive the FUBAR.

1. Always GO EARLY to the Murat box office to buy your tickets.  You'd be surprised at how helpful the underpaid ticket person can be.
2. Save your pennies (actually fives or tens would be better) and buy the best tixs you can afford for Broadway Touring shows. From an acoustic and visual standpoint shoot for something in the center section (orchestra) at least 15 rows back and no further back than EE under the balcony or on either side in the first 10 seats off the inside aisles.  Believe it or not the seats are in fact offset just a little in each row and yes there is a gentle slope to the stage almost the entire length of the theater on the main floor.
3. The Balcony is also not a bad way to go. In the upper air, look for the first 15 rows with the same rules off to the sides as the main floor.
4. Yes, seats are narrow, check your coat, and loose some weight lard butt.
5. Yes, leg room is airline like. Deal with it and stand up when someone needs to get by...be a human being!
6. Yes your first experience with this theater can be confusing, but if you arrive early, take your time, you should be able to figure it out.  There are signs and arrows, kinda like driving a car, not rocket science.
7. Don't buy the overpriced watered down hootch and you won't have to piss and moan about pissing and moaning in long lines at intermission thus avoiding chaotic clusterf*@!(wow that IS harsh). Heck, I'm the poster boy for an AA ad and even i can go without for a couple hours.
8. If, like me, you suffer from WMD (think about it, short and slow), all you can do is pray to the higher power of your choice that no NBA player taller than Muggsy Bogues sits in front of you, cause if you get two NFL Jeff Saturdays side by side, you ain't see'en much.  I don't care what venue you're in, you can just Listen to the Music.
9. As for the Neanderthals, you know, i hate to say it but, i beleive it has gotten worse over the years.  The only thing you can do is call them on their inappropriate behavior from incessant talking to the ubiquitous cell phone fumbling.  Call em fast and call em often, just don't call em on your phone, no pun intended.
10. Finally, when you go to the Murat, go in Steely Dan style, do it with your Fez on!

My absolute favourite thing to get from the Duchess is their Coconut Cream Pie. Best coconut cream pie I have ever had. After eating anything from the Duchess, anything from a grocery store bakery doesn't cut it anymore. I don't even like macarons but the ones from here are my only exception. I always get the pastries to go, though -- it's way too crowded in there usually. That isn't something I would take a star off for, though.

Tex-Mex fast food, chain store variety. That being said, it's typically pretty good considering its chain store fast food. For the love of God, get rid of the corporate mandate making employees yell "welcome to moes" every time somebody walks in the door.
James was awesome and the food was fabulous. I had a great meal and the frog legs was a great appetizer. Definitely will eat here again when I come back to town.

Great Gyro- ask for the sauce on the side. They put way to much on the Gyro for my taste... great mid-day stop- has a nice St. Louis feel... 
Side note- cross the street at your own risk! McCausand traffic stops for no man or red light for that matter...

5 out of 5 for the one and only Wayne Gretzky, the epitome of Canadian hockey! No better way to remember this guy than constantly seeing his life size replica outside of Rexall place everytime I go cheer on the Oilers!

Well, whaddya know? They have paint, nails, gardening stuff, key making--pretty much all the stuff you're looking for in a hardware store, and best of all for the super-urban/ heart of the city dwellers: in your back yard. 

It's a bit spendier, as you might imagine, but think what you're saving on gas from a schlep to the nomansland burbs!
Nondescript lobby restaurant in the Embassy Suites but don't let that stop you. Good beer selection, lots of grilled cheese sandwich varieties, several other things on the menu as well.

Great two hour tour. Our guide, Lucy, was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic, keeping our energy up despite the unseasonably cold temperatures. We got to see lots of historic corners of the French quarter and deepen our knowledge of the area.

Had the whole pig banh mi and the brisket. Both were delicious. Friendly folks. Small seating area inside. Since it's so close to Masterman HS avoid going in right when school lets out due to crowds. About 20 hungry teenagers descended on the place directly after (thankfully) I ordered. Definitely will be coming back here!

Stopped in for a couple of brunch drinks and a quick bite. 

A beer and what was essentially baklava for me and a sangria and omelette for the lady.

The baklava was sweet with a bacon interior. It is a small appetizer, only enough to tide me over. The omelette however was hearty and full of flavor. The atmosphere was friendly and there is a nice dried flower decoration around the bar area. Interesting enough for me.

I am amazed that JMH has anything above 2 stars. They are the most ridiculous company to deal with. I'd prefer not to develop a brain tumor going over everything they do to annoy me, so I will pick some things out.

When you move in, any landlord is required to paint the apartment, and they specialize in slopping on a thick layer over absolutely everything. Because of this, your windows won't open correctly, any door hinge is slathered over and seized up, and there are white paint drips over every surface. We have had leaks which is understandable, but instead of actually fixing the problem and removing any mold, they bring a man over to paint over everything. Our apartment has exposed brick and because the building is so old, some of the bricks tend to crumble. Instead of maybe attempting to replace a brick here and there, they decide to swiftly paint over the whole thing. I like to joke that they will use paint to fix any problem; clogged drain, lockouts, or late rent is no match for a fresh coat of white glop! We had problems where maintenance people needed to fix something and instead of letting us know in advance when they were coming, one of us would happen to catch a random stranger in our house snooping around. They did that a few times saying it is too difficult for them to let us know when someone would come, but I would remind them that what they were dong was illegal. Now, the threat of calling 911 on their men is the only thing keeping them away. 

I really don't want to get into the Fairmount office staff. The two women are very unorganized at what they are responsible for; I would constantly get phone calls to my cell asking to speak to my roommate or to remind my roommate of something. When it is only those two in there, you have to wait until they are finished talking to a friend on their cell phone or until they are done reading something on their facebook wall. If they need to write a note about your apartment or lease (like my roommate's phone number) they will pull out your lease file and scribble it into the margins of your lease which is something my cat would think is logical. The office manager is bipolar at best. He will want to kiss your feet one day and the next he is tearing up papers and throwing them in your face. I don't really have much interaction with the assistant dude. He sends you a monthly newsletter to inform you about things like clogs or frozen pipes, but they use it as an opportunity to TELL YOU IN ALL CAPS HOW THEY WILL FINANCIALLY MOLEST YOU IF YOU DO ANYTHING THAT THEY JUST SAID NOT TO DO IN THE NEWSLETTER. 


You really can't avoid them if you are looking for an apartment in the Art Museum area. If you're looking for a cheap place, you definitely get what you pay for. Just hope and pray you don't need to coordinate with them about a problem.

When I moved out, the deposit check they sent me bounced which is just hilarious.

I moved to the area about 6 years ago and I've visited quite a few nail salons - some good, some not so good. I've always gotten acrylics. 

I came to see Ty for my first set of SNS dipped nails. He works alone and by appointment only, so you're sure to get attentive care. No waiting. His booth is cozy and inviting. Ty is very easy to talk to. He takes great pride in his work and you can tell he truly enjoys what he does. 

I was beyond happy with my experience at Lavish Nails and will be back!

Most disgusting place I've been to! Very very dirty! The container the coffee creamer was in was so dirty inside! The coffee cup was also dirty inside! Food came cold & the chicken salad sandwich was sour!! The walls, ceiling & all the vents in the restaurant are caked with decades of dust & dirt! I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like! Gross! The owner should take pride in his/her business & clean thing up! If this place is voted best in New Orleans, than were in trouble!!

Jamie Slone Wines provides a wonderful wine tasting experience...amazing wines, warm and hospitable service and beautiful, welcoming environment. From the first wine we tasted to the last, we were very impressed. We can't recommend their wines enough. We had been up in Santa Barbara for a dinner party, and stopped by for a tasting. We decided to bring a couple of bottles with us to white dinner-which became the hit of the evening!  
Be sure and visit Jamie Slone when you are in Santa Barbara....you will love the experience and return again and again!

Great food! I'm so shocked by these other reviewers' low scores. I got the Salmon Benedict and it was EXCELLENT. 

The only turn off at this restaurant was the rather cold hostess. Our waiter was excellent however! I forget his name but he was an older gentlemen with excellent service. For example, he saw us trying to take a selfie and offered to take the photo for us!

Figure out your auxiliary staff's cold demeanor and you've basically got it made! Will return.

Great place for overnight camping even if it's just for one day. The staff here is very accommodating when we needed ice last minute they brought it right to our campsite.
We went for a kayak ride and they have everything there on site you can rent a kayak in the right from the campsite.
The showers and bathrooms here are very clean you can tell they take care of the grounds.
The night we went they had an open mic and a band play as well as fire pits and good food for sale.
They also have different types of excursions which we are going to try out next time such as night kayaking and more!
The campground is very close to the state park you can kayak there and then take a walk in the park or you can drive there it's a very short drive.

There literally aren't words to describe how  amazing my experience was at Southern Swings!

We we're celebrating a life event for a girlfriend and we settled on the deluxe pedicure (totally worth it) and a full set.

The pedicure was *amazing*. I chose a chocolate mask and my girl gave me the gresatest massage! My polish was flawless, and the owner Brandy came over to personally deliver us a complimentary glass of champagne. Sitting in a swing was so fun and really enhanced the experience.

While I loved my pedicure, my nails sealed my love! I am an individual who actively rips and chews at my nails and as such, is very embarrassed by my nails. Lana made me feel beautiful and designed for me the most beautiful nails I've ever had! She was so kind and professional and I left the salon feeling like a princess!

Go visit Brandy at Southern Spa! Ask for Lana. You won't be disappointed!!!
Great bagels and chicken soup. Luv the pickle bar and cold sides offered through the deli. Haven't tried a deli sandwich but looks respectable with enuf cold cuts to make 2 sandwiches.

I stayed in philly for a few weeks while visiting friends. I found this hotel to be near a majority of things and stayed here. The hotel and its staff are incredible. Very well built, customer service was incredible. The only issue is the temperature in the room, I live in California and understand it would be cold, but my gosh! My room felt like the Arctic.  They room heating/cooling system is on a timer that shuts off constantly so my room was never warm enough.

I've been telling everyone Im staying at the NorthPole, feels like it!
Been here many times and never been disappointed. Great food and beer selection. Many different options of seating. Staff very friendly and constantly asking if we were satisfied.

I have been coming to this Palm Harbor Sweet Tomatoes for about  3 1/2 years.  The salads are always fresh, bins are always full, the bread is fresh and warm, the soups are worth trying, although there are only a couple that I truly like.  The prepared Ceasar and Wonton Happiness are both very good.  The staff is friendly and always willing to help.  I would have given it 5 stars but the parking lot at dinner time is horrendous.  So difficult to get a spot and when we are in season...fuggetaboudit.  Considering the money this chain takes in, and the fact that this is is the best Sweet Tomatoes in the area, they should invest in redoing the parking lot before next snowbird season.

Hidden gem is correct! Breakfast was awesome. I had a ny bagel with egg, cheese and fresh spinach. My girlfriend  had the breakfast burrito. We found both extremely delicious! The customer service was great, we even got a hug from April. I highly recommend hard to find this kind of comfort in St Pete.

If you want to have a good time out with your friends this is an awesome place to go. The food on the other hand was a different story. I had the ribs and they were dry and very charred. I couldn't finish them. The side items included macaroni and cheese, collard greens, and slaw. I was not impressed with any of these. All were flavorless and the greens weren't fresh at all. It was like they were taken right out of can and put on my plate. I will give them refit for the presentation of the meal. It was spot on. The staff was friendly and overall I had a great time there. I will go back just to hang out and enjoy the music with friends but I don't think I'll eat there.

I just had one of the best bagel and lox sandwiches ever. The rye bagel was crunchy and the balance of cream cheese to everything else was perfect. Great lox. My husband's whitefish salad sandwich was equally amazing. I am not a big fan of whitefish, but this was great and I kept stealing bites...very casual but warm and situated on a nice city corner.

One of my go to favorites.  Brisket  sandwich is my first choice. Try the salmon. So moist and tasty. Best I've ever had. Lots of food. Staff is so friendly.  They go out of their  way to make sure your taken care of. Nice to go where you can see memorabilia  of people who fight for our freedom and save lives making us safe in public.

The food is great but the service is exceptional! We walked in and we're greeted with smiles and positive energy! The hostess was so welcoming! She introduced herself as Bekah but she was such a fun hostess that by the end of the interaction, we had nicknamed her "Beks!" Our server was awesome as well as the food! 10/10 experience!

The smallest portion we ever had at any chipotle's
We wont be back to this one
The employees were rude when I commented about our very small salads
Love the different pizza's they offer. Great service, and great pizza. Won't go anywhere else now.

Great food? No. Good food in a hurry? Depends on what you order on the menu. I like that they will actually make something extra garlic or extra spicy, rather than giving lip service. It is the best take out Chinese in Bellevue, although that is not saying a lot.

Personally, I like their szechuan beef and garlic chicken combos. Both come with an eggroll and pork fried rice. And both are around $7 - $8 (in 2014), which is reasonable.

And to Scott G (yes, I know him), this is hole in the wall take out Chinese. :-)

Love this place! Everything is clean and the nail polish selection is great. This is the only nail salon I will go to get the gel polish. I recommend Tammy, she's quick, talks to you, and always remembers your name!

Highly recommended for a weekend brunch date! Trendy atmosphere, not too crowded, attentive service, fresh ingredients and overall great meal!  First of all the Bloody Mary was amazing. Spiced just like I love it. I had the short rib hash. The ingredients were very fresh, I highly recommend this dish. Let me turn this over to my beautiful GF to describe her dish. :) I ordered the breakfast sandwich. Brioche bun, avocado, egg, bacon, with a side salad-what more could you want?!  Go here for brunch!!
We went here for our 9 yr wedding anniversary. The views are beautiful, the food was very good, the service was great!

Fantastic!  First off, it's a great venue.  This place has been there for 50+ years but the inside is fresh and open.  The service is super, very attentive with the coffee and water.  The pancakes are the stars.  So many choices, went with the Georgia peach.  My advice, just get the pancakes. No need for eggs or sausage, you'll be full before you're done.

The pancakes are just right, not too heavy and plenty of flavor.  No need for syrup on these, they're plenty sweet as is.

I had heard stories about long lines getting into the place.  I guess we were lucky because we walked right in.  It was about 1pm so that's probably a good time to go.

What an amazing experience Darin and his team provided! From the first phone call, we knew we went with the right company. We used Jump On The School Bus for transportation/wedding reception fun. The bus took us to all the awesome wineries/breweries in Carpinteria and Santa Barbara. Darin set up the plan and our bus driver -unfortunately three months later I can't remember his name :( but he was amazing!!! - took the party and ran with it. He was so responsive to the vibe of the bus and kept the perfect pace for bar hopping. I would recommend this company to anyone and everyone. Worth every penny spent!!!
Not a museum, more like an indoor playground, very misleading, and 15 dollars for adults.

Markley St, Norristown, PA
Great service and drive thru. And a cute Indian guy took my order. You know why people like chains? Because they know what they want n dont need to think too hard or make a decision over small things like coffee and dont need to be too surprised as they know what to expect. Thats why chains typically do well. People dont always have the energy to figure out if a store is selling something they want when they are out shopping and get exhausted and need to fuel up their bodies. By the way...the Decaff was a tad bit sweet. I just needed something hot. Usually dont like that much sugar in my decaff.

Definitely the trendiest-looking Vietnamese restaurant I have ever dined in. You can tell it's not your usual pho spot when you walk in and there's no smell of fish sauce lingering around. 

My group decided to let me choose my post-Broad Street Run brunch. I asked them how Le Viet's Cafe Sua Da is and it took no further discussion. After twenty minutes of circling the blocks around Le Viet, we found parking (thank Buddha, I was starving). The restaurant wasn't too busy for a Sunday during brunch hour. Worked out well for us and we were seated right away.

Since I knew I was going to be gorging at some type of buffet in the evening as my BSR reward to myself, I opted for small items. I ordered Goi Cuon, Banh Xeo, and a Cafe Sua Da. Little did I know, the appetizers were not small at all. The Goi Cuon was stuffed with noodles, a little too much in my opinion. But the dipping sauce was delicious.

The size of the Banh Xeo was on a different level. It was probably the size of a cheesesteak! Unlike traditional restaurants that overfill the Vietnamese crepe with bean sprouts, this one had a lot of pork and shrimp, very tasty. Beware, the dish is served with a tremendous amount of vegetables that you will probably not finish.

My Vietnamese iced coffee finally arrived after my meal was almost finished. Not sure what took so long, but the server apologized. It was ready to drink in a plastic cup with a straw, no drip cup necessary.

Good company and good food helped ease the soreness from running ten miles, until I had to get up. I had a good experience at Le Viet and will be back soon!

If you don't like snake and jakes I probably won't like you.

I live a block from here so k find myself here a lot. It's a dive bar, obviously but it's just dicey enough that it feels cool. The couch is a little gross but I've spent many a night there with $3 vodka crans.

The decor is weird in a cool way and I personally want to find a way to obtain the giant Santa light up

Busy, busy. busy. They get lots of business and should probably have more people staffed to work the floor as it gets MESSY. There was a line to get to the toppings bar, and some of the topping spoons were "double dipped" into other topping containers (my pet peeve). I wish someone was actively responsible for maintaining this area and also refilling! I don't want to top my yogurt with goodies I had to SCRAPE out from the bottom of the container. Also, I noticed some of the flavors here at this location had a bit of a watery texture.. so I avoided those ones. 

Nonetheless, I love love love froyo and was by no means dissatisfied with my creation.

The menu reads really interesting, some really interesting sandwich concepts, but they don't eat like they read. The sandwich ideas are awesome, the execution on them just doesn't hold up. Regular deli turkey on the turkey sandwich? It says citrus sous vide, but I don't taste it. Maybe I was expecting something more, but I wasn't expecting regular old deli meat at this sort of craft style sandwich shop. Maybe I came in with incorrect expectations of what Tasso was going to be. The bread, and let me preface this by saying LOVE crusty baguettes, was hard to eat. This bread would be perfect with some soup, but not in a sandwich. The roof of my mouth was destroyed after the sandwich, but r takes more than that to get me to put down a sandwich so I continued.. The rest of the toppings were good, but nothing amazing. The pickle was drastically, like somebody messed up on the amounts of the brine, salty.. so much that I couldn't even eat it. The side of mojito cucumber salad was plain and boring and not seasoned at all. Somebody forgot the seasoning or vinaigrette. Wasted 4.00 on that side, I took one bite and just put it to the side. Thankfully.. the meal was saved by the cheapest, insignificant addition to the meal, the popcorn. The popcorn (self serve) was great. I'm guessing curry or garam masala is the spice, but it's a great snack to have with a sandwich. 

I hope they work on the execution in the kitchen and shore up some of the recipes, I'd love to come back and try a different sandwich! They do read well, I hope some of the others have a bit better execution.

This han dynasty location was the worst location I have been to. I will probably order again but for take out only. The wontons in chili sauce is my favorite appetizer and I thought it was missing it's usual spice as well as flavor. I will order from this location again hoping it was an off day, but after that.....we will see. My entree was delicious however when I get rice I have never been charged extra for asking for more. I didn't enjoy drinking our of plastic cups, the decor was odd, the bathroom was odd and I had to put r he toilet seat down in the shared bathroom.and.avoid stepping on pee. Overall, this location has a lot to improve upon to be more like the other locations. This location is so close to my home, but fo.my.next dine in experience, I will be going back to the university city location.
Just moved here and have only used them a few times but so far I am really pleased.

Great diner-esque food with a huge pastry bakery case up front. My friend and I were getting hungry and I've seen signs all over for Ponzio's and thought it would be a great time to check it out.

Our first server was a little..odd. But she had to leave half-way through and the next server was ok, but she was semi staring at us once in awhile. This was about 5pm on a Saturday and it was packed. 

To start out, the green bean fries were tasty and the philly cheesesteak spring rolls were super hot, crispy and flavorful. Being as hungry as I was, and knowing I can't actually eat that much I wanted something I could easily heat up the next day as well. Answer- chicken parm with a side of angel hair pasta. Huge portion! Everything was cooked perfectly with a really nice tomato sauce. My friend got a Reuben and loved every bite.  

The menu was large with a copious amount of options. I was deciding between shrimp scampi, strip steak, blackened chicken wrap.. I was on the point of being hangry, but the chicken parm hit the spot.

This restaurant was absolutely delightful; From the creative art and style to the mouthwatering alligator and sausage cheesecake. OMG. Our waiter and the staff was on top of keeping our table clean, drinks full, and all of them were friendly and inviting. We shared an entree which was the perfect amount of food for us. Very rich but so great! Loved the atmosphere here and will definitely recommend this restaurant to all!!

Went here for drinks after Commanders and it was great! The drinks were crafted very well with slight variations on originals with their own unique flair. The bartender was extremely welcoming and the whole interior has a wonderful atmosphere. We had the deviled egg trio which was good as well. Our favorite was the duck and our least favorite was the salmon. With a drip of hollandaise the salmon would be out of this world. 

5stars for drinks and service and atmosphere

I had a reservation last night with my friend at 7:30 pm. I got there at 6:45 and asked the lady if she can get me a spot for two little early. Though the restaurant was busy I saw many empty tables. She said she will get me seated asap. She got me seated right at 7:30 after my white friend asked her if she could sear us how. The person who is incharge of reservations is a total racist. Made me wait for 45 mins and didn't offer to sit at bar or even water.

I was transferring vets anyways, but I had called to make sure that they could transfer my records. They lost them. Even after forwarding them their own emails and records they still could not put me in the system (although I'd been going here for two years). They even offered to send me other patients records?  I don't see how that would help and sounds like a privacy violation for the other clients? Staff up font is nice, vet over all is pretty expensive.

How about using some soap and water !!!
so worried about social distancing!  

Not busy at all and worried about too many at a table worry about soap and water on your dishes.   Masks are too much.



Another chance at what ? 
Taking my money 
Not caring you has the recovery moment and failed !
Rachel, the office manager is great with communication. They did an amazing job on fixing my car for general maintenance. Definitely a recommended mechanic!!

I was flying into Tucson and needed to order lunch for a group of 12. Although I couldn't order in advance, I was able to place the order at 11am (when they opened) for pick-up at 11:30am. The staff made the process very easy. The food was delicious. I had the Banh-mi, and several of my coworkers tried different items on the menu and said it was excellent.
The take-out order was not where my experience ended. I realized as I was at the airport later that day that I had left my card. I called and spoke to someone at the restaurant who knew exactly who I was and offered to shred or mail me my card. She followed-through mailing the card and I received it within a few days. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Tucson.

Got a pizza to go from Pizza Nola when in the area based on reviews.  Kind of hole in the wall location in nondescript strip mall a mile or so on the Metairie side of the yuppie kingdom business-restaurant district area of Harrison Avenue.  Nothing wrong with the pizza, it was nice hot zesty cheesy, etc., but nothing great either.  The crust was somewhat unique in that it was soft and light as opposed to crisp (which is how I like it). I would not go out of the way to go there, but if I lived around the block I'd probably pick up a pie every now and then.

When I go on vacation, I like to treat myself like it's my birthday!

First step - Make A Reservation! 

This place fills up fast and they will send you reminder text too. I know this is seafood in Nashville but it was literally the best food experience I had while visiting. 

My friend and I arrived from a long flight from NY and had a couple cocktails at Skull's Raimnbow Room before heading over. Yet, Maci our waitress, sold me on this gin, blueberry, egg white cocktail, called Negative Space. Mind Blowing! It's like this girl could read my mind. I am a sucker for gin and egg white cocktail. I could not have been happier. 

The restaurant itself felt modern, clean and spacious. I like to not be elbow to elbow when I am splurging on a meal. 

We started with a dozen oysters. The oyster menu was perfect. It explained the flavor notes for each, of course some of the obscure ones were sold out. Our dinner was pretty late. I would say come as early as you can for the full menu. Also remember to check the boxes for mignonettesauce, horseradish, cocktail sauce and lemon. This was the best way to start the meal. 

They suggested 4-5 plates to share. We ordered 4 after the oysters and it was a lot. But happy we got to try so many of the dishes. 

Poppy's Caviar - was a delicious and light dish 
Octopus salad - So good with the grapes, avocado and crunchy pepitas
Crab Dip -  A really meaty one of the dishes, rich and comforting. Loved the cast iron skillet it was served in
Smoked Trout - a lovely layering of flavors. With the potatoes it became a lot heavier too

We ended up taking some of the crab dip and smoked trout home and it made for the perfect morning chilled breakfast. 

Thanks to our lovely waitress for helping us through the menu and making our experience so enjoyable. I have been singing your praises Henrietta Red, until we meet again!

The worst papa johns it was really a disappointment for sure. Usually the other papa johns their pizza are very juicy and cheesy this pizza is very dry and the not a lot of cheese on them and the cheese looks low quality! Sorry really not worth it

We tried Ehrlich for a couple of months and they've been hell. The first service, the guy was literally in and out of the house in 5 min. 2nd time a no-show, no one called- just waited all day. 3rd scheduled visit, again a no-show with no call. What a scam of a company and waste of money.

We finally got a chance to try this GEM! I had the Asada Plato...Hubs had the Cali Burrito...and my son had the Birria Tacos. Everything was cooked fresh to order and was so so so amazing. The meat was especially good. Very well seasoned with the right amount of char. All of the sauces and sides were better than expected. There are a lot of taco places around town that make fantastic food...but this is a little different Cali spin on things. Def worth a trip! Don't miss that Hibiscus Agua Fresca either! Wowzers!

They don't actually deserve a star. Whoever goes to Cdn Tire Capilano Auto, without reading reviews, deserves to be gouged, and believe me, they will make sure you are well serviced in this regard and not in any other way....

Many times I've given crappy tire auto a shot, simply because they are close to where I live, but over the years, have yet to do any business with them simply because their quotes for whatever service I was seeking, could be done cheaper and faster at other vendors or even other crappy tire locations (have never used them either because I simply do not trust crappy tire auto. 

Last three crappy tire attempts:

1. 2019 Coquitlam BC - BMW X3, brake line went. Sunday. My kid was driving the car and the only option for repair was crappy tire. I spoke with the service manager and the quote was 2300.00. I laughed at him. Told him to not gouge me, I knew their game etc. I got he work done for 1000.00

2. 2020 Remote car starter Capilano Edmonton: Only 100.00!!? wow. Install cost? 800.00!!!! Idiots. What a deal. I went to a different vendor and had the same starter installed for 465.00

3. 2021 Winter to summer tire swap: Capilano crappy tire. 153.00. No thanks Crappy tire South Common? 80.00  (each location is independently owned, not a corp rate) Alse tire, west end 60.00. 

I could go on. This is only being posted as a warning to STAY AWAY from Capilano crappy tire.

Annette saved me!! Wow - What an inspiration. When in town for the gem shows, I was receiving an award at a black tie event. Pairing up with a friend to get our hair done, we crossed our wires and each thought one another was creating hair appointments in advance. Come the day of, we realized our mistake and went on a maddening search to find someone with both the extra, last-minute time and SKILLS to help us out (I have no hair skills - 0). Lo and behold, Annette kept her doors opened to us and stayed extra late to help me out with an intensely beautiful, unique updo. Her patience, kindness, and execution of an updo floored me, sending me out the door feeling (and looking!) like a million bucks. Thank you, Annette - You're a real stylist GEM!

Surprise ....surprise..... Don't judge this place by the outside, stop in and try it. Went with a couple of friends after work, we ordered wine flights, fondue,and a cheese plate all was enjoyed! Owner is very friendly ,  so are the patrons, Will return soon,

There is truly nothing about this place that I could give a star for. I booked a pedicure, never having been here before. The pedicure room is so outdated. Flashback to 90s is what the pink walls reminded me of. My chair was not comfortable. I'm tall and felt like my knees were at my chin. The lady giving me a pedicure was quiet for about the first half and then started asking questions I felt too personal (do you have kids, why don't you want kids, what do you do for work). And the worst part, my feet were still rough and dry when I left. Terrible.

Started the evening with Vincent greeting us at the door and suggesting house specialties. Started with so many delightful plates of appetizers- including the meatballs on toast, corn and crawfish bisque (which. Should NOT be missed) and Vincent brought a complimentary eggplant appetizer. Everything was on par with the best Italian food in Nola. The service was unrivaled and we were constantly met with pleasing waiters who were eager to fulfill our needs (the waiter had a 5 min conversation with our 11 year old about the state of the NBA). Overall all--- best family meal in New Orleans and we are regulars. DO NOT PASS UP THIS FANTASTIC ITALIAN RESTAURANT. thank you, Vincent and crew !!

When we need a quick meal for the kids we usually resort to Papa Murphy's pizza. I really like the Gourmet Veggie on thin crust because I'm a calorie counter, 1 slice usually comes in at about 160 calories. The veggie pizza is loaded with tomatoes, zucchini, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, spinach and other veggies I can't remember with a white garlic sauce. Yummy!I can never just have one slice so I can eat pizza relatively guilt free when I order basically anything on thin crust. My family are not calorie counters so they like all the flavors. The kids like the Hawaiian the most. Husband is a fan of the gourmet garlic chicken.

The prices are very reasonable for the quality of food. Their lemongrass soup is just the right amount of spicy. Seafood salad is delicious and refreshing and those coconut, shrimp and curry dumplings are one of the most unique dishes I've ever tried. Perfect combination of sweet and savory.

everyone was going crazy about how good the hoagies are from cosmis so i got one and wasn't too impressed with the bread ! the meat/ cheese combos are good and priced reasonably. but it's all about the bread !!

Finally a place to eat right by the water on delaware ave!!  Not only is the food really good but the entire staff is super friendly.  You can always find the owners just chilling and talking with all the customers.  Whether you just want a coffee or a quick bite to eat this place is perfect! Oh and did I mention the food is awesome!!!

I can't figure out if they're understaffed or just not good behind the bar.  I know it's not a wine bar but asked for a broad description of a red wine I was answered with, "I'm not a wine drinker."  

I ordered a burger with an egg and was asked about all the extras...lettuce, tomato, onion and I said, "yes.  I'll take them all."  I received none...

When I received my food it was without silverware.  I waited for over 8 minutes and then went to a nearby table to get my own.

The burger was decent and the fries were crisp.  

Unless you're a cute dude, service will be slow at the bar.  Not terrible but not a place I'll be back to anytime soon.  And I live in the neighborhood.

Stopped in here on a whim while in the neighborhood and was blown away. This city has so many great cheesesteak joints that it's easy to judge if it's going to be good or not but this spot hit it out of the park. Got a chicken cheesesteak, and they use real marinated chicken breast which was deliciously awesome, and it was huge!!! I refuse to eat the chicken steak that other places sell, stuff is fake! A plus was that they sell beer too so I got a Lagunitas IPA to wash it down. Definitely will be back to try the regular cheesesteak which looked awesome as well. I also like that they chop the steak. Definitely top 5 steak i've ever had in philly hands down.

Finally made the trip to the unsuspecting spot where Perennial resides. What a gem!  Based in the bottom of a refurbished Coke factory that now houses loft apartments, this place is awesome. As soon as we walked in, the bartenders gave us a friendly greeting and asked if it was our first time - indeed it was!  She then went through the menu and all the beer options available that day.  My husband and I both opted for a flight of beer to find out which one we liked best. My winner was Midnight Rambler, a dark full-bodied Belgian Stout. Mmmmm, mmmmm, good.

To pair with our beers we ordered the charcuterie plate and the pumpkin humus. Both were spectacular but the pumpkin humus blew my mind! I am a fan of all things pumpkin and it makes so much sense to use it in humus. It also came sprinkled with pomegranate seeds on top which gave each bite a tart, acidity to it. I am drooling right now just thinking about it. 

Our experience at Perennial could not have been any better. The beer, the food, the service all five star worthy. Oh and we got to chatting with a group of home brewers who traveled up from Memphis to try the place, very cool.   Got some great tips to use for our future home brews.  This place is a winner and we can't wait to go back to try and get our hands on some of their famous Abraxas beer next month!!
nice inexpensive eat. very casual great place to spot for a bite at all hours
Fabulous!!! My family orders from here all the time always amazing food and super quick delivery!!!

Where do I start...
Dr. Amy Hoffman, the veterinarian who saved my dog, really went the extra mile. "V" was brought to her after being found starving, and with a severely infected tail from someone abusing him. Amy carefully, and with great surgical skill, had to cut the tail bit by bit until all the damage had been removed. The poor little guy was then lovingly rehabbed, before presenting him to me for adoption.
Maybe another vet would not have dedicated so much personal time to save an abandoned mutt. All I know is that without the skill, compassion, and generosity Dr. Hoffman showed, I would not be the gloriously happy owner of "V" the coolest mutt in the world.
Dr. Hoffman was also the doctor who saved my cat, many years ago. She was another abandoned animal that Dr. Amy treated as if it were a blue-ribbon champion. Miss Kittty is now 18 years old!!
Bless you Dr. Amy!!
The bagels were very good and the bagel and egg sandwich was delicious. Also the coffee was excellent. The people that work there were very nice and I highly recommend this place.

Stopped here today. Been wanting to get in here. It was worth the time. Best sandwich I've had in a very long time. The gal at the counter was friendly and helpful. What a treat. They have fresh sausage and homemade meatballs. Don't pass this place up. Five stars. If there was ten stars I'd give it ten.

Please  be careful when you order food to go from this restaurant. Their website is not updated and their  employee's  conveniently forget to provide  that information to customers when they take out orders over the phone. I learned of the difference between what I ordered via their website and what I actually  got, when I arrived home. When I called back to the restaurant  inquire about my order, then I was informed "sorry our website is out dated" and further told  that what I received was the new version. Smaller in quantity and more expensive in price. So,  if you plan to order anything  to go please learn from me "their  website is outdated" and whenever you think you are ordering has been  changed to something slightly different and more expensive. That said, usually the food is OK.
I can't say enough good things.   Their Gyros are amazing.  We stopped in the bakery on the way home.  I had the Chocolate Kok and it was really good.  5 stars!

I hate places that brag about their local heirloom ingredients and then serve the same crap everyone else does. Since when did grape tomatoes become heirlooms? Local vegetables in January? Hardly likely. Be honest and admit you are a bar with average food with above average prices. Service was snotty and you really felt like they were doing you a favor by coming to your table. Serve cream or at least something white with the coffee, maybe the heirloom heritage cow was off for the day?

Wasn't horrible.  First time visit. What made me visit was the photo of the shrimp and grits they posted on Facebook. (Sponsored post, I believe)  I see a lot of reviews that rave about the cheesy grits, so I had high expectations!  Unfortunately, I was let down.  The price was $12.99. Not outrageous, but I felt there could have been more grits on the plate. The plate was very shallow, but wide.  As for the taste of the grits, I was ready to have awesome, cheesy grits, but to me, they were lacking in cheesy flavor. The shrimp were flavorful and cooked well. The bacon in the dish was excellent, so it wasn't a complete bust, but I would not order it again. My wife had an omelet which she said was very tasty.  If we go back, I would like to try the fried green tomatoes.  That is IF we go back.

Beware this hostile store!

My friend and I drove here after a very positive experience years ago with their selection and were treated INCREDIBLY disrespectfully by the sales people who body shamed, and treated my friend and with incredible rudeness.

It is a great shame as we were hoping to find dresses for a family wedding and travelled for an hour to see this amazing selection. Felt so unsafe and hurt in the store we both decided to leave rather than try anything on.

will not be coming again and feel strongly these workers should be fired!

Servers were extremely nice, still waiting for food after almost an hour. Would not be so bad, but I am tired of listening to hip hop and r&b in a Cajun restaurant. Has a nightclub feel to it. Being a Louisiana native, sounds like staff is screwing with the radio.
It's okay if you want a drink and some cheap bar food, like fried this or fried that, but don't order the brisket. It's the first time I ever had brisket that seemed more like SPAM.

My Boyfriend and I would come here every Wednesday for margaritas and dinner.  Normally, when Brittany was working, it would be an exceptional evening.  Tonight was absolutely terrible.  The server we had acted like she didn't want to serve us.  We had to get our own menus, and basically beg for utensils and napkins.   The food was ok, not exceptional like usual.  I'm very disappointed in what was our every Wednesday go to date spot.  We will no longer be coming back and this disappoints me.
I ordered the night before from Doordash the earliest delivery possible. Woke up to the most delicious donuts EVER!!!!!! THANK YOU PANA!!!!!

Dr. Reddy and Staff are wonderful ! They offer a wide range of services and prices for you to chose from. Her office is always clean and decorated for the occasion. She did a great job on my forehead and i highly recommend her services and be back !

I live in Atlanta but I'm in the area visiting family and noticed my car was due for service.  I have had terrible experiences with my dealership and figured I could go here and if it took all day at least my dad could pick me up.  Not only did they accept my last min appointment, they took me in immediately, honored an expired offer that the dealership I bought it from wouldn't honor when it was valid (I didn't even ask they offered to help!) and it was done when it was supposed to be done!  I have had good and bad luck with JEEP service departments - Atlanta being horrific - but this place was great and Nancy was the best!  I would highly recommend!

I've been here a couple times before and it's always been a pretty good experience. Prices are fine and the ladies are nice but this time I was severely disappointed. I got a dip manicure, which is my usual. Normally, this lasts me 3ish weeks without chilling or anything no matter where I get them done. This time, I've had two nails pop off on less than a week and a half. While the place is nice and prices are fair, I can't rationalize paying $35 for a manicure that didn't even last me two weeks.

I came here for my 17th birthday with my two best friends and family. We stayed here for one night. We got two rooms which were connected through a lockable door. My outlook on the experience was that it was good, great with friends, but overall just good if I wasn't taking into account that my friends and family were with me. 

I'm not a very picky person, most things I just go with the flow with. However, having said that, there was definitely a few things I can talk about that was negative with the actual hotel rooms. For one, the sheets were awful. I am never picky about sheets but they were stiff and felt like paper. Another issue is the thin walls. We were able to hear conversations down the hall from people in the hallway as if our door was open. At one point I went over and checked because it sounded so crystal clear. My friends who used the shampoo, shower gel, and conditioner that came with the hotel room, said they all felt the same, just dyed different colors. Overall, the room experience isn't great. Luckily, you're not spending majority of your time there, or at least we weren't.

Now, the views. This place is beautiful. I think everyone who has been here can attest and agree to one thing: this is a beautiful resort. The waterfalls, the roses, the greenery, the hanging and twinkling lights - it's all so very beautiful. 

As far as options to eat in the resort, we went to a pizzeria place I can't quite remember the name of, but it was pretty good! We also had Carvel and Auntie Ann's for dessert and that all tasted splendid. For breakfast we ate at Auntie Ann's and Cinnabon. The lines were pretty bad but nothing like the marketplace line. They moved relatively fast, though, and the food was hot.

We spent majority of our time at the waterpark, which is huge and tons of fun. The rides are a-plenty and we swam for hours on end! Only complaint here is the lockers are, you guessed it, way too overpriced. The smallest locker, a "medium" is 12 dollars, and they don't accept coins. You're best just hiding your stuff like we did.

In summary, though, I believe this place is way too overpriced. I feel bad about how much my parents paid - don't get me wrong, I had a wonderful time because I always will when I'm with friends and family, but if I had come here alone I would have been immensely dissatisfied.

Great service I made reservations place was
Packed - wld be a great place to get tipsy w friends but (thats my old life) took left overs home they were sooooo good the next morning
The location is wonderful, ocean view and outside seating. They have a wide variety of options and great strong coffee!

I go to the Publix on Kingsway where this restaurant is near a lot, and thought I would give this place a try. I ordered the Chinese BBQ Ribs, and was quite pleasantly surprised. Instead of the usual "kibbles and bit's" you get when you order BBQ Ribs at most Chinese places, I got 4 full sized meaty ribs, cooked to perfection, with a very tasty Chinese BBQ Sauce all over them.
Yum!
They were served over a bed of really outstanding pork fried rice. I could barely finish all that food, so I took home the Egg Roll, and gave it to my friend. 

Service was great, and even though all the few tables in the place were full, the owner actually moved menu's and decorative stuff off an unused corner table, so I had a place to eat. 

I will be back here for sure, the next time I get a craving for Chinese Food In Brandon.
HORRIBLE customer service. The front desk staff is rude. The basic attitude at this "hotel" is if you've chosen to stay, it's your fault. Spend your money other places.
An insult to Louisiana cuisine. Small portions and overpriced. Everything I got looked like it came out of a TV dinner or prepackaged grocery store food. Bleh!

Stage 2 of re-opening states that restaurant establishments are to frequently clean and disinfect high touch surfaces (such as restrooms) during operation, not to keep them closed. If your establishment is open for dine-in seating, you must provide full use of a restroom for your customers. Very careless to force customers to a neighboring food establishment for restroom use, causing higher traffic to another facility. Not safe. Not nice.

We like this Wendy's a lot. It is our go to fast food option and you often will catch us here Sunday afternoon. The restaurant is clean and updated. The staff is super kind and has even remembered who we are and what we order (shout out to Angie). We like the 4 for 4 option because its cheap and a lot of food. They always have fresh baked cookies too, which I am a sucker for. 

See you next Sunday, Wendy's!

By nature, I'm not a complainer but this is the worst consumer experience I've ever had.  And Gerhard's doesn't seem to care.  We ordered a washer, dryer and refrigerator for our new home in late July, 2020.  $4,100!   OK, COVID has delayed supplies, I get that but the communication is nonexistent.  No update on the fridge and we're in late August, it took me to drive to the store to get someone to check.  The washer and dyer was finally delivered but the washer is broken.  After two failed attempts to fix it, they tell me they will not take it back.  That they need to "re-build" it until it works.  The repair tech Gerhard's sent recommended that we have it exchanged as he was puzzled with why it's broken.  Gerhard's refuses to exchange it saying the manufacturer won't let them return it.  I said that's now their problem.    Please go to Best Buy of Home Depot.

Got a to-go order on a very cold Sunday afternoon in March. I ordered a Hot N Sour Soup, a 4pc Crab Rangoon, and the House Special (Beef, Pork, Chicken, & Shrimp) Lo Mein. The Hot N Sour Soup and the Crab Rangoon were both adequate and typical of any strip mall carryout Chinese place. The Lo Mein was probably the worst I've ever had. The noodles were overcooked and tasteless. The beef was stringy. The pork appeared to be reddish in an alarmingly undercooked way. I took literally two bites of this and threw it away. I would never go back.

I ordered two pizzas with extra cheese by web delivery. They took an hour to bring it. By the time it came it looks like something they dropped on the floor and stomped on it. I will never order from here again and I suggest everyone else to do the same. They don't like working at a pizza place obviously . My girlfriend and  dad told me not to complain but $35 for 2 pizzas and this  is what we get?
Some of the best tacos in FL. There's so many different combinations, there is literally something for everyone. And oh the sangria is spot on. I wanna try everything. IG: Food4YouGlobal

The more unique items on the menu are the best, especially the burgers. The Bavarian Burger rocks as does the one on the Pretzel bun. The Greek salad with chicken is awesome and all of their salads are HUGE as well as their chocolate cake!

I was excited to see another food place open in IV but it was super disappointing...
We went the first day it opened when they were giving out buy one get one free coupons outside. I forgot to show the cashier my coupon and asked him if he could give us a free grilled cheese since it's buy one get one. He said no because the purchase already went through but told us we can use it next time. I thought okay that's fine we'll probably come back! 
When our grilled cheese with added bacon came out it was SUPER dry and TINY... there were about 2 pieces of dry bacon in there cut into tiny strips of four to fit the equally tiny sandwich. Tater tots were good, but not worth the price.
I won't be going back to use that coupon :(

In one word: sad.  If you are a fan of American Target stores, you will be disappointed - no designer clothing lines, very few housewares, exactly one rank of shoes. Instead of stocking those things that are unique to Target, this location is full of household staples like paper towels.  So sad.

Great sushi. We had dynamite and Amanda roll, they were delicious. We also had Kung pao and fried rice, which were ok. 
In the next couple days or so, we ordered for take out because we liked the food so much. They said they will have it ready in 20 mins. I came in after 20 minutes of placing the order and I waited another 40 minutes before they gave it. But the staff were very friendly and gave me 10% off because I had to wait.
There is no where else to go for nail services!! Gwen is awesome!! Pedi ans mani best in Metairie!

I was looking for a restaurant that wasn't just tourist hype with mediocre to good at best creole / Cajun influenced food. This place far exceeded all my expectations and goes down as THE best place to eat in french quarter. Small, on the romantic side, good service and the food was AMAZING. Cannelloni- AMAZING. The Grouper or Talapia - AMAZING. Always order the food with the house special "Ocean sauce." I promise the grub will be "slap yo mama" good....
Good prices, noodles are some of the best coming from a restaurant chain I've ever had.

Ting Wong is one of the best "quick" places in Chinatown to grab a bite. The prices here are really reasonable and they have a good selection of stuff to order. 

If the roasted meats hanging in the window are not something you are interested in you can also order some of the other stuff they prepare in the back. 

The best thing about this restaurant is the service. While the waiters here may not have the smiling faces of waiters from most American restaurants, the speed is incredibly fast. For each of the times I went to Ting Wong's,  it takes the server usually 3-5 minutes after I place my order to bring me my food. (Usually roasted meats from the window, other stuff in the back take longer in my experience)

So if you are in a hurry for some good fast food, then Ting Wong's the place to be.
There is a nice atmosphere in the restaurant. The workers are really nice and accommodating. The prices aren't too bad. Overall, the food is decent for being in Antioch.

What a little gem! The menu is diverse, the ambiance charming. Our server was helpful, patient and had great recommendations- very knowledgeable too. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town. Better than any vegan joint I've tried in Miami (Miami seems to thinks all vegans subsist off of smoothies, juices and acai bowls exclusively).

It's just an ok ramen place. I am picky about my ramen. Obon ramen is so much better, they also don't boil there egg it's a 64 degree egg and it's way better to be able to stir it up in the soup. Just my opinion. But if you want some ramen for a cheap price this is the place!

Good vibes and an even better burger! 

I've been here twice now, and the servers are super friendly and attentive. I'm happy to see places like this pop up on the west side of town.

Good music! Great patio with board games and cornhole!

What doesn't this place have? Live music, delicious food, and bomb cocktails all around.

Cocktails - Persephone's Downfall and Lavendar Lace. Do it.

Food: Three Muses Fries are a can't-miss. Mac and Cheese with brussel sprouts--I didn't even know I liked brussel sprouts until I had these. I really liked that they give you a small or large portion option.

Service: Wonderful. Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.

Venue: Live music. Made me feel like I was in a dreamy intimate jazz club. Which I was!

Only Con: We got the best table in the house however, it was right near the door so people kept swinging it and hitting V. Hilarious, but he was losing patience. Get a spring for that door yo!

**Only takes 2-3 credit cards per table I believe.

This restaurant is garbage...they wont make you what you want if it's the wrong time of day and they won't make things the way you want.  The chef is pretentious and he only makes what he wants to make and it tastes terrible because they refuse to use the right ingredients.

Avoid the omelettes at all cost.
One of the best pizzas in town! I had it late saturday night and the slices are absolutely huge and delicious!

Go Overboard. Seriously awesome. Especially of you're a fan of Primanti Bros. 

Everything else looks great too. I think this will be my new sandwich spot.

Friendly home cooked meals, great food great prices always busy when we went in. All the waitresses at each of the diners we went to offered service with a smile. The sweet tea was great, loved the chicken fried steak. The grits were cooked to perfection and the pork chop was awesomely seasoned. Dots Diner Definitely pleased and should be tried when you go to NOLA!

I've ordered from Pat's for 2 years now, ever since I moved to PA.  I have been GF for over 8 years, and I have not ever had a better GF pizza than what I get at Pat's.  I'm picky, and I love this pizza!  Ask the delivery guys, I see them at least once a week.  No doubt the best GF pizzas ever!  I also here their strombolis are awesome too!

It was my first time visiting Nola!! This place came highly recommend for my local friends. So of course we had to find out for our selfs. It was a 5 min walk from the hotel which was nice. The atmosphere was very nice and welcoming we ordered the p and j oysters. We didn't pay close to the what the menu said and how they were prepared. But when they arrived they were green and delicious!! We both ordered sandwiches that were very tasty and filling. i recommend if you ever get a chance you should give it a shot!!

Food was fantastic....fresh, delicious and upscale Mexican. We went with a party of 10 and had Nick as our waiter. He was extremely knowledgable about the menu and his recommendations were spot on. Will absolutely go back!

I've been consistently impressed with Byrd & Barrel. I've ordered the Mother Clucker sandwich (to go) a handful of times. Last night I ate at the restaurant and had the smoked wings and poutine. Everything has been outstanding. The dry rub on the smoked wings is killer... just the right balance of sweet & spicy. The poutine was all around delicious; it's heavy, but not overly so. I've tried the tater tots, too, which also have that killer seasoning on them. If you like chicken, you owe it to yourself to check this place out. I haven't used the drive thru, but it's a great feature to have. The food has always been prepared quickly, as well.

I'm a born and raised Santa Barbaran and for those visiting, it's definitely the place to go if you want seafood and a great atmosphere.  It's always full, no matter what night and expect a 15-30 minute wait, but you can go for a walk while waiting or have a drink.  

The food is awesome although I generally go for the a la carte items.  Their best in my opinion are:

Oysters Rockafeller - best I've had at any restaurant. Always get them. 
Beer boiled shrimp
Oyster Shooters
Baked climbs
Calamari - they are known for their calamari.

The staff is always great and usually cute girls. Prices are good and the view of the harbor is awesome. I suggest you ask to wait for an outside table for better views and a bit less crowding although you won't have a ton of elbow room wherever you sit. 

It's defiitely on my top 5 restaurants I go to, especially when wanting to show a friend from out of town, a Santa Barbara experience.
Rather eat McDonald's or Burger King  not a place to go for lunch or dinner it's an embarrassing service

I think this place is a touch overrated, but it's still a solid dining option in the Cherry Hill area. Met some friends for dinner last evening and were seated at a nice booth in the dining room. Ordered cocktails, which took much longer than expected to arrive. We ordered some of their small, shared plates after we ordered the drinks, and those arrived before the drinks showed up. 

We ordered the breads and spreads, the burrata, two of the bloody beet salads, and a cheese plate to start. I highly recommend the bloody beet salad- it had a great yogurt sauce and was just really light and fresh. I could have done without some of the things on the breads and spreads platter- the chick pea fries were a little soggy, but there was an interesting kale fritter thing with a yogurt sauce that was very good. The burrata dish was very unique so props for thinking outside the box! I could have done with less of the toppings and more of the burrata itself. I think the proportions were a bit off. The bread it was served on was basic and forgettable, but the "butternut peperonata" that it was served with was delicious!

I ordered the shrimp & grits, which were good, except that the proportions were off again. Massive grit cakes, and only 4 shrimp. The short ribs were delicious, very tender and, the veggies were great. A friend ordered the seared tuna served on a pesto risotto. The tuna itself was overcooked, but she said the risotto was excellent. The other three ordered sandwiches and raved about them. I think that might be the way to go. Everybody, except myself, had been there several times before, and were raving about the open faced greens sandwich. 

Not sure I'd go back, but now I'm very interested in trying out their Philly location to compare!

This place was cool, casual and delicious. I had grilled swordfish and my wife had cioppino and they were both outstanding. The fish was really fresh and well prepared. The menu is what you would expect with a few surprises given the proximity to the harbor. The clam chowder was delicious as well and from the second floor, the views of the harbor are worth a visit alone!
Wasnt crazy about it. Hummus did not have much flavor and dish was not full of flavor. Probably wouldn't go back.

I love this place because it's "home" to me. I grew up a town over in Springfield, so I grew up visiting Linvilla annually. It's always on my to-do list for the Fall, and even the Summer. My only complaint is that sometimes the prices are a bit too high for what they sell. Aside from that, thumbs up all around!

Outstanding experience. Went here for my birthday and it was one not to forget. Service was impeccable, atmosphere very vibey, the food was marvelous. Mushroom risotto with crab was wonderful, and the trio of soups was a lovely way to start. The $0.25 martinis are dangerous of course, but a great accessory to an already awesome meal!
Very busy, but extremely polite service and the burgers were incredible. Just make sure the fries are well cooked.

We went to CaiE's on a Sunday when the full dim sum menu is available.  The shu mai (pork, beef, and chicken) were fresh and tasty.  I also really like the steamed egg custard buns (sweet, like dessert).

From the "regular" menu, the special Chinese broccoli and salt and pepper pork ribs were quite good.  The ribs could have been cut into smaller pieces, and were fairly greasy, but the flavor was delicious.

The only dish I thought was a little "off" was the chow fun noodles- seemed a little bland.

Service was excellent, and the food was prepared quickly and steaming hot.  I definitely will be "bookmarking" and returning to CaiE's.

Cheap drain rooting service
Arrived on time however it was an unmarked truck and the guy yelled out of the truck hello ,but we were all inside
Plumber spent entire visit chatting (complaining) about previous customers and then after service informed me that he cannot accept debit card payments
Most unprofessional service
Then again Jerry's wanted ~$130 for the same service and roto rooter wouldn't give me a quote overt the phone

I went into this store today. I was surprised at what a bare bones white box store this is. They really cut a lot of corners in the construction of this store. It really is very bland and unappealing. There are many places that you can see all the mechanical systems because they cheaped out by not installing Sheetrock and paint. Prices are good though.

Horrible service you will wait all night they will put you in a a room and forget about you
Want to come somewhere to die this is it!!!!
