Chaddsford Winery & their crew are always impressing me! From their affordable, delicious wines (and slushees!!!) to the staff's professionalism and kindness during their tours. Corey & his team are always an upmost pleasure to work with. 
I definitely recommend CFW for any fall day activity or private event.
I stopped by for my daily $1 diet coke. No notice price increase to $1.72, 72% increase. Icing on the cake dealing with long waits. There are plenty of other choices!

Tuesday nights.  Favorite local place.  Great staff.  Great prices.  

Honestly.  When I came to Boise I tried to find a local watering hole that felt like home.  Suds is that place.

Wonderful food. Excellent customer service. We ordered vegetarian food and while usually restaurants that specialize in non vegetarian dishes do not do great on vegetarian food, the paneer tikka masala was excellent and the dal makhani really delicious. The naans were fresh and aromatic and the papads they served before the meal were just superb! The place looks modest but the cleanliness level was top notch. (Restrooms were clean and well maintained) 
Overall very pleased with the experience.

Love, love, love! Great service and amazing menu. I ordered the mudslide custard with snickers in a waffle bowl - Yaaaas! My husband ordered chocolate custard in a waffle bowl and said it was equally as delicious. Honestly, they were both over the top delicious. 
Bonus is that the staff was super patient explaining the menu, and offering samples as well as suggestions. I got a loyalty card while I was there, and I can't wait to go back to get it stamped again. Highly recommend this place. Stop by next time you're in the quarter.

I have never written a negative review before, but highly recommend parents research this organization before sending children to their camps or other activities. We attended a children's birthday party at the ranch, and while Sadie, the owner of Rancho Palomino, was fine, there was a belligerent woman cursing, yelling, calling parents stupid, and otherwise acting inappropriate in front of children. This woman apparently owns the property where Rancho Palomino recently moved. After this interaction, I emailed Sadie requesting a refund of my daughter's summer camp tuition (my daughter had not yet attended the camp, so there were no services performed). Sadie apologized for the woman's behavior, who she explained had been dealing with some stress and drinking too much. However, Sadie refused to refund any part of the tuition. I explained I did not feel safe with my daughter attending a camp on a property where a woman acted like that in front of children. Sadie has continued to refuse any refund despite repeated requests. Thus, while the camp may have at one time provided a good experience for SB kids, the business practices of the organization are such that I would not recommend purchasing any camps or activities.

Great neighborhood market/coffee shop/bakery/restaurant. There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating includes couches. I recently enjoyed a terrific omelet, which was made to order. The dish included potatoes and my choice of a croissant or cinnamon roll. One downside to the breakfast was the price... with my coffee, I believe it was around $9.
The worst service I've ever received....the waitress was super rude and the management unreceptive and unapologetic. From the moment we walked in...worst experience ever!

There is not much parking in the area for self-parking, which I realize is a common problem for most South Tampa restaurants. Be prepared to valet. Limited vegetarian options, but staff was accommodating and friendly.  Fried green tomatoes (without bacon garnish) was yummy.  Eggs benedict was a little on the bland side. It was good though. Overall I  was satisfied with my experience.

I had the Mean Green veggie burger. I must say the curry honey mustard sauce is brilliant and delicious. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I also got an Irish car bomb cupcake, which was a bit dry, so that's why I'm giving them 4 stars. Definitely interested in returning some time. Nice shady patio area.

This place could be a gold mine if they ran it properly. Took my two kids there for a quick early dinner and got my son pasta with butter. When the pasta came out I noticed all these little black spots on them. Upon closer inspection it was MOLD! How the cook missed this, then the server missed it as well I don't know! Thank god I pay attention and actually noticed before he started eating. Barely an apology, no manager came over to say anything. Absolutely unacceptable. This place got a bad health department inspection a few months back. My mistake for assuming that would have corrected some of the issues. We will not return here again.

Was looking for something healthy on Google and this place popped up. Never heard of it but was open to giving it a try and will definitely be back. The staff was super friendly and the food was actually really tasty. Being a "healthy, fit restaurant" the taste is often not there for most places but the bowl I got was absolutely delicious. The wait was a bit longer than I anticipated (20min) and it was not crowded but the food prep apologized for the wait when I finally got my food. Definitely recommend!

Zero Stars!!!!  We We went at 11:00 on 4/28/2018.  There were only two  tables occupied and we sat down.  The blond waitress continually walked by our table without so much as an acknowledgment.  I thought, ok, she is there by herself so give her a break.  After a half hour two ladies came in and sat down.  Within five minutes, she walked over there to take their order - 40 minutes and not a word to us...  NEVER AGAIN!!! We walked out.  Not bad service..NO SERVICE!!!!!!

We were headed to the place across the street for oysters but they were so busy. We decided to skip the line and head to Felix's. Well the oysters were just okay. I was expecting a "WOW" factor. I did not receive that at all. The server was meh as well. I think I had high hopes and it was just meh. Not bad but not memorable. We had raw oysters and some other kind with cheese.

The good thing is they get you seated pretty quickly.

I was hit by a guy running a red light a year ago. This was my first and only accident. Direct collision was called by the police, they have a contract with the township to handle accident towing.
But, they are also a body shop. Seems unfair, like a conflict of interest. They are not the only body shop in h-town.

My dad told me to have it towed to a different local body shop, one he's used before.

So, when he arrives, I ask the older tow truck guy to take me there. He seemed like a nice grampa type. He must have had instructions to only take it back to their shop. Because as I'm in the truck with him, still shaken from just being in an accident, he keeps saying, let's just stop here first, talk to the owner, he'll give you a better deal. I told him a few times: no, let's just go straight to the other place. But he wouldn't let up. So, we went there, then I had to talk with the owner, had to tell him over and over: No, I just want to take it where my dad told me to take it.

It was so ridiculous!!!!

I felt so taken advantage of, i was at their mercy, vulnerable, had no control over the situation. And, I was all traumatized from just being hit! If I had been hit a few inches off, my car would've been totaled. 

These guys are totally shady and have bad business practices.

So glad I was able to get my car outta there!!!  :)  it's good as new now!
Been to Nashville twice, been here both times. NY hip, Nashville charm, great love music, awesome vibe, fantastic menu, great food!   This place is a great mix of hip, comfy and lively!
You did not try. Nice message to try to convince other potential customers. You did not treat us well and you know it. You should recognize your errors too. All the best.
Annalise is a talented lash tech. Love her studio. The location is so convenient. Love my lashes and I am so glad that I found Rockstar Ink!

Huge sporting good store with higher end equipment. Very large selection of guns and very knowledgeable staff highly recommend compared to most other gun shops in Reno. Very competitive with pricing and also do price matching.

I am a connoisseur of ALL THINGS CRAWFISH... and while this CAJUNS is not my 1st choice, it does ok to come in 5th.

The crawfish were nicely flavored, not too spicy where you're sucking on ice after sucking each head & not too bland where you're reaching for the Tony Chachere's, #IJS.  

The corn, turkey-necks and pig feet are prepackaged, so to speak.  I guess to be more expeditious while filling orders, the staff has pre-bagged those items.  Not a bad Idea, I guess, but for me I like to have my pig feet, turkey necks and corn sitting in the juicy juices, yeahhhhhh baby!!!!!! 

This day in particular, this Cajun's restaurant's crawfish were about .50 cent cheaper that one of the others that I frequent & the line wasn't too long either.  As at other Cajun restaurants there's a line for cooked seafood & a line for the food that has to be prepared.

All in all this place was there for me in a time of crawfish-feining, I got my fix & i was good!!!!

Restaurant week and we waited until the last minute to make reservations.  Cafe Napoli was our one choice and it did not disappoint.  I chose not to order off the restaurant week menu because I love the Penne Vodka and have not had it in a while.  Others in our party order from the pre fixe menu.  Lots of good choices Cioppino, Branzino, Linguine with clam sauce, there were a lot of good choices.  Service was great, it was very busy but we had a good time and really great food.

Love the brunch on sundays and their french onion soup is a must. It's a great atmosphere is so vibrant and bustling that it makes me feel like I might actually be in europe!
Love that they will call when a table is ready for you, so you can go and roam the square until they call. 
Tip: bread bowl is delicious. Is it bad that I always ask to take it to go?

Java is solid, but it's not that great. Further, they are very expensive. I'm talking like a hot chocolate is $1 more than it is at a coffee place just a block away. This is definitely a cool hangout spot though.

My wife and I used to be regulars here,  but we started to try the newer restaurants in town for a change. Last night we decided to go to happy hour and came away disapointed. The muscles were a great price but arrived at our table cold and seemed to be dry. We also ordered Escargot with Roquefort, while it came hot, it lacked the creamyness and garlic flavor we have come to enjoy over the years. The waitress in the bar seemed overwhelmed with the crowd but was pleasant. Maybe they need two for happy hour? The salad was great. However, we had to ask twice for bread. I hope they fix their issues, we used to love Rapscallions.

I've been here more than a few times and every time I go, I'm impressed! The food always has a freshly-prepared-with-love touch to it! If I can't finish my plate, I know my boyfriend will! My favorite sandwich on the menu is the "Big Red" paired with their savory sweet potato fries. However, they offer new specials regularly, so you also have a multitude of options while dining!

If your in Santa Barbara you have to rent a bike and take a ride along the beach. Its one of the most relaxing things you can do, and the scenery is breath taking. Wheel Fun has a bike for everyone, and the prices are fairly cheap. Riding around Santa Barbara was probably one of the best parts of visiting Santa Barbara!

This was my first time eating here , a coworker of mine insisted that it was amazing and it really was! Good modern environment and the food was amazing! Seriously from the iced tea , chips and salsa, fried avocado tacos everything was fantastic! Will definitely return!
Great service!!! The seafood was so fresh and the kids menu was filling as well! We do not eat pork and this place has a Seafood Gumbo that doesn't have any meat other than seafood. It was delish!

Had a really great time here again. Service at the bar was great. Happy hour specials keep you full and tipsy (if you are into that). Food was SO good!  Shrimp seviche was flavorful, ahi sashimi was tender and red, and my bfs chicken wings even seemed to have a higher end quality. The prices are a little much during non-happy hour times.
I eat here all of the time and we also use them to cater food to our company regularly. Always good consistent quality and quick service. Recommend for sure

Went for lunch and ordered the chicken somen noodle soup and then split the honeymoon roll ;), dynamite roll, and kani kamakaze

The chicken somen soup tasted bland and was cold within 30 seconds of being on the table.
The dynamite roll is just a bad idea. Nothing about this dish went together, didnt finish
The kani kamikaze could have been good but the honey sauce did not have the proper punch to offset the spicy crab.

My girlfriend is a bit more bashful than me when it comes to roll, she played it safe with the smoked salmon and spicy tuna. After tasting these rolls I was relieved to see that I did not misfire on my order....the food is just bad.

Osaka seems to want to position itself as a more upscale option to Houka Houka (another Chestnut hill sushi spot), and the ambiance speaks to this. However the food is actually worse than Houka Houka and the prices are higher. I would advise they actually serve a quality of food that matches the presentation and then maybe I would return. Until then Houka Houka is definitely the place to eat sushi in chestnut hill!

So we came in for my moms birthday because my sister works in the city. There were 3 of us. We all got gel manicures and my mom also got one of their spa pedicures which she really enjoyed. My mom loved all of her services. My moms technician was Rose and was excellent. I would recommend people ask for Rose. However my sister and I had Janine and Sandy for our gel manicures and they are both nice women however I would not recommend them. We both chose nude nail polish colors mine was a cream champagne color and my sister chose a white. Mine went on totally clear as if I had out on a clear coat but Sandy agreed to do a top coat of a different color so that it would show up more. I chose a light pink and was happy with the end result although it was a little sloppy on the sides and there was nail polish on the skin. My sister who got the white polish was also unhappy with her nails because she felt it was too clear and looked like a top coat rather than a gel polish. She did say something to her technician and asked for another coat so it would show up more and Janine said she did not need it. When we both went to the manager to ask if she could have another coat of a different color like I did he said something like if you weren't happy you should've said something earlier because now Janine was doing a pedicure. We said she did say something to Janine when she was doing her nails. He said we could come back another to fix it which to me was just not going to cut it. We have a luxury nail spa that we usually go to and this place just did not cut it based on the quality of service we are used to. We won't be back and we were not impressed. They made my nail bleed and I was poked with a tool and it broke the skin. When I'm paying this much I expect much better service and more gentle care!

If they had an option for no stars I would definitely rate this "restaurant" that. The best thing I had to eat at this restaurant was the queso...the wait staff was rude and ignored us...the chicken quesadilla had no flavor at all...the steak looked like ground beef and it was overall a disappointing experience especially since they got such good reviews...

LA Exposures is the best of the best when it comes to both quality and customer service! Based off of his reviews and work we were happy to hire Jeremy for our wedding! Jeremy was extremely responsive and was able to coordinate well with our wedding planner and other vendors seamlessly. He's available for travel, which he gladly did for our wedding in Florida. 

On our wedding day, Jeremy was crucial in all aspects; he made us laugh (a lot,) calmed us down, made us feel like everything was taken care of, and was excellent about ensuring we enjoyed the biggest day of our lives! His professionalism, experience and personality was worth everything to us and we can't recommend him enough! 

Jeremy's tenure in the industry is very evident in his  work, which is incredible! We feel so lucky to be able to have had such an amazing photographer for our wedding day and would 100% utilize Jeremy for future photo shoots! You absolutely cannot go wrong by hiring this extremely talented and friendly professional!

I suppose I'm reviewing the location of this Best Buy just as much as the store itself, but this entire sprawling Brentwood shopping center that includes Whole Foods, REI, Trader Joe's...I mean, amazing.

This Best Buy is like the cookie cutter versions of itself all around the country.  Identical layout, high likelihood that you'll find what you need and more, and staff that are more friendly than what they are getting paid.
Huge disappointment. Cold chowder. Gyro meet was not fresh it was thinly, evenly sliced which to me means microwaved. I will not eat here again. But the server was nice.
Great service, friendly and sarcastic. Even showed his secret to shucking oysters. Waited maybe 15 minutes and got a great seat at the bar.

One of the best sushi restaurants in Center City! The food was fresh and there was a variety of sushi dishes to choose from ; both traditional and original. Nice atmosphere; casual. Great place to bring a date!

Went here on a cheap date night. We started with flaming saganaki for a appetizer, which was delicious. Reminiscent of fondue, it was a nice serving of hot, Greek cheese and wine set ablaze. The flavors, salty and tangy, were fantastic. The appetizer came with two pita breads, which was not enough for the generous portion of cheese. Unfortunately our dining experience went downhill from there. It was a Tuesday and there were at most two other small parties, yet our beverages weren't offered to be refilled until towards the end of the meal. We would have asked for more pita bread for our appetizer, had our server been anywhere to be found. Our Greek pizza arrived after quite a wait. The thin crust was not too thin nor too thick and was the best part of the pizza. The cheese was overly abundant (way too much) and the other toppings scant. Red onion, bell pepper, beef gyro, tomatoes, and kalamata olives sounds yummy, but in such small quantity didn't give much flavor. I was confused as to a single dolmade placed in the middle of the pizza. I love dolmades, but just one on a pizza? Odd. In the end, the Greek pizza was completely lacking in the flavors I love about Greek food. Given the slow service, I was able to fully "appreciate" the "interesting decor." Well, someone definitely loves artificial greenery in cheap hanging baskets. Red vinyl tablecloths provide additional divey feel. The appetizer alone would get four stars. Service and pizza way less. So I will call it two. Not likely to return.

Chose New Sunrise after reading other reviews on Yelp. Guys did a great job with stretching and deep cleaning my 15+ year old carpet, Even got out the printer ink from the office carpet that was a year old. Definitely recommend.

Needed a neighborhood spot, and our area of Grad Hospital doesn't have that many amazing options. Enter Thai Square. 

I didn't have high expectations, but it's quickly become our go-to when stressed/tired/boiling pasta becomes an inconceivably stressful burden. It helps that it's a family place where the proprietors are super nice (and they used to be involved with Erawan, which in itself is a really solid Philly Thai option).

Their food is pretty darn good. Among the best Pad Thai I've had in Philly - 11 bucks for chicken/pork/veggie, and their spice levels are legitimately hot and not fake/diluted hot, which I'm a fan of. Drunken noodles and eggplant dishes are also consistently good. There are some other things that are pricier and which I haven't sampled (duck, seafood based dishes). I'll stick to my cheapish noodles. 

Closed on Mondays, but open every other day of the week. We're working our way up to the free entree currently with one of their rewards cards, only three more stamps to go.

Xtreme Juice has a great selection of smoothies. The thing that sets it apart the most to me is that they also offer the fresh juices as well. Usually smoothie places only have your fruit smoothie options, but Xtreme Juice offers many fresh juice options and even wheat grass shots. They also do a good job with recommendations and specials, including BOGO Sundays. The only reason I didn't give it 5 starts is that there isn't much room to enjoy your smoothie. Between the parking lot and the lack of space, it's a get in and get out kind of place. But you get out with a delicious, fresh beverage.

We found this originally through yelp and couldn't be happier that we did! We use to take our pembroke welsh corgi to petsmart but this has been hands down a much better experience overall. They're friendly, passionate about what they do and the animals they work with. We have been coming here ever since! Highly reccomended!

Yum!  Just YUM!  Everything I have had, which is just about everything on the menu, has not disappointed.  My families number one choice when asked should I pick up something for dinner tonight.  I work in the building so my visits are frequent!  Recommend!!

Not good. We come to this beach every year. Tons of great ice cream places. This year we tried D'lites. It's soft serve and had very little flavor. Plus it was over priced. Do yourself a favor and go to one of the other great ice cream places up the beach.
This place is fresh and energetic. The food was exciting and delightful. The manager paid personal attention to the guests and eagerly described the different dishes.
3.5 stars. Nice selection of beers and some grocery items. A good place to stop in when you need something.

Came in here with a large group and they were very accomodating. The space itself is quite nice with high ceilings and well decorated. 

I was a little skeptical coming in but in the end the food really was quite authentic. I had the hen pho which was a little pricey at 14 dollars but I'm willing to pay a little extra for good food when i'm in the middle of nowhere. The broth was extremely flavorful and it seemed really authentic to me. I also tried the wings and while they were pretty crispy they weren't amazing to me unlike many of the reviews i read. I also tried the grilled porkchop which was pretty good as well; usually its thinner and more flavorful. 

In any case I'm happy to come back here if i'm ever in the area. I'm guessing this is the best viet place in the cherryhill nj area.

Maggie and the team at the new UPS Store on Gunn Hwy near Starkey Ranch is a welcome asset to our Odessa community! So glad to have the convenience of this new location! 
Welcome UPS Store #7124!

Stopped here for some lunch on a Saturday afternoon at about 3PM. No line to order food, we ordered three burgers and an order of crawfish. Took about 25-30 minutes which seemed long to me for not having much business at the time. We got drinks and sat outside while we waited. Sign posted says no alcohol allowed outside but everyone else had pitchers of beer so we just went with it. I tried the Strawberry Basil Lemonade they had as a special I guess, and it was pretty good. I had the Brunch Burger, fried egg on top was cooked perfectly. Burger itself was a little overdone from what I asked but still tasted fine. We got an order of cheese fries to share and those were fantastic. Lots of cheese! My brother says the crawfish were great, they came with two small potatoes and a half of a corn of the cob. I wouldn't go out of your way to come here but it was decent for just stopping by.

The hot chicken nachos are the best in town. I would order these every single time. Be careful with the level of hot you order because it can change a little every day. The mild is a safe choice because the medium was occasionally be a little too spicy. 

I no longer eat meat but if this place ever decides to do a fried tofu I would immediately come back.

such a great coffee place. my first time having stumptown was in new york, so when i stumbled upon this one in the ace a few years ago i was ecstatic. the coffee is excellent, and the atmosphere is unreal. i love thats it's in the ace because that's definitely my favorite hotel in nola

Great place for lunch! Love the buffet. Their salad is usually awesome.,plus I love all the add Ins such as cheese, olives, hot peppers and more.

The staff is always great as well.

One day, we will have to try them for dinne

  I'm going to update my review. I have been back several times since this first review and on occasion I find that the salad is just fair. Sometimes their great salad really pops with amazing flavor. Today it tasted very flat and it's felt or seemed that it had to been out for sometime, and I arrived upon the store opening. The pizza was good as always and I only eat the vegetarian pizza so that's all I can come in on. 

As I love salads, I may not go back as often as I had been since the salads have been somewhat less enjoyable. 

As always the staff is great.

This complaint is for Graduation announcements for my son.  I  ordered elegant style announcements, but was sent the wrong style without any notification.  I should have been notified promptly of this substitution, so I would have had more allotted time and had the option to cancel the order.  But now because of timeliness I am forced to use the announcements I didn't order.  The company gave me a 20 percent discount for this error but I feel this is unfair still.  It seems like the company blatantly sent me the wrong announcements knowing the timeliness of this matter would force me to accept there offer and I do not.

I dig this place. Killer Sunday brunch, awesome atmosphere, fantastic staff! Beer! The backyard is cool especially when they have live music. I would love to give it 5 stars but I can't recommend the prime rib or any steaks we have ordered as they are consistently super fatty and they use a very strong black pepper crust recipe. If that's what you like, you'll be in heaven! :) I order the wings or the pork lately and it's always delicious but brunch is where the party's at. Hoping the Brewery will open again soon, we always had a good time when bands or karaoke were happening!

My kids have voted this place their favorite poke bowl in Reno. They like the wonton chip option as a base and loved the sauces. I agree that the sauce choices are fantastic. Mix and match friends!
They don't have octopus or crab as a protein choice. They do have crab salad as a topping. The proteins they give you are a good portion. We like our poke chunky so this place was good for that. Their fish isn't diced up fine and they didn't use the smallest scooper they could find.

Nice furniture at this place.  Everything is available in your choice of solid wood.  I've been deciding what to splurge on - a bed or a hutch?
I can see why the previous reviews claim the furniture is boring - everything has a clean, understated design.  It's traditional American furniture.  Simple, functional and well built with outstanding materials - this is where the beauty lies.
This place is clean, nice staff and knows what they are doing! Quick too' I will definitely be coming back.
Friendly staff, clean store and fresh donuts. Haven't had a bad experience yet. I personally don't eat donuts but my family LOVES them.

We arrived at around 11:45 this morning and appeared to have beaten the crowd that we experienced a couple of years ago at the Mangrove location.  The crowd never really showed up but the service was still VERY slow because they could not keep enough chicken wings cooked.  We had to wait for 2 batches of wings to be cooked before being served but once we received the food it was all good.

One thing I noticed that I didn't like was the first server you encountered was eating food off the line which was not sanitary or healthy for customers.  From my table I could see her taking pieces of fish eating them ... this happened more than once.  She was obviously trying to hide it but not very well.  I don't think the management would allow this behavior but it happened anyway ... she also gave some food to the girl who was learning the register when she came to socialize during some down time
Excellent venue. The pork was outstanding. The service was great. Located in such a great part of Indy. I HIGHLY recommend this place and will definitely be back.

This is long overdue as is our second visit. We went for our Anniversary in Sept. and had an excellent meal. The chef definitely knows what he is doing with a fine dining menu. It is a much needed dining experience in the N. Libs as we don't have many high end restaurants yet. We food was prepared skillfully with attention to detail and finesse. Every flavor was delicious from the Pork belly to the chocolate dessert. We hope this place continues to flourish. I would reccomend this place to anyone looking for a delicious quiet intimate dinner.

The food was really good... even that dish that I didn't order. Yea the waiter messed up my order, but I didn't complain since I liked what he gave me. However he was a little bitchy with me. I asked if the Dhal was soup-like (that's how it is in the NY places I have been too) so I could use it for dipping the Naan. IDK, but for some reason that ticked him off. Anyway he brought my out Dhal that was thick, so I spread it on the Naan. The he didn't offer us desert and gave us our check. I didn't feel like we were being kicked out though because we sat there for a long time before we got the check. Sooo to sum it up the food was excellent, but the service was a little lacking.

This is my go to place for burgers but I decided to try thebchick-n-shack. This was a calorie splurge but worth every calorie.  It is  boneless chicken with a crispy coating, herb mayo, and pickle served on a soft bun.  It is fried to perfect without being doused in oil. The crinkle cut fries are good as well. They are not soggy or greasy.  It was a nice evening I dined outside. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Great food, great prices, good service - the rare trifecta!  Kids loved it also, will definitely be back.
Good sticky buns, cookies, foot-long cinnamon rolls, etc.  Known for butter cake.

The large part of my experiences with TCF is with larger groups and time and again I am impressed. When you got 10-18 people looking for a place to eat its amazing that this place is adaptable to accommodation.

This time I had a great pasta that was properly oiled and graced with proportionate amounts of tomatoes, herbs, and feta cheese that was just a great meal. 

We also had those fried zucchini sticks with the mozzarella atop. but it was obviously from a prepared and refrigerated mix, since it melted far to slow. Hand grinding is usually thinner imparts some warmth and melts faster. That's how i know.

The drinks came out in good time, or waters were always filled, and the waitress was very nice even though we continue to invite our difficult friend. He makes for laughs and assures me that our hosts "earn" their keep. He's not mean, he is challenging. 

Anyways while the huge menu, and service are very good there are things that keep the restaurant from reaching the top echelon. Perhaps a higher end selection or more paired items. I think a menu revamp should be in order. Surprisingly this has a lot of  sub conscious behavioral affects on people.

Went here for my husbands graduation dinner and man we're we satisfied. Of course we ordered everything that we wanted to try and received it on 2 boats despite the stares we got because it was so much for 2 people but please believe me we arrived here with empty stomachs and left satisfied and full.
The waitress was very polite and checked in periodically to make sure we were okay. The atmosphere is amazing despite the covid precautions that are in place. Definitely would recommend this place if your looking for a appetizing sushi experience the only thing is make sure you make a reservation.

Something Obviously did go wrong...First of all My Dog was not neglected or matted, she is a Ihapso Apso and the reason why I called a mobile groomer is because her groomer died and she has anxiety from a bad groomer experience (as you where told on the phone) she gets regularly groomed every 6-8 weeks and has skin allergies which she gets shots for at her regular vet (David Heller DMV) so neglectful....I think not!! Just your poor excuse to safe face!!! I'm sure you do have clients that love your service, but in my opinion (and that is why this venue is here) I not one of them!

Total scam, don't use this service. Promises are cheap. False advertising all the way. You pay them a fee to get Marketed too, in order to sell more service. Really, I am paying for this? Scam Scam Scam. If you call the 800 number, you are promised one touch service. When you call Misty, the Customer "dis-service" representative you get offered a phone number of an attorney that wants to charge you at a "discount, Total scam.

 Proves attorneys ARE the problem, bottom feeders to be sure. Scam, Scam, Scam. Dont pay for this scam, by, you guessed it,,,attorneys.
My kids and I love their pollo a la plancha with white rice and black beans, the tostones are so fresh and taste great!

My wife and I were comparing large SUVs, like the Honda Pilot and Toyota Sequoia.

However, once we met our salesman, Ben Pugliesi, and he showed us the GMC Acadia, our shopping was over.  He made the entire process super easy and was a professional from start to finish.  The day we picked it up was quite wet and nasty and Ben suggested that I bring it back for its cleanup and detail on a better day.  I was impressed with his concern and even more impressed because none of the other dealerships talked about this kind of service being included with the purchase of their used vehicles.  We thought that only came with a  new car.  

We loved the fact that we only had to deal with him, and that we were not turned over to another person to finish the paperwork.   Bottom Line - Rivard Buick GMC and Ben Pugliesi treated my family great, and we got a tremendous deal in the process.  

Nothing negative to share.
Love getting my nails done here! They always turn out great and the environment is relaxing. Will come back again!!

The location is just outside the gates of hell. horrible neighborhood!  However the greatest sand which ever made is the Omar Sub. I am not trying to over dramatize it. It is the In N Out double double of sandwhichs. It is made out of ingredients blessed by Angels. Only get this do not share. You will be a rabid crack addict if anyone comes near your sweet sweet treasure.  You should order two in advance to save yourself the extra trip in line

Visited Sahm's on a Saturday afternoon with a group on 5 friends. We sat in the bar area and were waited on promptly! 
Sever was nice! Food was pretty good! I ordered the Nashville chicken bone in hot chicken wings. They definitely weren't hot but seasoned well. They are served with pickles which is awesome and goes with the "Nashville" name.
As a table we also had the Coney Island poutine and a Meatzorilla pizza. 
Poutine was good but just like most stacked fries or nachos the top layer has all the toppings then you have a ton of naked friends/chips left.
The Roadstone Meatzorilla pizza was great! Loaded up with meat and cheese. I would recommend getting it "well done" if you like a crisper bite. Otherwise the pizza was great! 
Also had a blood orange sour from their tap, Five foot freak. It was good but just seemed to be missing "something". 
My only complaint is that they offer certain apps at $3.33 between certain hours. They have the list inside each menu. After our group finally agreed on a few apps the waiter came back as said "I was just informed we aren't doing the discount on weekends". There was no days listed on the app list only times. I'd recommend they remove the advertisement during the weekend or list the days that these items are offered. 
The server did ask if we had a Sahm's card and explained what it was but never offered to sign any of us up even after we all said we were first timers ‍

I've taken my foster dog Toffee to a few places in Tampa Bay and can vouch for the superb treatment and care at Fetch. Dr. Hogan and vet tech Shannon in particular have been so great with making sure she is so well cared for and so responsive with any little or big concern I've had. I highly recommend Fetch and so thankful for their high-level diagnostics and treatment that have saved Toffee's life!

If it was possible to give -1 stars, thats what Sundance, their promotion giveaway and the customer service is. Beyond words on how furious I am with all the time I've wasted following the rules of the promotion vacation.

"Based on availability" is crap . Why make me submit a deposit and wait til 30 days til before the first date I chose to tell me its unavailable? I submitted the dates way ahead of time, and my money. Thats ridiculous. And on top of that to wait on the phone for close to an hour and a half? Yes, Im well aware its a third party agency , but apparently they suck at their job too. Its not that hard to reserve and book dates and make sure the plans allign. Sorry not actually sorry, but this has to be said: I really don't appreciate my time being wasted like that.

Because in the end the dates and the flights didnt work out and Im ON HOLD FOR A REFUND.

I think there are two types of people in Tucson. The people that go to Frog & Firkin and the ones that go to No Anchovies. I'm the latter. I love it that I can always find a place to sit on the patio and get a quick slice with my beer. I also love that you can hear the band at Frog & Firkin, but you can still talk to the people your out with! Great place to kick back in!

I have to say that hearing all the hype about this place I was expecting something more then I got.  We had to wait 20 minutes to get seated and it was only half full (late afternoon on Sunday.) We then sat at our table for 10-15minutes before anyone acknowledged we were there.  Food was below average and somewhat expensive for what we got.  Would I go back? Probably not....not for the wait.

As a visitor to Philadelphia and someone who has been travelling for a while, I was in desperate need of a good haircut. I booked an appointment with the lovely Rachid today and opted for a drastic chop. I showed Rachid a photo of the style I was after and he did it brilliantly - exactly what I wanted, stylish and new and comfortable and most of all, a wonderful fresh change. I left very happy with the cut and the price as well. Thank you so much, Rachid!
I regretted agreeing to share my catfish dinner because it wound up only being one piece of catfish. That thing was delicious. Flaky, fresh, and the perfect blend of spices.

I stayed there this past week for a wedding the room was nice bed comfortable but that was it. Don't plan on eating anything in that hotel it's gross and over priced. The hotel is over packed with people and you can hear through the walls. It's pricey for what you get not worth it at all will be staying somewhere else next time in Philly

Even though I have been in Delaware County for a long time, I just recently went to Nick's.   There are only 5 different sandwiches on the menu (roast beef, pork, ham, turkey, and broccoli rabe).   There are some sides like fries and mozzarella sticks and lots of beer.   My dining partner and I split the roast beef and pork  sandwiches.   We ordered combos which means you want it with sharp provolone.   Fries and drinks are not included.   The roast beef sandwich was reminiscent of the old Drexel Ale House in the Bond Shopping Center.   Both sandwiches were tender and replete with gravy so don't come here without expecting to get your fingers dirty.  Service is on paper plates with plastic forks.   Parking is tight.   Sandwiches are around $6.50.   Plain fries are $2.50.

When I'm lazy and want a pizza delivered, this location of Godfather's never disappoints. I know it's a chain but the pizza is always better than I expect. Worth checking out. Friendly, professional staff is a plus.!

Amazing! A genuine French bakery! Food and service superb! Pain au chocolat straight out of the oven! I had to have two for good measure. Don't get the decaf coffee though...but I guess that's my fault because who orders decaf!...#newbornbabywoes

Love this place.  We have had the bulgogi, goji bokum, and jjampong soup. All fantastic. Always a majority of Korean folk eating here when there. Always a good sign.  Service is always acceptable. Never an issue. The jjampong is a spicy Korean seafood noodle soup that is fantastic.  The only complaint I have is they seem to not be able to make things "extra spicy".  I ask every time yet it always comes out with virtually no spice or very little. The menu is pretty large and I'm sure a ton of good stuff. Find a Korean friend that can tell you what the heck most of it is.

I have had the pleasure of spending lots of time in Europe.  Mostly France but in Italy and Spain as well.  I love pizza.  Not the soggy, faux cheese kind but real, thin crust, lightly sauced, wonderful taste with high quality ingredients.  Never found that in Tucson until I found Pizzeria Bianco.  Without question the best pizza outside of Europe.  If you don't love it you are a cretin.

Went here for happy hour last night with a few friends and wow! What an awesome happy hour that they have. $4 select rolls. We tried California, pumpkin and avocado which were all fresh. They had a few other options like spicy tuna, salmon Avo, etc.. The chicken and shrimp dumplings were very tasty ($4 each as well). And what can I say about the martinis .. they certainly don't skimp on the alcohol provided in them. Overall, we will be back!

went in and what was weird is it smelled like cigarette smoke. they must let workers smoke in the back and it comes through. i am very sensitive and allergic and will not be buying a couch from this establishment. i got a creepy vibe inside as well.
Overcrowded, overpriced with typical raunchy people rubbing far closer than most would prefer. Should be called the Body Odor Festival

Half & Half is one of my fave brunch spots! Also have always had excellent service! However, on this visit, I ordered the sausage egg cheese biscuit that came with potato's and was pretty disappointed. The biscuit and eggs were great but the sausage was tough and had an odd flavor . The potatoes tasted like metal and had a bad aftertaste. I decided to mention it to the bartender after I paid so not the restaurants fault I didn't order something different  just hope they can make some changes to this dish option going forward.

This target is super nice! Besides from having a Starbucks they have lots of neat little sections that other targets don't! Their grocery section is one, but they also have a section for men with good fellow brand shave needs, lotions, etc, as well as a ladies spa section which has a large display of different colored loofahs and tons of bath bombs, and bath/self care fun items. As soon as you walk in there's a whole section set up by women's bathing suits for summer fun including pool floaties, personal coolers, fiesta decor, and margarita fixings! 

If you thought target stole all your money before, beware of this one!

Travel Tip:  Find out about the best local eateries from your Lyft or Uber drivers.

One of the suggestions from our kind and "Uber" friendly driver (see how I did that? Lol) was Drago's.  He proclaimed they had the best charbroiled oysters, and he told no lies.  The piping hot oysters arrived at the table crusted with Parmesan cheese on top, and swimming in butter.  I grabbed a piece of French bread, gave my best somersault tuck, and dove in!  So rich and flavorful, just sublime.  The spinach dip was tasty as well, but the oysters are a must.
The fried spinach appetizer was out of this world, definitely recommend. I also really suggest the lamb meatballs with saffron rice.  Price was moderate

Really Bad. 2 of the buildings caught on fire. People have technically been homeless for a month with no end in sight. Constant water shut-offs.  Dangerous safety issues everywhere, especially due to lack of real security and management putting a "band-aid" on everything instead of doing the right thing and truly fixing the issues. Not to mention crazy fighting neighbors, people who hit and run cars in the parking lot, and people who don't live here sleeping in the parking lot and swimming in the pool at all hours. Don't get scammed into living here.
Amazing service!! The glow facial leaves your face smooth and bright. Best pedi and mani I've ever had. Flosadé used all natural products, making her services worth every penny.

Let me start off by saying the owners are very nice people looking to improve. Our waitress was a nice young lady but inexperienced. On multiple levels. The oil that came with the amuse bouche was not EVOO. Clear, flavorless oil. The bread was pretty good. If the pasta is home made mine was a few days old. The sauce with my veal appeared to use canned/jarred ingredients. Pizza was undercooked. No color on the crust or cheese. We'll give it a try again in a few months.

I live in Washington, DC.  I love eating out.  I've eaten at a lot of places.  This is one of my favorite place EVER.  It is sooo reasonably priced for the amazing quality of the food.  Some of the highlights for me were: Blackened Shrimp & Grit Cake, Boudin Balls, Pulled Pork Cake, & Thai Chili Chocolate Chess Pie.  It's just so good and everyone who work there was SO nice.  We popped in, unknowing tourists, on a Saturday night and dinner time and they found us a seat.  It's amazing.  Just go.

Great atmosphere , Venues, vast beer selections  and fresh Food . The selection / variety of food is very good as is the quality  & quantity . The steak alone is 5. Worth the parking issue if u encounter one & there's always valet parking .  If your looking at going after dinner for clubbing etc.. it's fun, festive , great indoor & out with fire tables etc... It dose get fuller the later it gets as it should if ur looking to network , meet up or party with ur friends . Its very well rounded with something for all at the right times. With that said it isnt a place I'd advise parents of young kids to go to on weekend nighit or game nights. They offer entertainment like guest speakers , live music and pay pre-view boxing events etc.. enjoy & peace
This place is gross and the food is greasy.  I went here with my boyfriend because of the rave reviews and his meal was filled with bones and mine was a greasy mess.  I wouldn't ever go back

I generally love the curry chicken.  I have ordered  twice in last month and both orders were incorrect.  There is no manager to speak to when you are upset. Only children can speak English fluent enough to participate in a conversation but they lack the maturity to problem solve. I'm not sure what has changed here but it's really unfortunate considering that not many places deliver in Plant City.

This is the best ice cream !! I no longer live in the area but make the trip over from Cherry Hill because Sprinkles is THAT good. The staff is always so friendly, the portions are huuuge, and the prices are extremely fair. The graham slam is the ultimate fav with my family. The outside patio is also set up with so many chairs and rockers which make a comfortable outside seating area to enjoy your treat. The best part about this shoppe? It's open all year round!!

Great place to shop if you can.  Good prices and interesting selection.  I live too far to buy perishables, because I usually forget to bring a cooler, but its a great place to stock up on your center-aisle stuff and try something new.

The food was delicious :) Everything was so fresh. I had the quiche with artichokes & spinach, homefries and a side of fruit. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. I have definitely found a new spot to take friends and family when they visit.

This was another Yelp search that proved successful.  We searched for nearby eateries and this one came up highly rated as well as the YS had heard some good things about it as well.  

We walked in and it was seat yourself and so we did.  A big open air room with lots of bar stool tables as well as regular tables.  

Our waitress came right up and greeted us and as it turned out had went to high school oh so many years ago with the YS.  How's that for going back in time.  

We ordered up a couple of specials and since they brew their own gin there the YS decided to try a martini.  It and the turkey sandwiches and soup/salad were all quite tasty and decent sized portions.

The service was good and the refills on the soda and water were right on track.  

This looks to be a fun place to hang later in the evening.  We were there with the work day lunch crowd which really started filtering in as we were leaving.  

A fun and tasty stop.  I would try this place again.
Not bad long island iced tea was good but the nachos didn't have much topping on them not near enough chicken
Food is amazing. If you ever get down here check out this place. Nothing is bad on the menu prices are reasonable service is awesome ask for Kelsey

First off i'll start with that the food here was delicious!  Great italian food and the service was great.  Pretty easy to find and inside has a very nice relaxed feel to it.  All the good we ordered was great.  The lasagna was huge and tasted great.  Only negative is that parking is hard to find they have valet for 10 dollars which is prob your best bet.  Enjoy!

Love love love this place! What a nice little treasure to find. Fast and friendly service, great atmosphere, outdoor seating on the patio in the back and front, nice decor inside, and of course the food was delicious! We ordered specialty drinks Drunk Geisha and Summer Splash. The drinks were perfectly balanced with flavor and alcohol. We had the appetizer of Tam Yum Goon which was similar to crab rangoon but much better quality! And the sweet chili sauce that went with it was to die for. We each got Pho which is a broth with your choice of noodle and protein, bean sprouts, cilantro, spicy peppers, basil and seaweed. You got to add the ingredients  to it with as little or as much as you wanted. We left full and happy and with some leftovers. I highly recommend this place if you like Asian cuisine. We were also told there is live music on the weekends!

The story you are about to read is true.

7:22 pm. My partner and I are in town moving in a convention. As we head through the warehouse district looking for our hotel, I can't help but think of home. The streets in this part of town are a maze of one way streets. Coming from the convention center requires us to drive around the block before we can approach the hotel going the right direction. Fortunately our GPS gets us through.

The driveway has enough room for maybe four cars if everyone is considerate. The lobby is small, but the employee behind the front desk is nice enough. She gives us our room keys and lets us know that the parking lot is across the street. (We don't find out until much later that parking is $18 per day in these parts)

I'm on the first floor in a small apartment like room. There is an efficiency kitchen complete with refrigerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher. A door leads back to the bedroom, closet and bathroom area. The room is clean and tidy but one small piece of advice. If you are staying in an odd numbered room on the first floor, your room is at street level next to the sidewalk. The curtain blocks out the peepers but doesn't do much for the street noise and occasional gang of revelers wandering from one watering hole to the next.

All in all, not a bad place to stay. I've been in much worse, but also much better. Convenient for a convention (three blocks away) but a bit of a hike for the French Quarter if you're here to party.
Jennifer Ellison and the staff at Summit did a great job and got our refinance done quickly with no hassles. Start to finish in under 30 days, just like they said.

I am giving one star because I can't give zero stars. 
Pizza is good,  but so not worth the pain you have to suffer through to eat it there. 
This place is sooooo loud.  Filled with many large parties. None of whom have learned to use their indoor voices.  People talking loudly, even yelling. Ill-l behaved kids running around. Screaming and yelling.
The acoustics in the place also contribute to the intense noise.
Our most recent, and last-never-to-return-again visit, found this place to be so loud that I had to shout to make myself heard to the hostess.
We asked to be seated outside because of the noise inside. 
It had just finished raining,  so the outside table  and chairs were wet. The hostess brought us outside,  placed  menus on the table,  then left saying she would have someone come out to wipe down the chairs and table. 10 min later,  no one came out to help us with that.  We left. 
Won't ever be back.  We WILL Tell everyone we know not to go there if you want to have an enjoyable neal where you can converse in a normal,  conversational tone.

Excellent downtown happy hour place!  Burgers, excellent; calamari, awesome; Caesar salad...ok, the salad was a little strange.  The presentation was impressive--uncut bunches of endive lettuce with Caesar-y topping and fresh anchovies--but as it turns out, having everything cut up into little chunks makes sense for proper dressing allocation.  Still, an enjoyable meal was had by all.

Jerry's State Court Cafe gets four stars from me because of its big effort to provide a gluten free menu. The gluten free menu is huge - pancakes and toast for breakfast and a huge variety of sandwiches for lunch and dinner. There is also a gluten free Benedict that I need to go back and try. My kids loved getting gluten free pancakes off the breakfast menu, pretty much never happened before! The country omelet was pretty good and the bacon was crisp, can't go wrong there. There's tons of seating (the old Elmer's on Fairview) for the many people who seemed to be crowding into the place.

This hip little joint is the first restaurant on The Hill that my husband and I tried when we first moved to STL. One year later it is still the only restaurant we have been to on the Hill. The food is amazing and the staff has always been super friendly. We haven't found anything on the menu that we don't like. Definitely a place we will continue to visit.

I was referred to this company from my son for he had used them in the past. I sent in a quote request and when I received the quote I wanted to book it.  I called 3 separate phone numbers all being answered by voicemail stating it was purple people movers. I called several times leaving messages for which I didn't even receive a courtesy call back.  I then went to their email and over a span of 3 days I sent at least 4 emails all of which went unanswered except one that said he had sent me a message.  that was not TRUE for no where in my emails files was there any message other than the original quote.  based on this my opinion of this company is very poor for they lack the professionalism and common courtesy of getting back to a potential customer, wasting that persons time all while trying to book a good moving company!!!!  DO NOT EXPECT KINDNESS FROM THEM!!!!

This place is absolutely amazing!  First time ever in Arizona and I am in love with Mimi's Cafe.  From the moment we walked in, everyone was so pleasant.  My boyfriend and I waited a little bit but it was worth the wait.  We started off with mango mimosas and it was refreshing.  They also brought out bread with cinnamon madelines (I think they were cinnamon). I ordered the Bacon Avocado Omelet with a pumpkin muffin YUM!  My boyfriend had the Santa Fe Omelet with also a pumpkin muffin.  The omelet was perfectly made and the potatoes were well seasoned.  The service was great!  Our server was super sweet and attentive and knew the menu very well and even gave great recommendations.  She also gave us at the end a piece of cake they were promoting for free!  I was very pleased with my whole experience at Mimi's very!  Will absolutely come back when in the West Coast!

My wife and I have been here twice now. The food has all been great. The pork chop and the burgers were both delicious and the restaurants has a great vibe.
Highly recommend it.

Stopped in for coffee and wifi and had a great time. Friendly staff, delicious coffee and pastry, I used Xfinity wifi so idk about theirs. I was able to sit on the front porch and charge my laptop while enjoying my breakfast!

My husband and I are here to visit some family as well as to just simply spend some time together away from reality.  We stopped at say light to rewrap our broken window that we plan to get replaced when we get back home. Al and other employee were so helpful and quickly helped us out with the job. So freakin nice and quick.. definitely recommend this location!
Kathy is the best waitress ever! We had a blast at dennys after a night out! Without her it wouldn't have been nearly as good! Thanks Kathy for the great service and hospitality!
Steak with Lobster Ravioli...steak just OK ravioli REAL BAD all for $20 bucks I think..6 oz steak...overpriced and just not very good at all.

First visit to Peg's. The place was small but popular so it was pretty crowded. Staff got us seated right away. I ordered bacon and eggs, which was cooked perfectly. 

Only complaint was both me and hubby's toast was cold and rock hard when it was delivered to us. I saw that it was pre-toasted and sitting under the warmer with 20 other pieces. Would have rather waited another minute for fresh, warm toast. Also, both meals only came with one piece of toast. I've never seen that before - seemed cheap.
Josh is the best bartender in New Orleans. Thanks for the Sazeracs, oysters and gator. Definitely the best gator we had all week. Til next time...

Their Andouille Crusted Fish is to die for. Best I've ever had. Perfect taste was a sign of a caring chef with a touch of love. Also can't forget how caring were the staff. A real two thumbs up for me!

Red Robin has great food and prices. If you join their rewards program, you get a free burger on your birthday. They have delicious milkshakes and adult beverages. I've always had decent service and quality food.

In the first 20 minutes I had 2 drinks spilled on me, front and back. I have been here for a bridal shower, baby shower, and small luncheon, and have never been very impressed. I had a vegetarian pasta dish, it was drenched in oil. "Upscale", but not good food, by any means.

Suiting from LA, came to eat here. Service and ambience was good. The Oysters Rockefeller were burned and a long curly hair was nestled in the spinach. Gross. My shrimp creole was mediocre. Nothing to rave back home about.

I married into an incredibly picky Vietnamese family, and we came here and absolutely LOVED their pho. Wow. Amazing. We all agreed - their broth was amazing (most importantly), meat was high quality, egg rolls were excellent, and every sauce did not disappoint. And absolutely best of all was our waitress - she was THE BEST! She accommodated our every need. (She has dark hair & glasses & served us last night.) Thank you so much!

The food is typical Wendy's. My issue is with the poor management in being able to produce a restaurant that can serve even a minimal amount of guests in a timely fashion. There was only one person upfront and she had to take orders and serve the finished foods. This made it so incredibly slow. There were only six people in line and we waited for almost 20 minutes. Talk about fast food. In addition, in plan view of the window you could see large amounts of food dropped on the floor. I can't blame the employees,  but only the incredibly poor manafeme

Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmore please?? I was a dirty boy tonight ordering this penne pasta, DO NOT tell my trainer. This little spot is one of Santa Barbara's biggest secrets, and let me tell ya...it's a must visit. Do yourself a favor and grab a bite at Arnoldi's Cafe. I'm John Stewart.


-John

Very happy that management went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with our experience. If you have any problems, Farris Hamdan is amazing, and the sales consultant Thomas Zanios was wonderful.
Don't buy flooring from here. It took me talking to three guys before I could actually get the info I needed for the male sales clerk. Too much of an ordeal for me to repeat that again.

Jessica has been styling my hair for over 5 years. She does an amazing job and I always get so many compliments on my hair styles. I have a special needs daughter and Jessica is always so patient with her and does a fantastic job.
Ulta is a bit more pricey but I believe you get what you pay for and I'm worth it :)

Went back into o'charley's was told they closed at 8pm their was about 20 cars trucks in the parking lot I didn't pay him no attention since it was 815 pm he said look pal I'm serious we are closed I ended going across the street to mcdonalds as of 9 30pm their are still about 10 cars in the parking lot..I was their earlier and had no problems this restaurant..but since I don't like to argue with people I decided just to post here instead

Hip ping pong bar with great cocktails. Tables will fill up in advance its best to make reservations. We did see some parties reserve the red room and another area with DJs and their own waiters. Loved the banksy like art and variety of drinks served.
This place is disgusting. There were flies all over the sushi. I think that's enough to justify a 1-star review.

My Husband gave me a Birthday Dinner Celebration  on February 2 , 2019 .  We sat inside , however we took many pictures on the balcony. Very beautiful site . Service was great . Food was amazing. Anika did a excellent job taking care of the Birthday Queen , Hubby and our Friends. Anika , Thank you .

Edley's was recommended by a local during our visit to Nashville. Having grown up on the south, this is hands down THE BEST BBQ EVER!  

When we arrived, their power had been out and had just barely come on. They had told us that it might be a little bit of a wait to cook our food and to pay. However we had our food within 10 minutes.

I had the special of the day, which was a barbecue pork sandwich with grilled peaches, called Sweet Georgia Brown.  My husband had the hot chicken platter. Both were amazing. The plug of coleslaw had an amazing sweet vinegar taste, nothing I have ever had before. The grits casserole were amazing with the Gouda cheese base, jalapeños, pepper and onion. They were definitely a must try. The baked beans melted in your mouth.  We also had drinks from the bar. My husband had a Mohito which was quite tasty. But my bourbon cocktail was something that made you feel like you were sitting on an old porch in a rocking chair, sipping from an old Mason jar. To end our night, we shared a piece of pecan pie which tasted just as good as my mom's homemade pie.

Not only was the food absolutely delicious, but the service was quick, even with their power outage, friendly and above superior. In fact, when we went back up to pay, the manager whoever was in charge, told us that we did not need to pay and thanked us for our patients. I would have gladly have paid twice as much as what our final bill was. It was something I would definitely return to and would recommend to all locals and anyone passing by the area. You do not want to miss this taste of southern deliciousness heaven.

Dr Judy, dr Randy, and dr Gerry are the best I'm so pleased that I have gotten the opportunity to go there . The staff are so friendly as are everyone there . I promise you that you will leave feeling much better. Please give them a try .

For whatever reason I gave this pharmacy a second chance. No more. I went in 3 weeks ago transferred all my prescriptions. I get texted they are ready go into store and they say nothing is there. Today the text says they are sending it back because I don't pick up. So I call and the most obnoxious rude woman informs me my prescriptions all went to other pharmacy. Apparently it's all my fault because they did not transfer as requested. Same nonsense different day. I dont want to go somewhere that I am treated like this. No thank you. They need a better staff in this store.

How could you go wrong with Creole Creamery ice cream and French Truck coffee?!  You're thinking that you could just go to those places and you should but you have to come here for their varieties only sold at Drip Affogato!  

I tried the flight and shared it with my wife.  You can read about it in a dozen reviews but let me just say that it was revelatory and a lot of fun.  I had never had affogato before last night.   I liked the way the dish changed as the ice cream melted.  I wish I had a bigger spoon because I just wanted to gobble it.

Everyone there is really helpful and super friendly.  The pastries are from Gracious.  Best croissants in New Orleans.  All the pastries are a closeout price of $1 after 6pm.  You need to check this place out!

A few months ago was the first time I went to this salon. I have high expectations and they exceeded and beyond! 
The salon was easy to get to and most importantly nice and clean. The owner was so friendly and extremely knowledgable. She had the most reasonable prices within the surrounding areas. I had the Japanese treatment done, which is a hair straightening. This process is long and extremely dangerous if you don't know what you are doing. No worries here!!! They did a tremendous job from start to finish!! I also had my hair trimmed which I loved as well :)
Friendly and efficient service. The food was fresh and delicious. The table side pour over was on point.

We used to love this place, I don't know what happened... I asked them if they had new ownership or a different cook but they assured me that the totally burnt Shanghai Rice was a "rice problem" not the "chef's" fault... He offered us 50% off the rice dish that we left on the table and only took one bite each out of...? (Shocked) 
The broccoli that accompanied the walnut shrimp had begun to mold and had mushy parts... 
The Shanghai dumplings that you wait 20-25 minutes for them to prepare were dry on the inside and just a mushy and sticky mess... 
So very sad, because we used to love this place!! I don't think that we will be returning...
It was Very good first time there was Saturday food was excellently  , will be going back again.

ATTENTION VETERANS do not support this dealership.  I drove over two hours to try and purchase a vehicle here and what they promised on the phone and what happened when I got to the dealership were two different things.   

First they removed the window sticker from the car and tried to tell me the MSRP was different.  Secondly they claim to honor USAA certified car buying pricing and they flat out refused to honor the certificate that I presented them.  Finally, I tried to negotiate with them because we had driven so far and when they came back they made it look like they gave me a deeper discount but changed the price on the car again.  

I found my experience there as a veteran insulting as they treated me like I was some kind of idiot.  The salesman even called the next day and asked if we had bought a car yet.  I told him no because we spent all evening driving back.  I told him I have never been treated so poorly and manipulated by a car dealer in my life.  He said he was sorry they couldn't earn our business.  Folks, they didn't try to earn my business.  They tried to rip off a disabled veteran and his family.  Stay away from this place.

The owner is total d*ck and doesn't care about his customers. His prices are off the roof. You can order everything online for half the price. Avoid like the plague. Walmart is better then this place.

I feel the bottom if my heart has been pulled from my chest...I trusted this folks only after 9 months by chance I found out I was charged an extra 800.00 for services I didn't need. ..you know guys it's getting to point you cannot trust anyone...calls have been made all I'm hearing are excuses people trying to defend their employees and I'll get back to you in a week or 2 
#very #Hurt....

My wife and I have been here twice.  We love this place!  The Philly Wontons are awesome.  I just cannot say enough good things about some of the creativity of the chef!  Chimmichuri?!  In Nashville?!  YES PLZ!  The turkey burger was REALLY good.  I say this as a turkey burger snob.  I really feel that more don't do it right.  Braiz got it.  It comes with Adobo Mayo, but I also added the Chimmichuri and WHAT A COMBO!  Their Jerk Chili is some seriously good Chili.  Very different from the normal stuff you see everywhere.  One of the big surprises is the Buffalo Alfredo pasta.  Who knew?!  This is why I give 5 stars to this place.  The Chef and his creativity.  

A couple of negatives: Décor.  Definitly needs some work.  But I do NOT do to a place to look around.  If I were to do that, I wouldn't expect much out of the food.  But there are lots of folks who do, so Braiz could work on this to ensure a good, and solid customer base.  One food related gripe.  The salad.  My wife's side salad was Caesar.  When you order a Caesar, You expect a nice bed of Romaine, with shaved Romano or parmesan, croutons and dressing.  This hit all those points, except for one.  Iceberg lettuce.  My Turkey burger had Romaine lettuce on it, so I'm not sure why the Caesar salad did not.  Minor, but valid.

I still feel that the heart of any 5 star rating rests with the chef.  Obviously other factors play in, and the couple negatives I have mentioned are minor enough to me that they do NOT overshadow the eclectic brilliance of the Chef.

Kudos to Braiz!

We love the tamales, especially when getting them takeout. We hardly ever cook for company anymore, just pick up a family pack and we're good. Everyone has always asked about and complimented the food. The basmati rice salad goes well with tamales.

Decent thin crust pizza with a good array of toppings.

I opted for design your own and went with peperoni, smoked ham, meatballs, italian sausage, mushrooms, and fresh basil all on a spicy red sauce..  You can choose as many toppings as you like for less than $12.

The price can't be beat.  As others have mentioned, it's a bit of a Subway for pizza.. but with better toppings.  

The crust itself was good, but a bit on the chewy side.  Which is still better than the ultra thin soggy mess you get at a certain other 'famous' chain.

They're licenced too, and offer a handful of beers and whatnot.

I'd go back I think.

Great food, had baked oysters to start then a meat & cheese plate & finally our delicious main dish, well my Scottish salmon was very tasty but my husbands & best friends steak frites were really a tough piece of meat. The atmosphere of the restaurant was very chaotic. Not very relaxing at all & noise level was very high. I enjoyed the restaurant but probably wouldn't frequent the place.

So this experience started out bad... The wait time in the drive through was crazy, more than 15 minutes. I called in to see what was happening and spoke to "Matt" and explained the situation, that they have an entirely new staff and everyone was about 3-4 days old. I can sympathize with that. Especially since they managed to get my order correct. The new people were friendly and the food was hot and correct, topping it off with Matts professionalism is what made this a 4 star review. We will give this location another shot!

This place is so yummy! Service is always great. The sushi tastes great. The fried ice dessert is divine. It's a super cute layout too. I've gone with my hubby for date night or with our two young boys. We sat on the front patio with our kids. It was a nice summer evening. I recommend this place to people as my new go to sushi restaurant.

My girlfriend and I tried City Winery for a Griffin House show in mid-November one Wednesday night. Mostly we wanted to see the new concert behemoth of SoBro (I still hate the name SoBro). 

First off, the atmosphere. This place is beyond superlatives beautiful and tasteful, all at the same time. They've made it obvious it's a nicer place without overwhelming the concert-goer seeking to just enjoy a show with a nice glass of wine. They'll start making their own wine here in 2015 so we'll be interested to go back and see even more of this gorgeous venue.

The wine. I'm just starting to understand different types of wines and an amateur at best in describing what I want in a wine. The waiter was well-trained and did not lead us astray when we were making our selection from the multiple wines on tap, available for a glass, and those available by a bottle. We tried a couple of these before we left and weren't disappointed. 

The food. It was good, not great. I had the leg of lamb pizza, which was tasty with a good mix of spices, crunchy pine nuts, and melty cheese. She got the Chicken Fricassee which was good but reminded me of much less expensive items I've had elsewhere. The food was tasty and good to munch on during a show or for dinner. I'm probably going to have dinner elsewhere the next time we visit City Winery, however.

Pros: Amazing building and predictably great wine selection.

Cons: Food was kind of expensive and didn't blow me away. The parking was pretty terrible. They offered paid valet or you can park on the streets, which is not the best option in this neighborhood.

Overall: This a relaxing, romantic place to take a date for a concert. You will win friends  and influence people if you bring someone from out of town in for a concert. If you can stand the parking situation and high-priced food, you'll be elated to make this spot one of your regulars!
I come here for the wings, burgers and Spanish French fries, those items never disappoint. Great beer selection as well!

This is going to be my new library. This location has everything in stock from kids books and moives to the latest novel. Came here to actually vote but i decided to take look around and see what they had to offer. I was greedy by the receptionist and soon as i passed her there were tons and tons of books. So i immediately went to the kids section for my kids and there were lots and lots option. I was over whelmed. I ended up checking out 2 books. Plus they have many many computers Awesome Library!!!

I have eaten here a few times. They have done a good job in getting it spruced up from what it was. Breakfast special at $1.99 can't be beaten. 2 eggs, hash browns, toast, coffee. Tip $2. Ate dinner here on a week night. Everyone likes to cluster at the bar or on the Hi-tops. I had the Coneys and they were good, especially for a Chicago girl. Hope they make it. Staff is friendly and they bust it to make your experience a pleasure.

Convinced my dad to leave the place we were at to come eat here and you made me look like a genius . The food and everything involved is 10/10. Incredible all around. Turchettis is amazing. Highly recommend

Only the best calzones in St Louis! I eat out a lot, usually at least 10 meals a week. I have tried hole in the walls and the very finest in dining. In all my eating out in St Louis, I have never found such large and delicious calzones. I have eaten here three times and every time is better than the last. The calzones are always stuffed full of your toppings. They really stuff them full. The cheese is so fresh and delicious. Their sauces are delicious too. I haven't found a calzone better than I find here.

Great early bird ... otherwise lines were way too long after. But Much needed is more and I Mean More porta potties... too many people in line to pee!!! The tastes were fabulous and I brought several noobs to the fest but there main complaint was restrooms and long lines.   I want this festival to succeed but there needs to be better organization of tents and spread out so lines are not so long.. I got the expensive early bird and it was worth the less hassle .. at the beginning..although the lines at the exclusives were so long it wasn't worth it.... please take some notes and more relief stations... that is truly a "no brainer" I am not sure my noobs will be back.  The Columbus fest seems to have it down .::no lines and plenty of restrooms... looking forward to that Sept 30!!!!

About a year and a half ago I made the move from Long Island to Philly. This was the first bar I ventured out to and still continue to go on a regular basis. The food here is awesome and if you go for happy hour it is cheap!!! The music is great too!! Downstairs they have acoustic music and upstairs there is bluesy music. I also have gotten to know a lot of the bartenders and they are all great! 
I moved to Philly and fell in love.

After ten years as Executive Chef for the Century Hospitality Group, Chef Paul Shufelt decided it was time to start up a restaurant of his own. The Workshop Eatery officially opened a couple weeks ago in The Mosaic Centre, Canada's largest net-zero commercial building. Choosing to open up in a sustainable building definitely poses its challenges, but supporting local producers, sustainability, and using seasonal produce are concepts important to Chef Paul. 

The Workshop Eatery is located in the far south neighborhood of Summerside, which can be a fair drive for many in Edmonton. But once you enter the building you're greeted by an open space and living wall, which shows how unique and beautiful the Mosaic Centre really is. As for the restaurant, you're greeted into a space that is warm, rustic and inviting. I love the open concept and the visibility of the kitchen - there's nothing to hide! 

Throughout the different seasons, the menu will consist of roughly 20 staple dishes and a different feature each day. What makes the menu seasonal will be the different accompaniments and sides to a main dish. If you're ever wondering what's on the menu on a particular day, just check the website! It's amazing that they will be updating their online menu daily! 

We started off our meal with a couple of appetizers, first up was the Arancini ($12). The arancini at Workshop changes daily, and the "New York Deli" arancini with deli meats, a balsamic tomato smear, and Nefiss Lazizz Olive Oil was the feature for the day. These fried risotto balls had a golden, crisp exterior, and broke open to reveal a creamy mix of risotto, green peas, and small morsels of meat. I personally prefer my arancini to be rich and cheesy, so these arancini didn't quite deliver for me. 

Next up came the Chicken Liver Parfait ($11) served in a small mason jar with crostinis made from Bon Ton Bakery's Cranberry Raisin Nut Bread. The liver was whipped with a mousse-like texture and topped with a port and Saskatoon berry jam.
