It was a perfect balance between sweet and savoury, and I loved the different textures that the crostini added to the mixture.

Our last starter for the meal was the Duck Carpaccio ($17) featuring Moosewood Acres cured duck breast, pickled shiitakes, carrots, daikon, a soy reduction and blood orange vinaigrette. I really enjoyed the fragrant orange paired with the duck, and the tang of the vinaigrette, but found that the dish was much too salty. Typically a carpaccio dish features meat that is extremely thinly sliced or pounded thin, but the duck in this carpaccio was thickly sliced. The thick slice combined with the soy reduction was quite salty, so with some adjustments to the cut and seasoning, I would really enjoy this dish!

Just like the arancini, The Workshop Eatery has a feature dish each evening. On the night of our visit Tangle Ridge Lamb Chops were being served with a butternut squash, corn and bacon hash. The lamb chops were moist and tender, and looked beautiful against the brightly coloured hash. The hash itself was naturally sweet but lacking in smokiness which we expected from the bacon. As it turns out, we didn't find much bacon in the hash either, so that could have accounted for the discrepancy. 

For myself I ordered the Duck Duck Couscous (how fun is that to say?!) ($32) which featured beautifully seared Moosewood Acres duck breast on a bed of warm couscous with raisins, almonds, pickled cherries and vanilla parsnip puree. The duck was cooked to a perfect medium, and the lightly sweet couscous was a great companion to the duck. The parsnip puree was also a delightful addition to the dish, and complemented both components on the plate. Although I love lamb, the duck was definitely the winner for me and I would happily order it again. 

When it came down to the desserts, I was torn between two options. The panna cotta at The Workshop Eatery is made with the rooftop honey and would have been my first choice, but I couldn't resist the Croissant Bread Pudding ($9). The flaky croissant pieces are paired with white chocolate and cranberry, giving this dessert some tart notes to balance the sweet. Topped with a generous scoop of Pinocchio's cinnamon ice cream, this was a comforting dessert that I would eat again. 

Taken as a whole, we had a great dinner at The Workshop Eatery: our dishes were good and the service was attentive. If there's one thing I love about The Workshop Eatery, it's their commitment to sustainability and supporting local producers. Their decision to move into the Mosaic Centre means that the drive to their restaurant is long and far for many patrons, but the principles of the building align with the values of the restaurant. It's great to see so many local farmers mentioned throughout the menu, and I think it will be interesting to see how things shift once the growing season in Edmonton comes around.

I tried district tavern before a show at Amalie arena. My friends and I ordered Moscow mules which were delicious! We also split a variety of appetizers. The grilled cheese dippers with tomato soup shots were my favorite, but they were all very good. The night we went was super busy, so the service was a little slow, but the manager jumped in to make sure that we got served a little quicker which was nice. I will certainly return to district tavern!

First of all, we rode SCOOTERS to get here from our hotel. Second, the food was incredible. But most importantly, the staff went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable.

Our waiter Adam was attentive and funny without being overbearing, and the manager even stopped by twice--once to ask how things were and a second time to bus our plates when things got busy.

They split two of our shared dishes and plated them separately without a special request (the street corn and the paella, both of which were stupendous). And the lamb empanadas were smoky with chorizo and roasted tomatoes. Adam said they were everything you wanted from Hot Pockets but never got, and he was right. But like, in a very elevated nouveau cuisine kind of way. They were nothing like Hot Pockets, but everything like awesome.

10/10, would scooter here again.
I've been going here for years.  Louis is the best. Everyone I've encountered there has been very friendly. Great atmosphere

I have never in my life received such poor service. I walked into the establishment at 9:40PM, after having instructed to "seat myself" by a sign at the door. Once we found a table, I was passed by several servers during a 10 minute time period. After 15 minutes of waiting, the server that was assigned to our section and table came out of the kitchen chewing and eating.
Once we flagged him down, we stated that we were ready to order. He then informed us that the kitchen as closed. 

When we asked, "When did the kitchen close?" His reply was: "When you all walked in." I then explained to the server that we had been sitting here for 15 minutes, which he then confirmed, as he stated that he had walked passed us twice. Yet, he never approached our table. I would hate to think that as the only Black patrons in the building that night that it was race related. When we asked to speak to a manager, the manager looked at us and never approached our table. 

This establishment refused to serve us after waiting for several minutes with no service. It is not an inclusive establishment. Being blocks away from historic North Nashville where many people of color reside, this establishment continues to show us the horrors of gentrification. The experience was disgusting and I'm disappointed. 

--Dr. B

We are in the area on a short trip and ordered delivery. 

Positives: delivery was fast! And the food was hot and has fresh ingredients. 

Negatives: no flavor... the pad Thai was bland and there was no option to make it spicy on the Postmates app we used. I would have liked the option or at least a couple crushed red pepper packets. 
The crab Rangoon has HONEY MUSTARD FILLING!!?? My husband and I both did not like them and couldn't finish them. It is not traditional and when you're craving the traditional taste it is quite disappointing. This should be disclosed.

I'm overseas repairing with Super Glue, for the third time this year, the pieces of junk frames I bought at Lesco's last year for about $400 because no local optometrist thinks it worth the effort.  

I went to Lesco based on recommendations just like these on Yelp.  I accept responsibility for falling for Lesco's bait and switch sales technique, but not for the poor quality of the frames I bought at designer prices. Lesco advertises very low prices and delivers very low quality glasses, whatever the price you pay.

"Something for nothing" is never a trustworthy appeal.  Now I go by a different slogan:  "Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice..."  There is no twice.  Never again will I shop at Lesco's.

Island Style food in Reno, yes please. Found this place and loved it. They have this crack chicken (Mochiko chicken) and it was the Bomb. The bento plates were amazing, reminds me of home(Oahu). Come and check them out. You will not be disappointed. 5 STARS.

I'm a little torn with this review! The food overall was pretty tasting but the portion size was pretty small for the price. I got avocado toast, eggs benedict, and strawberry French toast. 

The eggs benedict were the best. Eggs perfect consistency, although the Hollandiase sauce started separating by the time I got home. I did have a 15 min drive and the food was probably sitting for a good 10mins before I picked up too. 

The avocado toast was 1 piece of toast, with a really meager smear of avocado(like the amount that you would spread for butter on toast). The turkey bacon and egg was good. But that was it. A little lacking for the price that you pay for it. 

The strawberry French toast cost $1.50 more than the regular French toast but all I got was some sliced strawberries. She had asked if I wanted fresh strawberries or the strawberry sauce, so I knew what I was getting for the fresh strawberries but I thought there would be more pizazz. On the bright side, the French toast was yummy.

Fish is a hard sell in Alberta.  Pride in Alberta beef (mediocre in my opinion) and distance from the coast play a part in neglecting this healthy protein option.  When I received a great coupon for this particular Joey's, I was reminded that we do like our fish in this house.  We intended to go there with another couple but sickness meant that we were only two that Saturday.

If location is everything, Joey's is at a disadvantage.  It's hard to see from the street - I recommend using a GPS to locate.  The entrance is also difficult to access because of a concrete walled patio (useless on a cold winter night.  Once inside, the restaurant is roomy, well-lit with a large screen TV on the north wall for those addicted to Hockey Night in Canada.  The staff are friendly and service is initially quick.  My only quibble with the service is that I had to go to the kitchen to ask for coffee and dessert when we were finished our mains.  We never know how we feel about dessert until we finish the first course.  However, the owner served coffee/tea and dessert as well as took our payment.  The waiting staff seemed to be busy with cleaning up, which made us fell slightly rushed.

How was the food you ask?  My wife had the halibut with mashed potatoes, pronouncing the mash great but the halibut too dry.  I must take her word for it because I learned to dislike mashed because that was the only way my father wanted potatoes served and because I ordered the endless shrimp plate.  I was full with the single serving so I couldn't sample my wife's halibut (which disappeared despite the bad review) or eat any more shrimp.  For dessert, we shared the mud pie, delicious.

The coupon worked because we plan another visit some time in the future.

Not one to write reviews but this was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Service and food were terrible. We were sat quickly on the rooftop tonight which was nice. We were sat a table with no salt and pepper or silverware just menus.. okay.. so my boyfriend and I start browsing the menu and pick drinks and our food since no one came up to us for 10 minutes. Our waiter comes by with water and drops a drink menu then runs away. Awesome. Wait another 10 minutes and he finally comes back. My boyfriend orders a beer they didn't have which was fine so he got something different. I ordered a lemonade and they were out of it so I ordered a root beer instead and what do you know they're out of that too. No big deal I just got a coke. We order our food and wait for our drinks. 5 minutes goes by, no drinks but our appetizer of calamari came out quickly and the food runner just drops it. Mind you we still have no plates or silverware but we eat it anyway. Calamari was super plain the menu said it came with stuff on it and it literally came with nothing but marinara. Then our food comes out. I got a ny strip steak and my boyfriend got a pineapple chicken sandwich. When I say Applebee's could of made better food I'm not kidding. I had to go up to the server who was completely non existent this whole time and ask for salt and pepper after the hostess finally brought silverware. Not once did he ask if we needed anything or how anything was. If we wanted another drink. Nothing. I waitress for a living and could see it was busy but that's literally no excuse for how horrible the service was. Both the tables next to us were complaining that he wasn't acknowledging them at all. Only positive was the food coming out quickly but it wasn't even good at all. Definitely will never be back a waste of 65 dollars.

Today we went to Drago's to celebrate our son's graduating from UNO.We wanted to have a special lunch to celebrate such a special occasion.Going to Drago's was awesome,the food was on point.We had the  charbroiled oysters and spinach dip as our appetizers and they were both fabulous.The charbroiled oysters will bring a happy tear to your eyes. My husband had the oyster poboy and enjoyed every bite.Our son had the Seafood pasta dish and I had a huge grilled shrimp salad.James our waiter was very attentive and friendly.We chatted for a few minutes,he told us that he has One Semester left in college.Best to you James!!The gentlemen that brought us our food was as well very friendly,he as well engaged us in a friendly conversation.Our son humored me by wearing his graduation cap.The owner Mrs.Cvitanovich came by our table and congratulated our son.She couldn't have been more lovely to our family!She even gave our son a T-shirt,saying it's something that they do for graduates.The food at Drago's was delicious from the appetizers to the entrees.The time that was taken by staff to connect with us was priceless!!Thank you Drago's!!!DW and Family   I forgot to mention that Drago's has done a great job in table spacing...Considering everything that's going on due to The Coronavirus,thank you to all the business for doing their best in keeping customers and employees as safe as possible!

Sloppy!  It's not holiday season but the store looked a mess!  Stuff was on the floors, not folded, hangers askew, a mess!  I have worked retail, even at Old Navy, so I know that this is store neglect. Bad look.
The views and location are perfect, however the food and the interior need some remodeling.

Not going to be a favorite for me.  Pretty food but not good. Very pricey, slow service. The place is beautiful but loud.  We have traveled throughout the states and other countries. Until last night we had never been charged for bread!
Of course it didn't help that the valet couldn't find our car keys.

I know that I do not need to give any review for this chain restaurant, because I have never wanted to go here anyway. However, we decided to go to this place with my in-laws because we thought it could please everyone (adults and children) and it was one of the few family style restaurants in the West side of town. We have been avoiding dining at Olive Garden for at least 7 years, and now I know we should have gone to another Italian restaurant. 

Their menu is quite extensive and very similar to other Italian restaurants, such as calamari, pizza, spaghetti, salad, chicken or pork scaloppini etc. Everything sounded good in the menu and the pictures looked very enticing.  However, nothing tasted right, and in almost all of their entrees, they have added cheese to their dishes which means extra creamy and FAT. YUCK! Their  kids cheese pizza did not taste good either. The only thing that is fresh is their Garden Salad. The service is good. The price is not cheap for the quality of their food. 

We will cross out Olive Garden from the list...FOREVER.

Suppa had one of the more interesting offerings for Restaurant Week, which is why my wife and I found here on a Friday evening in August 2015. The restaurant had seating outside and being a nice evening, we preferred that option.

Looking through the menu, we decided that one of us would go for the Restaurant week offering while the other of us would order ala carte from the menu. It was nice to have that option and I think not all restaurants have that option when a RW is in progress. The RW menu we chose consisted of crab fritters, mac n' cheese, ricotta cavatelli, and choice of a dessert item. It was nice of them to also include a beverage in the offering. From the ala carte menu, we went for the duck poutine and the cubano melt sandwich. 

The first comment is that the food took a long time to come out. The restaurant was quite busy on a Friday evening and we could only see one server doing the rounds. The first dish to come out were the crab fritters. They were crispy and hot but as my wife puts it, there did not seem to be any crab meat in it. I thought I had found some traces of crab when I first took a bite but I could certainly see what my wife was saying. The next two dishes to come out were the mac n' cheese and the duck poutine. Both dishes were tasty and as the poutine is not something I have often had before, I enjoyed the novelty of the dish. What surprised us were the huge portions. Even though I was very hungry, I decided to not finish all of my duck poutine and leave some room for the other things we had ordered. The cubano melt sandwich was also very nice. The bread was well toasted and the ham, pulled pork and cheese all went nicely together. The cavatelli pasta was quite flavorful too. Finally, when it came to the dessert, we were so full, we just had a cupcake to go and had it at home. 

Positives:
1. Interesting and eclectic menu.
2. Huge portions - I could have a full lunch based on what was leftover from the meal and even then there were some leftovers.
3. Reasonable prices - For what was being served, prices were reasonable.

Negatives:
1. Pretty slow service: We got in at around 9:20 p.m. and left at around 11 p.m. Certainly we were enjoying the evening and lingered on but then a part of the delay can be explained by how long it took for things to come out.
2. Waters were not refiled promptly. In one instance, my wife requested a glass of water and the waiter, absent-mindedly perhaps, just left her with a glass full of ice. It wasn't until another 5 mins. or so after we could hail the waiter that we were able to have our glasses filled.

Overall, this is the kind of place I would be very excited to have in my neighborhood. I wouldn't have the hassle of having to drive and search for parking and that would make it easy for me just to swing by for perhaps a sandwich or maybe one of their brunch items over the weekend. It is certainly a place I would like to return to.

My husband and I have lived here for almost 4 months.  We really like the apartment that we are in (they call it a townhome), but we do have some complaints about the neighborhood.  There are usually lots of children running around with their parents nowhere to be seen.  There have been times I've been woken in the middle of the night by people being loud, but that has settled some since the neighbors from two doors down moved.  There are lots of dogs in this neighborhood and lots of people that let their cats out during the day.  It is a gated community, however the gate is broken most of the time and be ready to have a lot of people call your phone when trying to enter the gate.  The system allows guests to look up names and have the system call that person to buzz them in the gate.  We get at least one call a day from this.  They have two pools: one is an indoor salt water pool (a little too warm for me) that stays open year round and an outdoor pool that is average size for an apartment complex.  Neither are usually very crowded. If we had it to do over again we would hold out for one of the townhomes on the back of the property on top of the hill.  It seems quieter and more quaint in that area.  Oh and if you have AT&T the service here sucks.  Not sure about any other carriers though.

Add wifi for public as a science museum. Place has to move to another location as they are not getting enough traffic. Too bad. They didn't build on the momentum of the science bodies of a few years ago.

Fabulous experience!! I called a few days into a week in NOLA on business. Easy online scheduling and good location. The massage therapist was wonderful. Professional and very attentive to my trouble spots. One of the best massages I've had. Will be back in my next trip.

The food is mediocre eggs and toast you Can get the same food across the street at Dennys for half the price. Service was terrible there. Trying to get my toast was like pulling teeth. This place is just an overhyped,  crowded, and not worth the wait for such a hole in the wall

Hands down the best hot dog we have ever eaten. I had the special which was a dog covered in mash potato, bacon and chives and it was to die for.
The buns are fresh alongside the ingredients and the staff are amazing. To top it off, they do an awesome mac and cheese and the prices are spot on.
Rude staff, there are too many other options in this city. The bartender actually told my friends that they wouldn't be able to afford their drinks, I guess we weren't their kind of people.

This place opened yesterday and i live in the area so i thought i would give it a try.....first issue in an area where there are quite a few breakfast options i would have expected this establishment to be on its "A" game, however the food was dismal...

The Bad:
Food - F
i order eggs benedict and as i am a vegetarian asked for spinach, tomato and mushrooms in place of the bacon....they charged me extra for each item, even though i excluded the meat, and i didn't even get what i requested, missing the spinach.   The hollandaise sauce was disgusting, not even sure it was hollandaise sauce more like white cream poured over the eggs.  The eggs were the size of quarters, not kidding and didn't even think they could be that tiny....The english muffin was soggy and the potatoes were hard and bland..all in all a pretty poor experience. 

The Good:
Service - A
I spoke with the manager regarding the my situation and he was more than understanding and accommodating.  The waitstaff is very nice and out going.  

Future:
With at least 5 different spots in the area that have fantastic breakfast options, this restaurant will have to do much better to survive...As this is there 2nd day opening i am going to return in a few weeks to try the food again.....with that being said i am giving this diner a generous 2 out 5 until i try the food again.

Best Bet was a lot of fun. When you walk in you notice right away that it's a pretty small space. There is a small area to wait by the door for a table. The owner came over to tell us where we were at in line to get a table, and to tell us a little about the menu. He was a unique guy to say the least. Obviously very friendly and passionate about his business. When we got seated we had an extremely friendly server who helped us out. The menu has a lot more of the breakfast options than lunch, and a lot more savory items than sweet. I had the biscuits and gravy which were very good. The Ava potatoes are a little different from what I like. I like a crispy potato at breakfast, and these are a bit more of a breakfast mash type of thing. All in all this was a good breakfast spot and well worth the visit.

My sister in law raves about this restaurant so we trekked all the way from NJ to Philly to try this place. I was initially skeptical, I've been to many a noodle shops in my days ranging from Taipei, HK, LA, to NYC so the bar was high. Still though I was pleasantly surprised by my meal.

First off the appetizers were different. They serve a ping pan appetizer where you can choose three appetizers. The beef tendons were rather good! I know I know, who eats beef tendons right??? But this one was different. Slice super thin, wasn't mushy, tender but still had a chewy texture to it. Their appetizer combos also come with pao chai pickled veggies that were pretty tasty.

Noodle texture: glad to report that they are indeed hand drawn! You can choose between the thin noodles and knife cut chunky noodles and the texture was chewy, just what you would expect from a hand drawn noodle

There's several beef options all of which were tender and flavorful. Try the House Special Combo, comes with a meatball that has a different stuffing/tecture. 

This restaurant also offers other appetizers such as fried mantou's with condensed milk, a slew of boba drinks, smoothies. Service was great and food was served fast! Restaurant was very clean and there are larger tables for groups along with smaller tables. 

Word of warning: we came at 130pm for lunch and it was still busy

Went there last night for dinner.  This place was awesome, all of the way around!
Island wings were amazing, mac and cheese bites, conch fritters...those were just the apps.  The wings were probably the best I've ever had!!
Blacked Salmon, Jerk Chicken, Curried Chicken, Corn Bread...this was an outstanding meal.
The waitstaff and owner could not be any nicer and eager to please.  
Can't wait to try Sunday brunch!!

We will definitely be back!!!

The most consistent destination along the South Street corridor is the eptiomy to hipster chic, with an outstanding selection of brews, a menu that never wears out its welcome, and the city's most consistently laid back staff.
Great food, great service not much more to say appetizers were so amazing my husband ordered a second set of stuffed mushrooms. We will definitely be back

Ordered an big party size lasagna. My family loved it so much they talked about it for days. It was so good and fresh. Pizza is also fresh and yummy. I stopped eating pizza in pottstown but now that I have tried this place out I can get a pizza locally now. The people are kind and this place is very clean.

Wish I would have taken a picture.
Burrito and BBQ tempeh wrap are really good. Sides are great, the potato salad is exceptional.

Another successful year for the Festival of Nations in Tower Grove Park!  An eclectic mix of food, crafts, music and dance from across the globe.  A great opportunity to experience cuisine from over 40 different nations all in one place.  This year I got to try a Turkish gyro, a Caribbean beef pattie, some jerk chicken & rice, and a cherry empanada!!  The beef pattie had awesome flavors with just the right amount of spice, definitely the food highlight for me.  The empanada was courtesy of El Chico bakery, I will be visiting them in the near future to get more, those things are addictive!!  Great job, Festival of Nations - see you again next year.

Prince's is the real deal. You walk in, you go up to the window and order. I definitely don't suggest ordering hot chicken because it's already spicy as we ordered it normal. 

It only takes a few minutes. We went when it was packed at night so we were lucky to get a table. The old man who was our bus boy was extremely nice and told us he eats here every day. I would too! Except...probably not. 

It was good chicken. But being from Louisiana I've had much better. Even at a local drive thru chain. But this is the best I've had outside of Louisiana so I give them props for that.

I've been going here since I've been very young. They have everything you need. I remember all the faces because I don't live in Philly anymore but the feel to this place is great. I always stop by every time I go home. 

Con: organization is not their greatest strength if you know what I mean. You can be digging to find what you need.

STAY AWAY - Don't expect to get the discount Clipper Magazine promises! Akio refused to honor our valid Clipper Magazine $10 discount. Presented coupon on 11/10 - VALID THROUGH 12/8 - and they refused. Argued for 5 minutes. Apparently the mistake is OUR responsibility - not THEIRS! Food wasn't worth the hassle.

Really disappointed with my experience at this location today 7-30-18 2:30pm.
My family and I were on a tight schedule and we called in our order in great detail to get it going in advance of arrival.  We were going to do a take out.  When we arrived about 30 minutes later, the order was only partially done.  We waited an additional 20 minutes and when we got out to the car, the order was wrong, and we had to go back in and wait another 10 minutes.  

It was a terrible waste of time.  The staff was a black eye on a reputable chain.

In the spirit of Cinco de Mayo, my fiancé and I decided to finally visit this spot. We were pleasantly surprised. We started off with chips and salsa, the salsa had a nice kick to it. We then had one of my favorite Mexican sides, corn on the cob with mayo, cheese, and seasoning. That alone was worth the visit. My fiancé ordered chicken flautas and I ordered the mole enchiladas. It was my first time trying dark mole sauce, and it wasn't my favorite mix of flavors but I appreciated the dish nonetheless. My fiancé's flautas were delicious with fresh salad and guacamole. 

Despite being busy, our service was phenomenal. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. At the end, there was a small mix up with our check, but it was handled quickly and very professionally. The staff was apologetic even though we weren't even upset. Things happen. 

Overall a great experience. I look forward to visiting this local spot again.
The best bubble tea in the area, especially the Thai bubble tea. Japanese green bubble tea was very milky but refreshing.
Love the atmosphere and they offer wonderful beer options. Not much for vegetarians but I manage.
Very good craft selection on draft. Staff was very knowledgeable and very helpful in beer decisions. I will definitely be back to this place.

This is a New Mexican restaurant in St Petersburg off of 4th street, very close to downtown. I went for lunch on a Saturday. Once seated, I was immediately provided complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa tasted fresh and had very good flavor. I ordered the Mexican Mule (their version of a Moscow Mule) which was absolutely delicious . It cost $13 but it was extremely big. 

For lunch I ordered the trio of tacos; chicken, asada and carnitas. All 3 needed some sort of sauce or crema. The chicken was extremely dry. The asada had very good flavor and was my favorite of the 3. The carnitas was average. I felt the tacos could have all been topped/dressed differently but instead they all were the same but for the protein. 

All in all, the place is nice, clean and close to downtown st Pete. I give it a 3 not because it's "bad" but because I simply think it's average/good. Certainly not the best Mexican food you will have;
Not even the best in st Pete. But it is good and will satisfying a Mexican craving if you have one.

The BEST Italian food I've had in the U.S.! I spent two weeks traveling through Italy and most of the food wasn't as good as that from Caffe Milano in Tucson, Arizona. I highly recommend the mussels, spinach salad with goat cheese, and spaghetti Amatriciana. Espresso after dinner is also a must.

If I could rate this place with 0 stars I would.  Let me start off by saying the experience of purchasing my dress was fine, nothing special they didn't make me feel uncomfortable but it wasn't the experience I wanted. However, the alterations department that this place is unprofessional, rude, and wants to take your money.  3 of my brides mates paid an additional 200$ for alterations on top of 220$ for the dress. They purposely order dress sizes larger to up the cost of the dress and then charge twice as much because the alterations are so dramatic. It was not only for the wedding dress but for each of the bridesmaids dresses too. Each bridesmaid was ordered a dress that was 4 sizes  or more too big. They were charged extra for more fabric and then had extra charges for alterations. The alterations ladies would alter the dress incorrectly or not enough so that additional alterations were needed. I would not  recommend they place to my enemy for weddings dress or dress shopping.

Great pizza.  Great atmosphere..best crust in town.  Staff very nice.  Owners are real attentive.   Brad , an owner,,grew up in Brooklyn and learned his trade there and learned it well.  Been there 3 times and each time was not disappointed.  The new manager ,Tony, was especially nice and accommodating.  The top Pizza maker ,Dean, is a real artisan and honored my requests and made me one of best pizzas I have ever had in Florida and been here over 40 yrs from NYC and  being an Italian I know my Apizza!!!

Meh. The staff here is unfriendly, maybe it was a culture or language barrier but they were icy and it didn't feel comfortable. The biryani portions were small, but inexpensive so I guess it balanced out. The naan was oily and thin. The channa Marsala was the best dish. All in all it was fine but forgettable. We won't be back, too many other places in the area with better Indian and friendlier service.

Ahi tuna with grapefruit is a great dish.  Tuna was very fresh and it's nice that someone serves ahi tuna with innovative accompaniment. The grapefruit goes very well with the tuna.  I've had this dish there twice.  Miguel from Mexico City is a great waiter, and my husband says they make great old-fashioned martinis (the kind with the olives). It can be windy, cold or hot out on the terrace; check the weather or ask to be seated indoors.

This is a relatively new (5 mo) brick oven pizza place. The fire is purely wood, no gas. They light it the old fashion way, with kindling and a match. I had the White Hibiscus personal 10" pizza. This pizza was as delicious as it was beautiful. Sort of a caprese meets spinach. The owners George and Bob were both there and were more than gracious hosts. They have a large wine and beer selection all reasonably priced. The rest of the menu is worthy of trying something new each time, and I intend to. The place is very comfortable with TVs, great staff, clean bathrooms and A/C to help chill out during your meal.

ummm...seriously patrick m, are you sure you actually ate at this restaurant???? i find all of your alleged accusations impossible to believe! this little restaurant does a really good job. Note to all: they do not serve alcohol, which is very rare for any restaurant in the 504....so they actually have to do a better job than anyone else in town with their food...which they do.......and they do it very well. Top favorites: great hamburger, the butter beans are to die for (almost), the chicken fried chicken, anything for dessert....you won't find any of that pre-prepared sysco crapola here! Give it a try, you won't get ripped off, you'll leave full and you will get great service!

I am from out of town but needed it washed after a long 15 hour drive. It doesn't look like much of a car wash but the guy ran out and greeted me right away. He was very nice and started on my car immediately. I only waited about 30 min. And they did a fantastic job. I stopped here due to the great reviews so I decided why not it was close to my hotel. I'm absolutely shocked that this place wasn't packed by all the wonderful reviews. It was decently priced and waiting room was very comfortable. I wish these guys were in Utah were I live. I'd be a regular. Good job guys!!

First off, I got an email that my reservation had been cancelled with no explanation. We went anyway and were thankfully seated without a problem. The noise level was horrible; I had to practically shout to be heard. We ordered a club sandwich (nice portion,) smoked salmon dip (which is delicious,) a Caesar salad, and chicken and waffles. It took about 40 minutes to get our order even though the only things that actually had to be cooked were the chicken and waffles and the fries that came with the club, and still the chicken and waffles came out cold, not lukewarm, but cold and we had to ask another server for syrup.  We sent it back and told them that they could just heat it up instead of making a fresh one; the new plate came out quickly and hot but the waffle was dense and undercooked. The family used to like going here on special occasions b/c is literally within 6 blocks of home, but this is the last time we'll take our chances. It's sad because this place had so much promise when it opened but the prices aren't worth the noise, cold food, and slow service.

A hidden gem! I've past by the little "Thai" sign off the road for over 2 months before driving in to check it out. So glad I did!  Friendly service and super yummy fresh food! And it's only 1.6 miles from home! Winner!

Update: Service still stellar. Kitchen, less so. 

I love the ravioli appetizer. The sauce with it had gone from luscious to watery. Little care is taken with the garlic spinach not to overpower the dish. 

The steak offerings have been the same for too long, and technique has suffered. My husband loves the Cowboy ribeye so when I stopped by for a solo cocktail, I got one "to go" to surprise him. There were grill marks on one side and gray nothingness on the other. This steak had not seen a broiler at all. I thought perhaps they cook it differently for take out. I inquired on my next visit and was assured it was supposed to be exactly the same. I don't mind paying a premium price for a premium steak. Premium price when I could have gotten a better sear at home in my cast iron pan? No thanks. While this is just one example, we have been unimpressed with the food and outdated menu for some time. Dry aged or grass fed beef? Nowhere to be found. I can now get prime beef at BJs. That alone isn't a selling point anymore.

I am a self-proclaimed fried chicken connoisseur and I proclaim this place being legit.  I don't care that it's a hole in the wall or that it is also inside a convenient store.  I'm writing this review about the fried chicken.  One word.  Deliciousness.  Plain and simple.  Really good and seasoned friend chicken.  Slight kick but not overwhelming.  We came here three times and brought extra for our plane ride.

I've been on a quest to find the best authentic Mexican in town. A number of close misses but finally I was encouraged to cross the bridge. I had the barbacoa, pollo and lengua tacos (my testing point for consistency ). Pollo was better than most but just ok, but the other two were fantastic. Big flavor, hot and tender. The green salsa is my new hero - perfect. I'm looking forward to exploring the non tacos next.
Courtney was amazing. She made the most amazing Bff Mac and cheese. Hard work and appreciation go a long way.

Who doesn't like to pick their own steak ? I love it! As soo as you walk in they're right there to get your menu selection off to a good start. Our server was a young man named Paul, I like him because he went out of his way to make sure that my wife and daughter were taken care of with their orders from beginning to end. When he initially came over to introduce himself and take our drink order, he knelt right beside me and my daughter looked at me and asked/stated... "Daddy, your face is saying that he committed a Man-Law Violation?! Yes, yes he did... much too close. But no points are deducted when a person is giving great hospitality and service.  Makes me wonder if everything really is BIGGER in Texas.


Let's see how the main coarse goes... 45 minutes later... So I had a 16oz sirloin and it melted like butter! Great steak! The house steak sauce was another story altogether... watered down, very bland and not a good pairing for such an amazing steak. Thanks once again to Paul for rescuing a choice steak with a bottle of A1 steak sauce.

Our appetizers were great as well, thanks Paul for the suggestion of a "Triple Treat" Potato skins, fried pickles (Amanda's favorite) and buffalo wings. My daughter loved her baked potato but was a title puzzled by the chicken tenders because they looked more like chicken nuggets.

Overall, great Job Paul! We live closer to the Wesley Chapel location but this was a great fill-in spot.

For such a highly talked about and well-known name, this is store was a sad disappointment. Animals are all in small cages and people are allowed to hold them, which is fine but the cage doors are too accessible for small children to mess around with. Store is smelly. I have even seen dead parakeets lying in the food dishes in the bird area. I feel sorry for the pets in that store.
Kind of a funky little place with good sandwiches and great portions. Decore is a little tired that you need. Good place to watch a baseball game.
Super yummy & really nice staff :) totally coming back! The young lady helping us had a smile on her face the whole time and made sure she gave me exactly what and how I wanted it

This company is the most professional Ive ever worked with. Very good rates.  They wrapped my furniture and moved it with great care. At no extra charge!! The job was twice as long as we all expected. The guys were amazing. Even took several items for me that I couldnt take with me but had to remove from the house. Flexible. Affordable. Professional. What more could you want. Made the entire move less stressful!! 
I will always recommend MVP Discount Movers!!  Keith and his team are simply the best!!
Always good when I go. Gives you free samples cups and is always happy to cut you fresh bananas lol

With the recent robbery where the store was held up at gun point, I called the store manager to ask what they were doing to improve the safety and security of their customers. The response I got was, "Who are you?"..."Why are you worried about this?"..."We're working on it." And "Don't worry about it you can call the cops if you are concerned!" I was absolutely appalled by the store managers attitude and aggression towards a customer simply asking what a store was planning on doing to ensure the safety of its customers after someone robbed them with a gun. I will no longer go to this Kroger not only because of safety concerns but also because of one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever endured.
Stopped in for lunch. Grilled shrimp po-boy and fried pickles nomnom. Great bar food and tons of beers
Always a great meal at Bandana's. We got ribs, pulled pork & chicken - all were delicious. Not to mentioned the garlic toast and you can't forget donut holes for dessert! Highly recommend

Stephen welcomed my family to Tampa last year and helped us with not only finding our home, but in the purchase and closing on the home. He willingly drove us all around Tampa helping us located the perfect home and neighborhood and made the paperwork portion and closing of our home, seamless.

This target is smaller than others. I only came here because I was looking for stuff from the bullseyes dollar section that I couldn't find anywhere. I went to like 5 different targets in the area. 

I was really happy I found some Disney rubber ducks here that I couldn't find anywhere else. I collect all different kinds of rubber ducks. The bullseye section was pretty small compared to other stores but somehow I found the ducks I was looking for both times. I don't know if no one really buys that stuff here or the staff do a really good job of restocking it. They had a lot of the Disney ducks so I was able to get 2 full sets and give some to my niece as well. 

I was also looking for peeps plush stuffed animals that I couldn't find anywhere and I ended up finding a bunch in the holiday section in the  back on the top of a shelf. 

This target never seems to be overwhelmingly crowded either with so many people trying to grab stuff from the bullseyes section. Sometimes you can barely move there's so many people over there. 

We will be back the next time I want to get some other seasonal decoration  from the bullseyes section. Haha
Nonna's is our favorite pizza in the area. Entrees, salads and desserts are even better. Run by a very sweet family - we hope Nonna's stays in this area for a long time!

Their drinks are good. But their jerked grilled chicken wings with sauce on the side is magical. I don't know who thought of them but they are well worth a visit. The restaurant is very COVID-19 safe so wear your mask and enjoy. The hostess and staff are friendly and personable. This is my go too place even late night the food is fresh and hot.

The food was really good, starting with the bread pesto and oil, house salad had good dressing, bang bang shrimp were great, crab cakes just ok, my wife loved her salmon, and my kids really liked their fish sticks. The dessert menu was limited and I wish they had a better beer selection. Our server was also really nice and on the ball.

I've always had a very positive experience coming to this bank. They are socially distancing and only allow a certain number of people so expect a short wait. The workers are SO kind- I wanted to give a big shoutout to Natalie and Evelyn! They both are very sweet, knowledgeable, and took their time with me. I would highly recommend this location. It is really nice to have such exceptional customer service- even amongst these difficult times. Great job ladies!!

We were super excited to find an Italian Deli near Indian Rocks Beach, this review COULD have been so much higher but when we ordered our sub we asked for a roast beef, extra red roasted peppers, extra fresh mozzarella and Mayo. The young man taking our order told that because we wanted a crunchy bread that sandwich would be $14 we were like fine. We also requested that part of the sandwich have just a little mayo and ham for our child. He said he would make 3/4 with roast beef and 1/4 with ham with very little mayo, said perfect. He asked if we wanted tomatoes and lettuce we said no thank you.  He hands me the sandwich with lettuce and tomato, so we said we asked no tomatoes no lettuce- he started to reply that wasn't the case. We explained one of us is allergic to tomatoes could he please remake the sandwich. He did but this why I am giving this deli 1 star if I could I would lower it!!! He obviously just wiped the lettuce and tomatoes off the sub. When someone is allergic to something they can't ingest it. So now we are on the beach and I paid over $21.47 for a sandwich that has been fingered to get the items off it and given back to us. The ham has a ton of mayo not light mayo so now I need to find a new meal to order from since we can't take the risk of an allergic reaction. This was very disappointing! I know we are specific on what we want but there are reasons why we are so specific. This sandwich is not a difficult one to make especially for an Italian Deli! Note to management / Owner you need to train your deli staff to take allergies more seriously at this place.

So what happened to this Nordstrom? Customer service is terrible, the floor (at least upstairs) is way under staffed and the staff that is on the floor is not super helpful. 
For instance I was looking for a shirt for family pictures, I wanted a navy or red wine colored shirt. When I asked the lady (from whichever section NYDJ is sold) if they had any good navy or red wine colored shirts she said "oh I'm sure there are some around, let me know if you find something and need a room". Hmmm that's not what I was hoping for. 
Then there was an older lady in the shoe dept that had no knowledge of shoes and a super attitude! It was bizarre. 
The staff that used to be there, like 4 years ago was awesome! Now it's sub-par. 
I hate to be like this but are the employees at Nordstrom aware they are there to help/serve us the customers? 
So for the time being I will be ordering my (and family's) stuff Nordstrom online and will dread the days I have to make returns. 

November 2018
I just don't understand this place. The majority of the people that work here have the worst attitude. The only ones I have encountered that don't seem to hate their job are the ones in the men's department and a few in the shoes. 
The ladies upstairs in tbd and bp are just down right pissed off at the world. I walked around with my hands full of stuff I wanted to try on for over 10 minutes, then I had to ask for a room and a lady said "yeah they are right there" pointed me in the direction-didn't grab the stuff, or help in any way. I was so annoyed at the whole situation I scanned what I wanted and ordered it online just so no one got commission from me. 
Nordstrom are you listening? This store needs some leadership and culture training.

Schenk's Family Bakery on Veree Avenue in the Fox Chase neighborhood of Philadelphia, has been in the flour, water and yeast business since the early twentieth century when their first generation started baking in Germany before immigrating to Germantown  and opening their shop in 1938. Both the family and the bakery have moved around, but always remained Philly centric. Their recipes travelled well.

Today, their storefront is small and lined with glass display cases and shelved walls, all full of their classic cookies, doughnuts, cupcakes, custom iced cakes and amazing pound cake. My small sample of half dozen doughnuts (glazed, vanilla iced, cinnamon sugar and powdered sugar) were all fresh, lightly yeasty and full of sweet flavor. They were perfect for accompaniment with hot coffee. 

The vanilla pound cake was dense, moist and was solidly superior to any commercial effort I have eaten. Better even than Starbucks, which has been on my pedestal for a long while. It would have been great heated with a scoop of ice cream, but stood unapologetically on its own. Why they loaded it up on three sides with copious amounts of white icing is a mystery. It was truly an amazing sugar coating, but unnecessary given the quality of what it covered. Diabetic overkill. 

That shelf of large Eagles playoff cakes looked great and gave comfort that they would be the hit of any party or cold afternoon tailgate at the Linc. Unfortunately, the sweetness would not be enough to change the outcome of the game to come.
Best costumer service ever! good drinks and food  the staff is amazing. I can't wait to come back!!!

This is a new favorite for Nashville! The environment was so cozy. There was no wait at 1pm on a Saturday. Inside was pretty crowded but the outside porch was nice and open! The food was amazing. Everything was at least a bit spicy but we loved it. The BBQ was tender, smoky, and the portions were big! I got the turnip greens which were the best I've ever had, and the Mac and cheese which was basic but delicious in my opinion. Drinks are served in huge mason jars which is great. Prices were fantastic, less than 10.00 for a platter and a soda. The food came out quickly and the service was fantastic. It is cash only. Will go back on our next trip down!

We didn't feel like we got what we paid for. While the place was immaculate and the staff very attentive, our food didn't seem fresh. We had been super excited to try the French onion soup but the store bought fried onions on top overpowered everything else in the bowl. 12 oz. sirloin looked more like 8 oz., wasn't prepared according to menu presentation, arrived well done when we had ordered medium and was bland. We got a heads up from our server on the automatic 16% gratuity...followed by a plea for more in the form of a rundown on how the tips are split amongst the staff.
Located in the mall very hard to find. Very expensive but I did like the gimmick of having the sushi on a conveyer belt, I won't be back. The food was ok.

I have been to many hotels, I give it 5 stars because even though it didn't have mint leaves for their mojitos and didn't actually serve food as advertised the staff and facility was great. Every morning we were greeted with a big smile and anything we need they helped us with. They had plenty of snacks to help us through those odd times of the day. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was great, especially loved the fresh waffles. This hotel was literally 5 min away from the mall, less than 30 min away from the Philly outlet which I recommend. I would def recommend this hotel.

Just went to Chatam Tap for the first time because a friend and I were right down the street and in the mood for a beer. I agree with what Brittany S. said about the atmosphere, this is a very laid back bar which is the kind I enjoy. Great beer local and otherwise. Bonus points: soccer on TV. I can only imagine how awesome this place would be during the World Cup.

AmaIng! Hands down the best Italian restaurant we have been to in the area of Saint Pete. We ordered the classic brie for an appetizer, one of the best we have ever had! 

For our entrees we ordered the cheese tortelloni pesto and the chicken parmesan, which were so good! We can't wait to come back and try some other entrees on their menu! 

If you are looking for the best Italian restaurant, come here! It will be your new favorite too.

We came with our cousin from Chicago and had a great time! Of course it isn't our first time here but it has been awhile and we still love it! Nick was our server & let me tell you if we could give a 10 star we would! Awesome food, drinks & service :)

I am so happy that this concept exists! I am a busy person always working, so any thing in my daily life that I can make easier for my self is a win! I love that I can pick up several complete meals, keep them in my refrigerator and heat one up for a complete dinner. The selection to choose from is huge and the meals all taste great! They last up to 5 days in the refrigerator so stocking up for the week is easy. The cost is about the same as cooking a healthy meal, except there are no dishes to wash, no food to prep, and no time wasted at the grocery store or trying to figure out what to make! Plus the staff are super nice, helpful, and knowledgeable on the meals. They want to help their customers make healthy choices and reach their goals.

This place really needs to figure out what it wants to be. I went in looking for a light breakfast. The menu look pretty good so i  decided to check Fresh out. When we arrived the grill or whatever they cook on was out of order?!! Ok????
So we  ordered a cup of coffee. We ask for milk were just  given a carton from the kitchen just thrown on the table.. Not sure why people like this place. The management needs to know what's going on with the business ..

The prices are high for somewhat meager, unexceptional portions. The shrimp dumpling soup had a nice garlic flavour to it, but for $8?? I was expecting much more. They also don't have any eggplant dishes, which is disappointing. It's a pretty place, and it's fine, but not a destination in my book.

Horrible! Ordered to go. They tried to give me egg rolls that sit on the counter for 10 minutes because they forgot to pack them in a previous order.  I asked them to remake so they were hot. I got back to my room and found out my chicken padti was shrimp and tofu. I had to go back down and it took them another half an hour to remake. After all that the food was so so.

First time trying this place. I heard mixed reviews but had to try it for myself. Absolutely love the food. Very clean environment. Staff is friendly and the food came out pretty quick. I will defiantly be coming back and recommending this place to my friends and colleagues.

I went to Santa Barbara for my bachelorette and wanted a fun activity to do. Booked a wine tour package with Rock Star, and it did not disappoint. The company helped with planning lunch in the area and picked it up for us to picnic at a winery. The bus driver was so nice and fun and willing to take as many photos that we wanted. All the recommended wineries were great. And it helped that the driver knew the wineries and their staff well. We had so much fun! I highly recommend.

(Shaking my fist at Camay's review!!)
She went in with the details...lol
But seriously.. This bar almost brings a tear to my eye.. 
(I said almost, dammit!!)
This reminds me of the bars from back in the day.. Smoking is allowed.. The bar and cooler is stocked with plenty of affordable drinks and beer.. Please don't walk in asking for your favorite craft beer...
People sitting at the bar and tables telling the same stories you've might have heard the last time you were there... But it's still entertaining.. 
A jukebox full of good music.. and a kitchen in the back that I've heard have some really good food, although I can't confirm it.. Apparently lunchtime opening isn't an option.. 
Bring a few bucks.. Say hello to Jasmine the bartender. She was pretty pleasant and attentive. and enjoy.. Bars like these are fading and you'll miss them when they're gone..
UYE anyone??
But first, somebody send an I Love Yelp sticker to put on this bar's door..

As a Filipino living in Nashville, you can just imagine how excited I was to hear about this place so we just had to try it!

Came tonight during their happy hour from 4-6. Mannnn were they packed! Nashville is definitely excited to try this restaurant out as they should!

Sitting right in the heart of the gulch, right across Sambuca, the restaurant is beautiful inside. It's big and it can hold big parties. I even saw a segregated room which hopefully you can reserve for private dinner.

We sat at the bar and had their happy hour cocktails. Delicious! But I do want to talk about food so let's get to it.

PORK ADOBO FRIED RICE: this is the BEST thing that I've had just yet. It is honestly perfect and just right. Bartender even told me that this is the most underrated dish they have- people never order it. But he said it's what he always get at the end of his shift. It is DELICIOUS! GET IT!!!!!!

SISIG:. Traditionally made with left overs from a pig's face - this is a traditional bar food in the Philippines. Don't worry! They only serve it with pork belly! It was my favorite from everything we've ordered. 
Update- it was really good the first time we had it. The 2nd time, I wish it was a little crispier.

LUMPIA: traditional egg rolls. You know, I'm a little biased because I've had so many lumpia growing up. I've had better but my husband thought it was good.

BAO: I had their pork belly bao. Really delicious! The bun is on point and that's always the hardest to make. 

CHICKEN INASAL: decent. Not bad. I didn't think it was amazing but I didn't think it was bad either.

SUNDA SUNDAE: dessert and it's their take on the traditional Halo-Halo dessert. You should try it! Also Halo-Halo literally translate to Mix-Mix so when you order this, take a picture, then mix it all together. You have to mix it until the Ube ice cream is completely melted. Trust me!

RIDICULOUS: this was pretty good. It's basically ice cream wrapped with cake. I thought it was just ok. 

Service Was good, too! It was their first week so one of the items that we ordered didn't arrive so our bartender gave us our dessert for free. I thought that was really nice. Shoutout to them!

Parking- there is another parking garage across Bar Louis and it's really cheap parking. There's also a parking garage literally right next to it in the same building so don't worry about that!


Overall, I'm so glad we tried this place and I'm so glad they decided to open a restaurant in Nashville!

Locksmith Dick saved me when I was locked out of my home for 5 hours on a cold snowy day when my electronic door lock key pad failed without warning. His off hour trip price was very fair for two trips. He was kind and caring and very efficient. I highly recommend. Thank you for the great customer service Dick . I will never purchase an unreliable electronic door lock again.

My fiancé and I have been wanting to check this place out since it opened a couple of weeks ago and finally had the chance to stop by last night. Super friendly staff and gorgeous restaurant! We ate outside and really enjoyed the vibes. Didn't get a picture of it but the double dip app was phenomenal! Drinks are also well-priced too - the $5 Mexican draft (Monopolio) really hit the spot with the burger! One of the co-owners Maren stopped by our table to chat and introduce herself which we thought was really cool - definitely excited to make this our go-to neighborhood spot, and can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu!
Awesome service. Fantastic deal on my new Titan!! Super stoked to have such an awesome truck!!

I love the pier in St. Pete!  I waited for quite a while and am so glad my family and I got to visit it this week!  It's a terrific spot for family, singles, and the elderly.  There's an outdoor park, chairs, and even water spouts for young children to play in.  For adults, there are a few cafes and restaurants with food and beverage.  Parking was good and only cost $2hr for the first two hours.  The family and I will be back again for sure!!

Food was amazing, our waiter was nice, but we were told it would be a 30 minute wait and it ended up being 45-50. Our food took a little bit long but overall I will go back, just definitely going to make a reservation next time!
Not worth it at all and it's to pricey. Crab legs were very dry all the food was very blah

There's something about thrifting and finding treasures that gives me goosebumps! The thrill of finding the hidden treasure is hard to explain unless you yourself are avid thrifter, a dumpster diver and a price checker! 

I had bookmarked my stops before traveling to Northern Liberties. And Once Worn was definitely in the to do list. As I walked up I could see a SALE rack! Those discounted racks can be the quick fix for sure. It  was my lucky day. I saw it hidden...it was a ..Catherine Malandrino dress!!! Wow! And in black! I tried to contain my glee for the true test. 

Then....dun dun dun...dressing room! The place that is the true decisions maker in my book.  I closed the curtain and the clerk remarked the Velcro that connects the curtain to the wall. Brilliant! I hate it when there's a little gap and people can see in. And then when I slipped the dress on..it was easily a Va-Va-Voom dress!! Fit like a glove! And I have to wear black at work some days. It was also work appropriate, flattering and feminine. There was black on black leopard pattern in the front section down. Gorgeous. 

I felt the need to pay and try to not tempt myself to buy the whole store. The clerk and I chatted for like 15 minutes! She was a total sweetheart! 

I had so much fun I told my friend who's into vintage to check it out! And from what I hear she made out like a bandit! Lulu Guinness was amongst the loot. Another one of my faves! This place is on my list for all future visits!! And I almost wanted to not review and keep it alllllll to myself but I'm too nice! Enjoy and find some treasures!
I thought this place was the sh*t, personally.  Gyros were f***ing great, zucchini fries were great too.  Good fast casual spot.

This is more of an "I'm in shock" review than anything else. We love Fork, we eat here every few months. But today after brunch, we brought home a cinnamon roll for my daughter who couldn't come along with us. I snuck a bite and THERE WAS A BUTTON in the dough! 

We called the restaurant and after being put on hold for a good amount of time, the acting manager came on the line and was less than sympathetic. His response to the situation was super awkward and borderline rude. He noted that the chef was wearing the same coat as he was yesterday when making the rolls and no button was missing (ok, ew - why no clean coat?!) but that they'd "look into it" and someone would call me tomorrow. (I had to ask him if he needed my phone number to call me back so not sure about the sincerity of that statement. )

We were polite and definitely are not looking for a handout, freebie, etc., just thought the restaurant should know that a customer bit into a button. Why not just take responsibility and apologize? Super disappointed with the way the situation was handled, and now feeling like the kitchen is less clean/sanitary than we thought. Thumbs down, Fork. Photo of button for the manager who seemed to believe that a lost button in the cinnamon roll was impossible.

Place has gone down hill In only of a few months , customer service at the front desk is the worst and are very ignorant. They took our deposit with our credit card and they said you're already prepaid, which was correct, they charged $100 on the credit card for the deposit when we checked in the woman said you won't see a charge , and we paid &100 in cash for the deposit, which doesn't make sense , and low and behold this morning they charged the credit card a $ 100 deposit fee , the front desk had no clue to why that happened and said you can call and get a fax number from your credit company so she can tell them to reverse the charge , but who has the time to do that when you're checking out and have to be there, that's just today's incident, it's every time we've been going for the last 3 months , it's getting worse and worse , the staff that they hired since is incompetent to say the least and not customer service oriented, o would say do not book the ML unless you're looking to be disappointed

This place was close by for a quick lunch. Simple, nice place with interesting display of a bear outside at the entrance.  Felt warm from the cold outside.  
Had to pay for parking in the front of the restaurant. 
We placed a to-go order,  and it took about 20 minutes; which wasn't bad.  
We then tried some drinks while waiting.
Surbabia and Stove rose sangria. Both tasted okay.

We got deviled eggs, boom boom shrimp and tap smoked cheesesteak. 

Deviled eggs were okay, a little too mustardy for my taste.  Has a hint of sweetness,  like caramelized onions.

boom boom shrimp were just okay.  It had a lot, and I  mean a lot more cauliflower than the shrimp.  It should be called boom boom cauliflower with shrimp.

tap smoked cheesesteak was great.  It was the best item out of what I got. 

Try it out if you're in the area!

This has become the restaurant I most often frequent in Chinatown. Not fancy, but a good selection of authentic Taiwanese food (as visiting friends from Taiwan always note). It's nice to eat at the restaurant (staff very friendly and very child friendly) and also good for takeout. So far I've had nothing bad on the menu (3 cup chicken, scallion pancakes and fried rice very good). Looking forward to trying a whole fish next time I dine in.

My wife and I tried it since we live close by. The people working there were very nice. I'm kind of new to Indian food and she was very helpful in making selections. She recommended an appetizer that was very thin like pita bread almost paperthin and it had a very fresh pico de Gallo on top with cilantro onions tomatoes and a sauce that we really liked. I ordered the chicken tiki masala. I'm not an expert on it but it tasted very good. My wife is vegan and they really bent over backwards to make some dishes for her. She didn't care too much for one dish but I liked it. The other Dish she did like it I wish I could remember the name but if you are vegan just let them know and they will make some suggestions or modify a dish for you. The prices were very reasonable in my opinion

The first thing I noticed was the parking, or lack there of, for a place designed for group events they lack the ability to accommodate their vehicles.
Next was the waiver, there's more info required than I am comfortable giving to the state let alone a warehouse trampoline center.
After completing the waiver I checked my son in when we were told to place our belongings in a bin that you would find on the discount rack at target.
We were then told to sit on these bleachers and wait.
The organization reminded me of basic training without a Drill Sgt. There to curse at me and make lewd comments. My six year old son felt alienated and found sky zone's order restrictive, literally across the street is Oasis, a much better organized and better designed facility at which my family has never felt out of place. I do not ever wish to return here.

I always come here for pedicures and they are great at them. I came in to get a fill, but this time I was greatly disappointed. I waited for almost an hour, which I didn't mind because I didn't have an appointment. The guy I had was really nice (he was the younger one) but did a horrible job shaping my nails and with the gel polish. The gel polish is very uneven and has dark spots where there isn't enough polish. I brought it up to him and he told me it's because the color is so light, but I've had this color before. The tips of my nails barely have any polish at all. He was just really horrible at applying polish. My nails are very uneven in length and shape too. I'll only be getting pedicures here from now on.
Best barbershop in all of Santa Barbara. Take all my roommates downtown to get their cuts here great dude gives the best haircuts for cheap and takes his time great for college budget

I definitely need to come here more often. I think I forget about it because it is so small and tucked away, but I am always impressed by the menu options and flavor of my food. Service is friendly and patio seating is a perk! I like the chill vibe and international vibe that comes from the spices and chai options. I've been pleased with every item that I have tried so far and look forward to trying more things!

This is the local teeny tiny Best Buy. It has a smaller selection than its big brother stores because it is smaller.

I have had a few bad customer service situations at this store as well.  Mostly due to indifference by the staff.  Generally if I am just browsing I'll come here. If I plan on shopping, I go to the one near Cool Springs.

As with all Best Buy stores, the more armed with knowledge you are before you shop, the better your experience will be.

Food was ok, but what really did it in when we told the waitress there was a cockroach and all she said well good thing it's big night. I understand it's Florida but that reaction to a bug crawling around our feet. Also we never got our soup. Bad news there
If you like to try local places, this is a good one. In town visiting and needed delivery. Easy to order, friendly people, and fresh hot pizza.

Pretty expensive for what turned out to be a pretty bland and small portioned meal. Bread was overly dry also. I ordered the Sabzi Chalaw, and it just left no impression. However, the interior is pretty and the staff is friendly, which brings it up to two stars.

This hotel is disgusting!!! Worst part about this hotel is that my husband and I got bed bugs here!! We reported this to the front desk staff and they weren't even surprised by us reporting it. We should have walked out and stayed at a different hotel just from seeing the filthy furniture in the lobby or the nasty food trays and trash in the hallways. Do not stay here!!!

Place is really great. It's amazing that when I first moved over here most of that strip mall was a toliet. It's a gem now. The staff is awesome and they are so nice to my kid he knows and goes looking for them. Guy ryan at the front desk is my kids favorite, he is really cool to him. It's always busy so if I do go and want lunch meat I use the order screen and go shopping and it's done when I'm ready to go. Like I said it can get super crowded and the older folks shopping in there drive me nuts to where I want to straggle somebody!!!!! I've now started to use the shop at home website and go in for only fruits and meats..which has lowered my blood pressure.
The chicken andouille gumbo was delicious!!! We tried the combination platter which was also very good. Definitely stop by here if you have time.

I have only been to this Starbucks location once or twice when I happened to be in the shopping center.  It's your typical Starbucks, except I don't love the set up.  When you walk in the door there is a table right in front of you, and it seems that the entrance area could get very crowded and confusing during busy time.  While I didn't sit down with my drink, I noticed the few tables around, none appearing to be particularly comfortable or private.  Also, the area where the barista will hand you your finished drink is kind of in the middle of the store, leaving you to stand awkwardly in someone's way.

Regardless, it's Starbucks, and I won't hesitate to go to this location if I'm in the area.
Never visited this business but i called there to inquire about a 26inch tire, and they don't carry that size and Nor do "Hub Cap Heaven".  Just Fyi.

So I am here to warn you about this company! 

DO NOT PURCHASE FROM THEM!!!
We purchased our sectional from them July 15th and it was delivered that same night. The crew brought it into the house unboxed the couch and put it together half way. Then hands me the clipboard and says sign for furniture. So I did and crew left. My husband and I put the furniture the rest of the way together and I noticed that the middle piece of the sectional was sagging in the back. So of course this place of business was closed to call anyone so we said we would call first thing in the morning on Monday. So I called and the gentleman I spoke to told me that there was nothing they were going to do because we shouldn't have signed for the furniture and asked if we purchased the warranty which we did and told us we needed to go through them to get the sectional replaced. I told the gentleman that I was floored that I would receive damaged furniture and have to make a warranty claim already. He said that how do they know that we didn't break the furniture over night I didn't even have the energy to fight with this gentleman. So my husband called the warranty company the next day and started a claim, the lady that was helping him said she was going to get into contact with the furniture store because if they delivered it damaged they needed to bring out a new piece. So after couple days of back and forth the furniture store said we were sol and warranty would have to cover it. Husband got back in contact with the lady that was helping him and she told him that they weren't going to replace it because the gentleman that she was dealing with at the furniture store admitted to her that the furniture was indeed BROKEN when it left the warehouse July 15th in the evening!!! So now we are stuck with a broken couch and no one to help replace or fix the couch.

This place is fantastic!! Amazing workers with wonderful customer service skills, some of the nicest people I have ever met. Jeanette is running a great ship there and the food is amazing! Special thank you to Brock for being kind and patient when taking my order. Will come back!!

So I've been to this beach many times through the years but I've never actually walked on the beach!  Could be because it's typically windy and a little chilly whenever I've been there... Whatever the case, it's a beautiful spot.  And the Biltmore is right across the street.

Not a bad store it's like almost any kohls stores. I think it's more of the area it's in than anything. Clothes on the floor and displays a mess. Like I said I think it's more the area not exactly the employees being lazy I see the employees constantly working. Let's face it some of the public just doesn't care and they just throw stuff wherever or let their children run free. All in all it is a good store with helpful employees.

The sushi was delicious and if you're a local, you get a sweet discount with all you can eat! Jennica helped us and was amazingly sweet and always right around the corner filling our waters, etc. The only thing is that the 1st rule of Yelp reviews is to never tell customers to write a Yelp review about your business!! The manager caught us before leaving to tell us to write a yelp review on the place. So, now I'm writing one. Hopefully she doesn't make that mistake again. Anyways, thanks Jennica! The manager should learn some professionalism from her.

In spite of many hipster references on Yelp to this business, I ventured to it late on a weekend night on a simple quest for good pizza.

That actually reminds me of one of my favorite hipster jokes: Why did the hipster burn his tongue on the slice of pizza? Because he wanted to eat it before it was cool.

Lee's pizza is tasty, made with care and the toppings you order on a custom pie are plentiful. And from what I saw while waiting for my pizza, the wings looked good as well. Those came out to a small group sitting near me at the bar that included a man who clearly needed some food in his stomach.

In my opinion, two people can easily fill themselves on this small size pizza while enjoying a drink or two to wash it down. 

There are plenty of beer options, most of which are available in coolers appropriate for a small and older grocery store. There are a handful of craft beers on draft as well and apparently they do pour some wine too...or those wine bottles are just to hold big fake roses and throw people off.

Unfortunately for people like me who drink "crap on tap," as Mr. Dunderbak calls it, Lee's has none of that. Not even "crappy crap" in cans or bottles like PBR or The Champagne of Beers. Which is fine, I get it. They kindly offer Coke products for us old souls who do like French toast, but want the actual breakfast and not a huge brown bottle at an 8.8% ABV.

Obviously, they keep it real simple here: Pizza, wings, craft beer. Seems like they know what they're doing and the employees openly appreciate their customers.

As I finish this review, the Yelp survey questions below include "Good for Dancing: Yes, No, Not Sure." I marked "No" because the only folks dancing here have had way too much of that French toast beer or ABV equivalent and not enough of their quality pizza.

Always a favorite, White Castle always has the best chocolate shakes anywhere, and I hadn't had a Slider forever! So this was a treat to stop and enjoy. This location isn't in the best spot. It's near downtown and near the expressway. We were walking back to our hotel after doing the Honky  Tonk bars, so we ignore the untidy area and went inside. The restaurant was clean and the staff friendly. The menu on the board still had excellent prices and the same food items.  This is definitely the place to go for a good cheap meal, and the must-have milk shakes.

We always have a great time!  We had 1 goal and that was to get the injectable donut holes. We chose to get the three different sauces chocolate, raspberry, and Bavarian cream. They did not disappoint. Our family loved them. Andrew was our server at our bay and he was the best server we have ever had there he gets 10 stars every day.

My only complaint is that it is very expensive and the wait is always crazy long and if you want a reservation you have to pay an additional amount that doesn't go towards your purchase! 

**Olivia and Brianna corner** (the teens thoughts) 

Olivia's favorite sauce was raspberry. The heaters are the best!!

We came here on the first day of our trip and the food was magnificent!! We had some boudin, gumbo, and jambalaya. Our waiter was very nice but unfortunately stopped being attentive to us around the time we got our food. We wanted to have another beer with our meal but he almost never even came back so we just got our check and left. We were thirsty! However, I will say he had wayyy too many tables for one person and could've used some help for how busy it was. All in all we really enjoyed our visit to Napoleon House.

This is my favorite nordstrom. I visited this location with my friend specifically looking for a present for my aunt, i knew exactly what i wanted in the women's jewelry department. The sales associate, Leslie Black was there to assist us. She showed us different variations of the product and gave us her own input on how it should be styled. She was extremely helpful. At checkout i even asked if she make the bag "cute" lol. She put tissue paper and added a nice silver bow. Thanks for all your efforts. I was an extremely satisfied customer and my aunt as well! I then visted the mens department and picked up a few items on my own, the other assoicates were friendly as well. I love the atmosphere here amongst other department stores where i feel hawked at, i like to go at my own pace and not feel pressured to make a purchase. Always a great experience. Will be returning here again. :)

Bravo! They did such a great job making this place special, as it seemed to have many unique and interesting touches. Very much enjoyed our visit here; from the magic to the ambiance, it was superb. They have an amazing collection of ancient playing cards, and Houdini's handcuffs.
