The upclose magic was really stunning, and two of the magicians really stood out as incredible, a mentalist and a guy with a floating cigarette, both leaving us scratching our heads and guessing days and days later! The food was okay, prices were high, but since you don't pay separately for the magic, it made sense. Would definitely be a repeat customer, but wonder if they rotate out the magicians/acts or if its the same guys indefinitely.

Best Mexican food available on Purdue University! Burritos as big as your head! Burritos, tacos or tortas... You can't lose! Ask for their extra hot sauce behind the counter.  Yummy yummy! Came across this location by accident during a blizzard and it was a pleasant oasis of flavor.

I really liked the decor of this place, elegant yet relaxed. There are daily specials, happy hour and 4 dll sangria and 5 dll tito's everyday which is pretty good. I got the chance to try the red and white sangria and both of them for good. Also got to try appetizers, edamame, shrimp and fries. Everything was really good and enough to share with the table. I am looking forward to going back for dinner and to try some of their specialty drinks.

I love this romantic and authentic Greek BYOB.  I always make sure to order the Mediterranean platter, which includes a medley of olives, cucumber salad, eggplant tapenade, hummus, beets.

In my opinion, the only negative is the noise level ... the acoustics must be bad, because when it's a full house (most of the time) it's very difficult to have a conversation. I will definitely be back, but I probably won't bring a group so we aren't struggling to hear each other.

This place is real good !! Truly enjoyed the pad Thai and the curry. The staff is super nice . Hard working young men ..  the chef was nice to come to our table and asked if dinner was to our liking. Love that very professional. Highly recommend this place

Mmm delicious Saturday brunch.  My friends and I sampled about everything on the menu (between the 5 of us) and all of it was wonderful.  I'm Lebanese, so I know when I'm eating good Lebanese food, and this was definitely up to par.  I would recommend it to anyone who is interested in getting great food without spending too much money!
Great chorizo quesadilla!! Table salsas are great and hey grab a free margarita while your here.

To be fair, when I booked the room on the web, it was clearly noted that renovations were to begin in March 2015.  The renovation is much needed!  The rooms were immaculately clean, but the furnishings and amenities were worn and definitely ready for the recycle bin. 

The service at the hotel was wonderful!  The staff were wonderfully friendly, which definitely made up for any disappointment in the decor.  The evening reception featured an open bar and snacks, which was right up my alley as I had to go back to my room to  pack for a 6 am flight.  The hotel is close to the Saguaro National Park, which offers a stunning view of Tucson and its desert beauty.  It's also close to many restaurants and a Target in case you forgot something.  

I hope to be able to return after the renovation so that I can really take in all of the improvements!!!

So glad we made it to Twenty Manning. Very cute and hip atmosphere. This would have been 5 stars except for the noise level (so loud we could barely hear ourselves think and were shouting to converse). We didn't have drinks so I can't comment on those. Our food was really delicious though and I give all of what we ordered a thumbs up. One person in our party had the mussels and almost licked the bowl. Another person had the fish tacos (celiac so it was nice for her to have a full gf option) and I had the salmon poke (dairy sensitivity so again, nice that they were so accommodating) and it was truly amazing. It sounded good and was not disappointing. We each only had an appetizer size portion, but honestly, that was perfect. What was served at other tables looked and smelled great as well. If you can sit outside (it was raining so that wasn't an option), I would think that's a good place. Enjoy!

Michael and I went back on Monday and our waitress Nancy showed me a new dish on the menu; a vegan meatloaf and it was out of this world delicious!!! Even Michael liked the dish!! This place never disappoints

Having just watched "The Art of the Steal" last night, the documentary about the blatant theft of the Barnes collection by big-wigs in city government for profit and tourism, I'm inclined to give this beautiful museum a 5 star review, before I have to relegate it to the list of things that existed in my lifetime I have to tell my children about one day (like when Pluto was a planet, pay-phones existed, and when gum was a quarter).

The Barnes Foundation houses(housed) a staggering and gorgeous collection of some of the finest Post-Impressionist and Modern art anywhere in the world. It is a true shame that what was once so pure and good has now been corrupted and will forever be associated with one of the largest political scandals in our city's history. I only had the opportunity to visit the Foundation once, but I was awe-struck at the collection, the presentation, the grounds, and the genuine sense of respect you feel for the entire idea behind it. 

Do yourself a favor and watch "Art of the Steal." Unfortunately, the chance to see the Barnes collection in its rightful home has passed.

DO NOT PAY UNTIL THE JOB IS COMPLETE!!!

8 months, we are still left with an incomplete job. After multiple conversations with ownership, broken promises, and missed appointments, I am left with no option other than to open a civil suit. Even Hunter Douglas implies that The Blind Guys cause issues like this all the time. 

Do yourself a favor and steer clear of these incompetent retailers.

The salsa was fresh and flavorful, but the rest of the meal was unremarkable and WAY overpriced.  The restaurant seems too trendy for me and had no ambiance at all.  The only spice i could taste in both mine and my wife's dish was salt or msg.  And lots of it.  More spices are definitely needed for Mexican style food.  The fajitas were bland, and the bacon wrapped shrimp tasted like they used Hormel pre-cooked microwavable bacon. I have seriously had better bacon at McDonalds.  The rice was as unflavorful as the rest of the meal, and even the guacamole, their namesake, tasted like it came from a can.    There are way too many superior Mexican restaurants in the area at a much cheaper cost for me to consider returning.  I would even consider Chipotle a superior restaurant.  Guac is one step above Taco Bell, but charges super premium prices.

I have to give this place one star so I can write a review. But this place charged me for a tab that wasn't even mine. Well not the bar. But Cody Lovell. And when I went in there and he said it was my fault cause I was talking to someone that had that tab. That's not okay. They never returned my money. I would NEVER suggest this place to anyone. Especially never get a drink from CODY LOVELL. He was being rude and disrespectful just cause I asked about it. They really suck. 100% Not recommended

A MUST for USAA members. I've previously used Ray Brandt Collision, but Trep's was by far the best repair experience I've had. They are knowledgeable, friendly, and finished the work on my car the fastest out of the many repair experiences that I have had. A+ to these guys.
Diana is the BEST!! She totally brought my hair dream to reality. The vibe was perfect and the enthusiasm got me so hyped about my new do Will be back for another hair adventure soon!

Our family has been going to the Sparks location for over 15 years. They consistently create delicious beers, and their prices for growlers are still reasonable (unlike several other popular local breweries). I've been asking them to make the Truckee River Red a Flagship brew ever since I discovered it; when I bring it home, even people who don't prefer beer tend to like it. It's truly a wine lover's beer. My favorite beer at Great Basin is the seasonal Red Nose Holiday Wassail, which is available during the holiday season. If you like holiday spices in your beer, you will love it!

Great BBQ at an unassuming corner place.  The outside tables were perfect for solid brisket and turkey.   It felt like eating in someone's backyard with games on the big screen.   I'm glad we stopped by!

Love the mariachi band that plays here on Fridays; so fun! My husband said the chicken enchiladas were the best he'd ever had. My son enjoyed his quesadilla, and they both wolfed down the "fried" ice cream dessert. Yes, the service is slow, but maybe they can't afford to hire more help...? It was worth the wait, and there is a friendly vibe to the place, especially when the band is playing. I've been here before and look forward to coming back.

Best mediterranean restaurant in the city, hands down. Large portions, decent prices, and it's BYOB!

It's also a nice place to sit outside and ~*watch the streetcar go by*~

The decor was straight out of a saloon in Arizona circa 1883 and yet the bartenders looked like they belonged in the 1920s. 

That's not really important. What's important is that the drinks here are yet another example of what a craft cocktail should be. They have a set menu of drinks that are all fairly good (the Off-Duty Sailor was certainly interesting) and one of my favorite tricks is to request whatever the bartender wants to make. In this case he made me a modified Sazerac that was pretty killer.

Also, following one of my rules for a good bar, they serve water to you immediately. So A++ Farmers' Cabinet!
My wife has been eating lunch here for 2 years and bought me home my first soup from here lastweek. OMG absolutely delicious

My first experience with Japanese food done fast food style will likely be my last.  I guess overall, I just really expected it to at least taste good - even if it wasn't AUTHENTIC Japanese cuisine.  Unfortunately, I was pretty much feeling indifferent toward the dish and a little pissed at my newly, much-lightened wallet.

I ordered the Spicy Chicken platter (not spicy at all, just like the no-personality cashier said).  You do get a LOT of food.  I also threw in an order of Vegetable Spring Rolls (those actually were delicious, but they're pretty hard to screw up!)   I guess I should start out by saying I'm not a sushi lover.  I'll nibble on it every once in awhile, but I just haven't ever really gotten into it.  I can tell this place probably prides itself on its sushi, but the entire place smelled so unappetizingly fishy, I can't imagine that even the most avid sushi lover would have enjoyed it.

The Sumi & Corn/Bowtie Salads that I chose for sides literally made me say "Meh" outloud and the vegtable skewer mostly got in my way while I was trying to eat the chicken.

All together (with an iced tea) it came to over 14 dollars for just me to eat.  Kind of ridiculous when you're eating something that pretty much tastes like it came from a mall food court.

Overall, if you're feeling some Japanese or sushi and you happen to be near a SanSai, stop in, get some spring rolls to hold you over, and then make reservations at a better place for dinner at close to the same price.

Been 12 years since my last visit.   The food was average at best this time around.  The decor seems to be holding up but the attention to detail which is normally the staple of a Starr Restaurant is no longer there.    The restrooms need to be updated.   Afraid Morimoto has jumped the shark.

They have a fairly good beer list and bar selection. But don't order a steak, they don't know how to cook it. And don't expect good service unless you're with a regular, because you're just going to get ignored if a regular is there.

I like this place and will come back! Harrahs NOLA is non-smoking (yay!), gives free beer and cocktails while you are playing (yes!), but not the premium pours like Grey Goose, Patron, or Fiji water unless you pay the upcharge or are a diamond rewards member (drats!). You can order drinks at the machines now(yes!). Craps tables have 10x odds (yes!). They have the "no craps" variant at 10x odds as well. Mini Baccarat at $10 min bet during the day (yes!).  21+3 Blackjack tables with $10 min during the day. They also have the higher house odds three card, pai gow, and other poker variants.

They have a full selection of video slots and progressive, video blackjack, and video poker. Jacks or better $1 video poker are 9-5 machines, others are 8-5. Video blackjack lets you split and double down even at the $0.25 bet (yes!). They also have video roulette, video actor blackjack, and the "bop it" craps machine at $2 to $3 min bet during the day. They have a poker room (of course), and if they have a sports book section, I didn't see it.

To the other reviewer: sounds obvious, but don't gamble money you can't afford to loose. I played craps for two hours, got free drinks, and left with my bankroll plus a few bucks intact.

I enjoy going out for breakfast with my husband on Sunday's. We have eaten at the Brunchery a handful of times...the food is pretty good but sometimes too salty. Service could definitely  improve...took my mother-en-law there for brunch. Our server forgot to put in her meal order...not sure how that happens ...by the time her food arrived at the table our food was cold...yes, we  could have eaten our food when it was hot...right out of the kitchen...but that would have been rude to eat in front of her...it took 20 minutes longer for my mother-en-laws food to finally get to the table. Over all the place is usually good...they are really busy as it is a popular place for the locals. It's not my favorite place to eat breakfast as it is "hit & miss"  as far as the food is concerned...I would say  maybe 3 stars.
 Suggestions:  1. -  tell the cooks to go easy on the salt.  The last seafood scramble I ordered  was so salty I had to send it back. They brought me something else and all ended well. 2. - Offer more selections for folks that don't eat meat..not everybody loves bacon.

This place is an absolutely amazing find!!!...very local cusine with a quaint atmosphere that is very inviting.  The Oyster Rockefeller is absolutely delicious!!!  I'm so glad that I found this place tucked away just off of Canal.

I must say that having traveled in China, Hong Kong, and major cities in the world including NYC, where there are alot of Chinese people and Chinese restaurants, Fushia Asian Bistro does a very nice job.  The service is always very nice and helpful and the food is the real Szechuan spice!  I come here for my Szechuan fix that I need every other week.  Although the dishes can be extremely spicy hot, that is what Szechuan food is supposed to be.  One can order other less spicy dishes as well.   

My main criticism is that the menu is too long with too many items that it is a bit confusing and hard to nuddle through.  Also, they need menus to go.  Otherwise, I really like this place and when you walk in and see all the foreign born Chinese people there with their families and friends, you know that it is the real deal.  

I love the fact that they have brown rice and beer, wine, and sake!  I wish more people knew about this place because it is tucked away on Amberly in New Tampa and a treat to have!

I just moved from San Jose to Marana literally the night before I called this Ulta salon.  The day before I had went to "my" Ulta in San Jose and was able to use my points from my reward card for a free haircut and conditioning treatment with a stylist I'd used previously (and had no problems with).  Unfortunately, when the haircut was done, I was in such a hurry to get home and finish packing, I threw my hair up into a ponytail and didn't even check to see if it was ok.  After I got to Marana the next day, showered, and fixed my hair, I couldn't help but be annoyed with some of the uneven layers around my face.  Nothing major by any means, but enough that it would bother me until I got it fixed.  

I called this Ulta, explained that it had been a rewards points' cut in California and asked what their policy was on fixing it, the charge, etc.  After checking with the manager, the gal on the phone apologized they couldn't get me in sooner (so I'm thinking 2-3 days), but she means they couldn't get me in that afternoon!  I was scheduled for noon the next day.  

The manager shampooed, cut, and blow dried my hair for no charge.  She did an excellent job, and it's sad that (I think she said) her last day would be that following Friday.  This salon, compared to other Ulta salons I've seen, was very neat and organized.  I hope it stays that way with the new manager as well.  

Appreciated the help these gals gave me, hoping I'm able to send some more folks their way.
LOVE everything about this. Fresh fruit and vegetables so cheap! I go at least once a week to stock up!
the food was delightful.  the sweet corn soup was out of this world.  and don't pass up the sweet potato beinetts.  the only drawback was how loud it was. we had to yell across the table to be heard.

Great patty melt with awesome prices on all other items. Looks a little dated but that's the allure. Takes you back to the old diners on the side of the freeway(TV show Alice). People there are really polite and nice. Foods good and that's all I require. Owners do a good job hiring there staff.
Roast beef sandwiches are fuckin delicious. Take-out available. The end.

Pretty standard Chinese food.  I used to go here before I found China Moon in Morton.  

Nice enough staff, located near the amazing 320 Market.  I used to go here at times as I preferred their Sesame chicken.

If you're a Swarthmore College student you've likely been here already.  If you're not...well, you probably haven't.  In either case, it's average Chinese for relatively good prices.

If you are a fan of Dali, this is a must see. To me it is one of the best museums in Florida, because I am a huge fan of the artist. Some of his work is sick and twisted, and the rest is just genius. The one drawback is the admission is steep.

Andrews bayou ribs was at the feast in the park Faust park.  It's a food truck.  They rib tips where awesome and the sauce was good.  You get a lot of rib tips for the price.  Next time I'm trying the chicken wings and thick cut pork steak.

Honestly I was so disappointed. I'm from up north so I don't have high hopes for Florida bagels but I tried them out. Cream cheese was good but it was seriously the most expensive worst whitefish spread I've ever had. It was actually disgusting I'm so disappointed if my food wasn't to go I would have complained. Not worth it unless you want a cheap bagel with cream cheese. I'm so sad I wasted $10

Lots of good eats, all in one place. There's a place there where President Obama had a meal. It's a nice hidden gem, where everyone in your family or group can have a meal of their choice, and still eat together as a group.
Brie appetizer was very good. Onion soup suprisingly bland and onions were not cooked enough.  Lobster thermidor was also suprisingly lacking in flavor. Nice dining room and view though.

Great service and great food! We tried Richard's for the first time and were impressed by how smooth the service was. The grilled shrimp appetizer and risotto cakes were very good! My husband had the braised leg of lamb for dinner and I had the cannelloni. Both were delicious. Our waiter, Trey, was also very attentive and friendly.
Great spot for kids parties! Very cool! Kids will have a blast! Great folks to work with

Been here before and loved it! Back again and not so pleased. Im happy with the cleanliness during COVID, and the room itself was just fine. However, the pool is limited capacity AND limited hours. You would think if you had to limit the capacity, you would extend the hours to give more people the opportunity to enjoy the pool. Also, we were told we could rent bikes 9-5, however that is only in the weekends and was also unavailable to us. I could have traveled with my own bike, but decided not to thinking they would be available as advertised. Our WiFi was terrible and cell service was non existent in the room. Our TV didn't work and it took two engineers two trips to get it up and running. And to top it off, there was a yelling dog near the pool outside my window for the first 90 minutes of my stay. Disappointment after disappointment on what should have been a special trip.

This event is preceding and culminating over Labor weekend and is one of the best barbecue gatherings on the West Coast.  There are around thirty different competitors and barbecue restaurants, which means a great opportunity to sample or eat at so many different restaurants all in one place.  It is a little crowded of course but there seems to be enough available parking.  The lines are reasonable given the type of event but it's worth the wait.  Overall, the barbecue ribs were outstanding at many of the competitors and restaurants.

I give the food a hard "meh". It's a bit lackluster and I would consider it for sustenance only. However, ice cream and drinks were absolutely incredible. You have to go - happy hour specials were off the chain. Standing banana split? Yes please.

I couldn't be happier with my dealings with E-Konomy Pool over the last 5 plus years. They are knowledgeable, friendly, courteous, LOCAL, and veteran friendly. Their prices may be the best in town. They come to know you and your pool/spa. Their customer service stands on it's own without comparison, but I'll briefly tell how I came to be a customer.
       I had used another pool company. Maybe the first pool company  that might come to mind. They've been around a long time. We used them to build a $36,000 spool (2500 gal in ground heated spa) They also sell PATIO furniture and build POOLS. And offer service and supplies.
 We had a rental with pool which tenants let go green without telling us quickly during Monsoon. We spent a lot in chemicals and tested frequently when told to. Finally got it under control. The last time I was in one of their stores was when I took a water sample in and the lady said    
"you know we usually like to do these tests about once a month. The testing piece we use cost a bit of money"
  So everyone who has never been to an E-Konomy Pool store should go there next time they need any pool/spa supplies or service. Tell them Kevin McConnell sent you.

Tried this place after getting a flier. It looks like a restaurant you'd see in Japan.  Lots of Japan motif around.  
    Now about the food.  Wife loved her sesame chicken. I had Pad Woo Sen. Mine was just okay.  I will return and try something else. Price is reasonable. 
    So many places come and go. Will be interesting to see if they make it.

Visited The C House yesterday, and we really enjoyed it. We had a reservation, but we didn't need it as there were plenty of socially distanced tables to sit. We chose to sit outside. I loved the cute decor, and the menu was small but had a few great choices. Everything on the menu starts with a "c" which is so cute and clever! We had the lobster Mac n cheese, which was good, and it had enough fresh lobster within. My crustacean roll was good with lobster and shrimp and coleslaw mixed in. I wish the garlic butter marinade was more flavorful, but it was still yummy. The cowboy burger was huge and flavorful, and the house made Oreo cheesecake was shareable and also yummy! Service was great also!

I've been a fan of Dmitri's for years (especially this Queen Village location--I don't love the one in Fitler Square), but my latest experience was less than positive.  My girlfriend and I had dinner on a recent Sunday evening, and the results were uneven and mostly negative.

We were seated quickly in a mostly full restaurant, and the greeter warmly filled our water glasses and prepared our wine.

We started by sharing the beet salad and a bowl of mussels in a white wine sauce.  The beet salad came first, and it was simple but very good.  While the salad set a positive tone, it wasn't indicative of what would follow.  The mussels that soon followed were in a broth that was bland, despite its numerous vegetables.  I think it just needed more wine.  The mussels themselves were cooked fine, but they were below average, I'd say.

For our main courses, I ordered scallops and my girlfriend seafood fettuccini.  My scallops were served nearly 5 minutes before the fettuccini--not ideal but also not a big deal.  More of a problem was that the fettuccini, which was supposed to be in a red sauce, was served in exactly the same broth as the mussels.

I was in the bathroom when her food was served, so she wanted to wait for me to make sure she was correct about the sauce.  She was.

My girlfriend advised the waitress, who responded, "Yeah, you're right."  She asked if she wanted something else, and since nearly everthing else we ate wasn't great (and she consequently ate a lot of bread), she said, "No, thanks."  The waitress then said, "Ok." and left, but not until after she asked if I wanted the food boxed up, not yet ten minutes after it was served.  I asked if she meant my food, and she said, "No--hers," so I said, "Well, you'll have to ask her."  Weird, and never once did she apologize for the mix-up.

I ate half of my scallop platter (which came with pretty good sauteed collared greens and an unseasoned pile of rice), which was ok but not remarkable, and then we had the balance of the entrees boxed up.

To the waitress' credit, we realized she took the fettuccini off the bill without us asking.  

Overall, the staff was attentive and friendly enough, but it wasn't enough to make up for food that was so-so at best.  I understand that Dmitri's goes for simply prepared food, but if that's the case, it should be prepared nearly flawlessly, and 3 of 4 of the dishes we ordered, we had no desire to finish.

I've come to expect a lot more out of Dmitri's, so I hope this visit was just an anomaly.  I'll head back at some point to give them another shot, but I also won't be so quick to recommend them anytime soon.
Super good, my boyfriend and I go on dates here, or bring it home for movie night. Great food.

We decided to enjoy some fish and chips this evening and Teddy's was our choice. We decided on take away due to the ease and convenience. We were extremely pleased with the results of our choice. Within the meals were four large, not overly battered fish filets, with fries and sweet potato fries respectively. The meals were excellent with the fish surprisingly crisp (even with a 15 minute drive home). We anticipate enjoying Teddy's By the Sea again very soon. This is a must try on the Carpinteria culinary scene.
very long wait lines, even with online order in advance and a confirmed pickup time!  prices tend to be higher compared to other clinics also

The location of this gym gets 5 stars. The dirty locker rooms that never have paper towels, or even toilet paper, are disgusting. It is hotter than heck in here all of the time. Treadmills have salt on them from people wearing their shoes in. I love to people watch here, but while I love to lift weights, those are a mess too! Either we need to require members to pick up after themselves, or get a cleaning crew on staff. Come on, planet fitness does better than this!

I have one star because I could leave negative stars. This place is a huge rip off! Extremely incompetent and poorly trained, grossly overpriced. I absolutely do NOT recommend them. And the Dr. next door is no better. For my experience Sasha is rude and unprofessional and the Dr has zero bedside manner and doesn't give a crap about the patients. Eyemart Express is a bit better and you don't have to wait 2 weeks for glasses for the most part. Usually you can get them the same day

First visit and everything was excellent. Had the hash Benedict with grits. My friend had the Nutella crepe. All of it was freshly prepared and the service was great. Prices are very reasonable. Can't wait to go back.

We've long been fans of The Brewhouse but really only re-discovered this neighborhood gem recently with a commitment to supporting them whenever we are up in Santa Barbara as they epitomize what makes Santa Barbara so special.  In the process, we rediscovered the really impressive beer that this place quietly brews...for years, but still with innovation.  The coffee Porter was among the best I've had.  My husband loves the Motivation Destroyer IPA, so appropriate for the times we are in and so, so good.  And the cheeseburgers with brioche bun and fries....heaven.  So pick up the phone, order a meal and beers to go.  You won't be disappointed...and you'll be helping keep a local Santa Barbara gem in business.

One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. The Pho Broth is next level (I had beef). Don't miss the Vindaloo sauce on the chicken wings or drumsticks. Drinks are fantastic. We will definitely be back. (Shoutout to Ray who steered in the right direction and was a great server)

Kevin and Tina are my mom and I 's go to for a mani/pedi! They're the best of the best. I have been coming here for a little over two years. Have never had problems until my last visit. I requested Kevin and Tina (per usual) and guy on the phone said "I will see what I can do." with attitude. I've never in the two years of coming here have been told that. Which I get they're busy a lot of the time, but I didn't appreciate that. My mom was given a new guy who did my mom's pedi in literally 10 minutes! Ridiculous! It looked awful, didn't clean her cuticles, took 30 seconds to rub her feet and the nail polish looked like my 2 years godson painted them. I had asked Kevin if he could fix her pedi and do her mani and he did. Bless his soul! While Kevin was fixing her pedi, the guy (that did the original pedi)  LAUGHED! Thought it was hilarious. Which I was not okay with. But let it go. My mom had told the receptionist what was going on and she was so kind, listened to my mom on what she was upset about, and had said to call her over next time so she can address it. My mom and I are NEVER to complain but these new people need to be trained. Hopefully when I take my mom again, Tina will be there.
Great pizza, appetizers, & service too. Be prepared to wait 45 minutes for the crust to be made, but it is worth it & the crust is amazingly good!

My first time here and i wanted to ask the guy that waited on us a few questuons but he had a great language barrier...found the lady cashier next to us was very good at explaining the menu so i just listened to her.  I had the lunch special which consist of 2 chicken tenders, a side and a drink for $7.99 The chicken tenders were very good, nice and juicy and tender, i just had fries although i did taste my friends mac/cheese it was creamy but not really cheesey. My feiend got the lunch special too but she didnt get bread and her sauce of choice was not on her tenders, we had to ask why to understand and hers was a dollar more than mine

This always seems to be a quick and easy go to for dinner.  

Let me start by saying, Our service is always awesome! The food is always hit or miss.  Mostly hit, as it's always fast and fresh. It's great that they have finally updated their menu. 

My three stars comes from the absolutely filthy oil and vinegar carafe and items on the table. I wish those were wiped down every time they cleaned a table.

Stopped here spur of the moment when I couldn't get into Salon St. Louis.  Keep in mind, the reason I couldn't get in is because I wait until the very last minute to invest in a hair cut.  I pretty much wait till the very last moment, when I wake up and think "Okay-- now I actually can't go out in public anymore until this is resolved".
It was on one of the rainiest, soggiest days that I drifted into Verve.  It's a chic little spot that sells uber high-end products.
A.J. cut my hair and did a good job.  She gave me a nice overall trim with some layers in the front.  Perked up my color-- 
I didn't ask for anything radical so-- not sure what I can grade this place on.
Make sure you look at the prices if you decide to buy some of their products.  I fell in love with the smell of their "organic" line of shampoos and conditioners.  I even had both bottles with me at the check out counter--
That is, until I realized they were $26 dollars a bottle!  Yeow...  that's above my budget for hair products, even if I do like the scent.
Happy haircuts!

The store used to be pretty good. I'm not sure what happened it seemed to have gone downhill. Things are priced wrong as well. I went to buy something that claimed it was a dollar and when I got up to the register the older woman who was ringing people out informed me otherwise (it was about $10 ) which is fine I still wanted it. I was just annoyed by the attitude I got from the cashier when I said "oh I thought it was a dollar."

Great spot for a thin crust pizza.  Not your conventional oven baked pizza but very tasty.  Oblong shaped but a nice size. Give it a try - may not be like your typical pizza joint but you will come back again and again

Getting a Cuban at West Tampa Sandwich Shop is first on my list whenever I visit Tampa! Their Cuban sandwiches are the standard for every other Cuban sandwich anywhere. I haven't tried anything on their menu that wasn't delicious.

Operated illegally as a contractor with no license for two years, complete disregard for any customer or employee, dishonest, unloyal and no integrity, it was a shame to allow the work and the business from this man, it was a huge mistake to ever use this man beware!

The most awesome breakfast, and as a pancake expert of 50 plus years they have the best pancakes ever!

Thanks for staying open!

Yesterday, we came from out of town and the plastic cover under the front engine of our car got loose and hanging down making noise, after going through the snow in truckee.
i didn't know any good mechanic, so Yelped and found these people.
i called and brought the car in Friday afternoon and they gladly checked it and found that a few brackets holding the cover was missing. they put brackets back and just charged $10 for the brackets, $10 for the labor. i am very pleased of how they treated me and the car with honesty, integrity and the competitive price. now, i have a mechanic to go to in Reno. Much recommended!

We love hawkers, but it always takes so long for our server to see us when we sit down. It took 10 minutes our last visit to even have a staff member see us at our table. We have an issue getting seated every time we come to this restaurant. We get told it's an hour wait for a table outside when there are 4 open tables not cleared yet. Madison the waitress took her own time to clear a table for us and seat us within 10 minutes. She deserves Credit for her work. Thank you Madison!

Always go here when I drive past Indianapolis. It's always packed but the staff are attentive and try to seat you as fast as possible. Other than the regular menu there is an AYCE option that you order from on a menu and it is brought out fresh. Good choices, decent rice, and most importantly fresh fish!!

Hands down the best falafel I've had outside of the Middle East, and better than a lot of falafel I've had IN of the Middle East, too! I spent a summer in Tel Aviv and crave the food often, but am usually careful not to get my hopes up for great food in the states. I was so pleasantly surprised! Authentic but also elevated - the atmosphere feels chic and modern, the staff was attentive, conversational, and professional. Food was amazing. I'll be back for sure!
This place is amazing. The food could use a little umpf but it works. The fountains and music are great. It can get crowded on the weekend, but during the week it is a ton of fun.
Great menu, fantastic. Good and first class service !I highly recommend Oak and Ola !
I never thought I'd say this, but the frose and meatloaf are beyond delicious! Highly recommend! Love everything about 13th Street!
This is a great place to eat or to have banquet at. Maryann the banquet manager was great, very helpful.  I Highly recommend this place for your next party or just a night out for dinner.

Both Dr's and staff are great. Never a wait, gentle caring people. 

Me and my son love Dr Ngo. She is beyond the Best!

Our visit: This was our first visit. We visited on a Saturday at 7:30pm. 

The reservation: The hostesses had a few mess ups with us. There were two working the hostess stand. The older woman (post 50) who is vivacious and energetic answered the phone the first time we called and pretended the restaurant was very unavailable. I called at 6pm asked for the first available table for the night for 2. She said they were avail at 8:15pm. I asked if there was anything earlier and she said maybe 8pm and eventually quoted 7:30pm as if she was doing us a big favor for a party of 2. After grappling with the consideration of waiting an hour for the table, I called again. This time the younger hostess answered the phone. She said there was no wait. LOL. So we arrived and there was no wait. ..........

The strawberry feta salad: amazing!!!! I devoured that salad. 

Chicken parm: I didn't eat the chicken because the pasta was so good, but the pasta was amazing. 

The lava cake: this is not a lava cake. It is a brownie that has not been cooked all the way through. I didn't eat much of it. 

The service: now, despite all the flubs, this is why I can not in good conscience give less than four stars. Our server, Maria, was wonderful!! She was calm, collected, knowledge, and delightful. We later learned she's worked there for eight plus years. We briefly interacted with a young food runner with a bad attitude. She was 25-35 in age, thinning blonde hair in a ponytail, slender, corse in demeanor and a tad condescending. I held my tongue and was exceedingly polite to her to counter her condemnation and my usually obtuse husband actually noticed her rudeness and commented after she left the table. I later needed my waitress mostly because the foodrunner kind of left without saying anything-- haha I assume she's a food running because why else would she behave that way. I noticed another server, Kevin, walk by and asked him if he could get our waitress. He responded by saying that he could help us. And we learned from him that our server, Maria, is his wife and they met at this restaurant and have been working there for eight years. They were both so calm and courteous. Next time I return, I'll be sure to request that one of them take care of us on the off chance that the food runner is actually a server and she is our waitress next time. 

The ambiance: sit down. There is a coat rack near the booths and it's a full service restaurant with evening lighting.
The food is delicious, especially the falafel and gyro meat. I ordered to go a few times and the food is always ready by the time I get there. Staff is friendly.

PAT's = Juicier, tastier meat, but the bread is way better at GENOS. Also, the hot sauce offered at GENOS is exceptional to spice up the steak and cannot even be compared with the hot sauce available at PAT's.

Can someone please open up a new store in between these two venus and call it PANOS or GET.

If someone was to ask me... Would you drive all the way to Philly just for a cheese steak? My answer would be yes.

$20 for tolls and $30 for gas and ($10 x 2 steaks, fries and soda = $30)

NET $80 for two philly cheese steak? Yes it's worth it.

Please note: There is no bathroom.

We ate there last night. The food and service was exceptional. My lamb stew was warm but not hot. Maybe good for most people. I like really hot food so I was a little disappointed in that however the taste was divine.  I would certainly eat there again many times over if I lived in Boise.
Staff called right away and offered discount.  Very good business practice.  We ordered again and it was much better.  We like it here because they listened to our concerns
I can't believe the people reviewing this place on food. Smh. This place gets a 5 star for it's purpose of a great bar and social spot. End of story.

Took a girlfriend here for a massage for her bachelorette party on a Saturday. We arrived a little early but the therapist was really nice and welcoming. She started early on my friend while i sat in the lobby resting. The location was north of State street so it's a bit of a far walk down to downtown. 

My friend loved the massage and was very relaxed.
it is a great place to get waxed in this city.. however, it is SO expensive.  you can get a Brazilian in California for $42 at European Wax Center.

A great way to get around New Orleans especially during Mardi Gras when many of the streets are blocked to vehicle traffic. Also, it is a lot more fun than taking a cab. I would definitely use Need A Ride? if I make another trip to New Orleans.

Need A Ride's staff were great especially Robert the dispatcher and Scarlett the driver.

I ordered a shirt online for Mardi Gras this year and accidently ordered the wrong size. I wanted to exchange the shirt but was worried that I wouldn't get it back in time for my trip, but tried anyways. I received the exchange in about a weeks time. Fleurty Girl made it so easy! I loved the selection online and really hope I'll be able to stop in the store when I'm in town. Thanks!
Please don't smash and burn that burger. I think the employees have no respect for the food. It's sad that smaller chains like this have poor quality control that;s why they don't thrive.

If your wallet can handle a $13 salad, the El Vez is the place for you--and I HANDS DOWN recommend the Mexican Chop Salad with Grilled Chicken and the Chipotle Ranch Dressing.  Don't forget to squeeze the lime on there! Delicious!  In this rare instance, the portion can easily allow for leftovers.  On more than one occasion I have been known to order this salad for lunch with coworkers as well as make the trip from south philly specifically craving this salad.  

The rest of the menu however can be a roller coaster.  The portions here are very inconsistent for the prices.  For instance, the "tacos" are three miniature tortillas with (although tasty) 1-2 slivers of steak, a sprig of cilantro, and a dollop of guacamole on them.  Now, while they're tasty, you will definitely be leaving there hungry if you order them.  And at $18, this appetizer (to put it nicely) is deceiving on the menu as it does not mention they are three 3" diameter tortillas.  There are plenty of authentic tacorias in Philadelphia where $7 will get you five times the amount of food and with an undeniably authentic taste.  But they don't have a spinning motorcycle in the middle of their bar. Just sayin'. 

Overall I would say that El Vez is a typical Steven Starr Restaurant: well designed, contemporary interior with a hip vibe making it almost worth the above average prices. The staff, although the hippest and trendiest around, leave some personality to be desired although they reassure me it's ok to dine in my jeans and a t-shirt since that's their uniform. I would say that the food tastes good--even very good at times--but the portion sizes are so inconsistent it is like a guessing game. The nachos are a meal in itself--while the tacos are barely enough as an appetizer. Both taste great, though, as does the guacamole which is good even when avocados aren't in season...how do they do that? The margaritas are delicious but over priced--the Cantina's are just as good (if not better) and at 1/3 the cost and the option for pitchers, it might keep from making the trip north. The photobooth is a fun touch, and the outdoor seating is convenient for the area. I would give this restaurant one solid thumbs up.  If not mostly for that chop salad. :)
prices seem competitive and the star is very friendly and always courteous. The pharmacy is over priced and claim to price match but in all reality they don't.

It was amazing.  The choices were staggering, one of the best sushi restaurants in town.  I was a Peter's and Sushime fan, and this tops both.  Service was great, the decor so elegant.  I will be back many times

So I will keep this one truly short and sweet.  BEST FRIED CHICKEN I HAVE EVER HAD!  While people seem super excited about the bisquits (I thought they were just ok) the chicken is the standout here.  Were I to be stranded in the middle of a mosquito infested swamp with nothing but the clothes on my back and a plate of this fried chicken I would entirely be ok with things as they were because of this chicken.  If I found myself with a hole in my head and a plate of this fried chicken, I would just hope that the hole didn't interfere with the eating of the chicken because thats all I would care about.  Go and get you some!

What a great group of people! Everyone is very helpful and well informed on the many ways they can help you. I have come to them with several different issues from iPhone problems to laptop and desktop questions. They have always fixed my problems and given me viable solutions in a hurry. I have never met anyone working there that didn't have a smile on their face and wasn't completely ready to help me. Thank you so much!

Decided to try this place on a whim and to be completely honest I was a bit nervous after reading such mixed reviews. I can't speak for the Hibachi portion, but our experience today on the Sushi Bar side was pleasant! Our waiter was friendly and the food tasted fresh. I ordered the onion soup and Philadelphia roll. My Hubby ordered the regular sushi combo (8 pieces and one roll, plus soup and salad.) Our meal was delivered after waiting approx 15 minutes and neither of us had anything negative to say. All in all, it was a nice lunch and for that occasion it was great and served it's purpose. We both left satisfied and will return.

I read many reviews on here and decided to stop by with my wife and give this place a try. We ordered their ultimate pork sandwich, ultimate Italian hoagie and bacon cheese fries. 
Now, maybe most of these reviewers don't really know what a good sandwich is. I'm originally from Philly. I grew up with Pat's, Gino's, Steve's, Tony Luke's and Greenmans in my backyard.....
I know what a good cheesesteak, hoagie or pork sandwich is. 
Maybe this place had a bad day, but I don't see myself coming back here any time soon. 
The pork roll sandwich with spinach was very bland, there was a spice on it but otherwise the pork itself held no flavor. The only thing that was tasty about this sandwich was the roll. 
The ultimate Italian hoagie was actually pretty good, it had good quality and tasty meats and cheese but it was sliced way too thick that one couldn't even fold it into a hoagie. It basically was an open roll. All the tomatoes and onions rolled off the top. The roasted peppers embedded in the sandwich were very good. 
The bacon cheese fries, I wouldn't give to my pups. The cheese was very lumpy and thick, the bacon was very greasy and flabby and the French fries themselves were very soggy.  I can't believe people actually order these. 

Like I mentioned before, maybe this was a bad day for Pudges, but after reading all the raves from here, I definitely expected something edible and good.

Ive been to a lot of Millers being that I live in the Fort Lauderdale area.  This one is great, super clean, beautiful. Food was awesome!  Omg, the french dip, unreal! Our bartender Ashley was great, knew the menu, had great opinions, I wish this place was near my house!  Bravo!

I love this place. I have eaten in and taken out and the quality is excellent.  Great guacamole, excellent burritos, and the taco sampler is a great value.  I have only ever seen one waitress working at a time, so it can be slow at times...you just have to know what you are getting yourself into.  BYO and be patient, its worth it.

Great Priceline price of $55/night! Location is centrally located near train stations, Chinatown, The Trocadero, across street from Reading Market. Bed was comfy, bathroom spacious compared to comparable hotels. For your convenience, there's an airport shuttle departing every half hour for only $12, great if you have luggage.

I've been to Urban Farmer twice and my only gripe is the service (hence the four out of five stars). My first visit was spent at the bar area where I waited 15 minutes to order a drink! Then another 15 minutes to get a menu. Mind you it was a Tuesday night and they were not busy at all! Maybe I should sit in the middle of the bar as opposed to the side but regardless, patrons should never have to wait that long to be served... Or acknowledged. For my second visit, I decided to take my sister and her husband to dine in. We were seated right away. Awesome. We were offered bread! Hell yes we want bread! You would think the bread would come right away but it didn't. It actually came out with our appetizers.... No big deal though. Our main courses also came shortly after. I can continue to complain about the service but it really wasn't completely terrible. 

Overall, I think the place is amazing! I am also obsessed with the interior design... I seriously could live there! 

So let's talk food. Everything I had was amazing! I ordered the duck and my sister and her hubby ordered the steak sampler to share. We also ordered brussels, mushrooms, butternut squash,  foie gras and bone marrow to share. Out of all the appetizers, I enjoyed the foie gras and marrow the most... but everything was just delicious! If you're a big meat eater, I suggest ordering the steak sampler! Worth the money! For my next visit, I'm going to go for the cheese cart and some dessert!

This is not only a great place for locals to dine, but a place tourists or guests at the Logan Hotel can appreciate. 

Can't wait to go back!

Three Sixty is a great place for drinks and appetizers with spectacular views and good ambiance. I've been there about a dozen times. I've used valet every time. The reason for my negative review, however, is that on my last visit, the valet driver damaged by vehicle and did not say anything to me. It wasn't as if they didn't know they did it - they hit the frame directly and hard. And my vehicle which is only a few months old stays parked in my garage all day every day. I wash it twice a week. I know exactly when the damage happened. I called the hotel and asked for the valet manager. Someone took a written message yet no response was received from the valet manager. I called again, asking for the valet manager, and had to leave a voice mail. Again, no response was received. That's poor business etiquette and shows apathy towards a good customer. The reputation of Three Sixty is highly tarnished in my mind. The date of the incident was April 3, 2013.


Update, July 2013:

After posting this, the valet manager did call me and they rectified the situation completely. Today will be the first time I've visited Three Sixty since the incident.

The small plates were delicious, the service was amazing and the decor is very cool. ( I love the giant Ganesh in the doorway). My only complaint has to do with the desserts. The fruit plate was uninspired and the rose ice cream tasted like bubble bath.
The best catfish I've had in a long time. The service was very good. Also have great sweet potato fries.

This place is great. Friendly quick service. They had my oil change and tire rotation done in about 20 minutes. They pleasantly explained everything to me regarding the service. I was in their computer system even though I hadn't been there in several years.

Initially when we moved it in seemed great, till move in day. Cheap paint, cheap everything. Floor is peeling up by their fake wood, which they will most likely try to charge us for even though it was like that the day we moved in. But that little compared to other issues.

Since day one my wife and I experienced humidity levels in the 75-80% range. I told management a total of 3 times, which they never did anything about, because why would they do their job? The result of the humidity was MOLD starting to grow on decorations we have, which we ended up throwing out. The response I got from the complex was "buy a dehumidifier" or "change the ac unit". The ac units in the building are oversized ptac units which result in little to no dehumidification because they only sense dry bulb temps. Mix that with the cheap windows (I feel the draft coming in, plus a consistency of spiders I find in my apartment). Management said they would "check on the humidity issue" which they never have. And to management, the issue is fine now BECAUSE it's winter and there's a lack of humidity in the air. So that you for your "concern". But this will become an issue again in the summer. If you like to sleep comfortable do not live here. I can only imagine mold growing inside the walls this summer and us getting charged for it. 

Next issue,

My wife had been contacting the lady in the management office (I call her out because I don't know her name and she is the only one my wife has contacted) for our utility bill because we like to pay our bills on time. 2 months later it took a negative yelp review from her (which she took down because she is nice and the other lady who comments on these yelp reviews asked her to in exchange to waive the previous months utility bills we were waiting on). They finally sent us a bill, which was not waived, and as my wife fulfilled her end the manager who said she would waive it did not. We have all this communication in writing, and I might take this to court just for principle, because my wife also emailed her 4 times for verification the utility has been waived, but my wife has been ignored ever since she removed her yelp review (which is why I am doing one now). 

I have also been waiting for a parking pass for almost 2 months. The only reason that vehicle hasn't been towed is because security now knows my work vehicle. 

If possible this would be zero star rating for this "complex". But because I can't, I guess the positive star goes to the front desk staff and security because they're always friendly and ACTUALLY DO THEIR JOB. Maintenance as well, they always do their job well. 

This is not all the issues I have just some of them. I would not recommend to move into this place. We are almost sure we will not be renewing our lease due to the multiple failures of management, and "upper management". 

To the lady who comments on the yelp reviews and lied to my wife, you can be sure this review will not be edited or removed. Y'all have lied to us entirely too much for you to be trusted. And I have all your communication with my wife in writing too, which I may use as evidence. But for the time being, we are just going to pay our bills on time. And management stop giving my wife dirty looks or ignoring her because she called you out. 

Do not be fooled by the mimosas and smiles when you come in and look. The leasing office didn't even know the place takes money orders for rent payment (because paying online they just steal more money from you).

Orlando gave my family horrible costumer service. Not to mention the company LIES in order to make money from customers in need. My stepdad went in to see what was wrong with his car, and was told he needed his alternator replaced. Firestone wanted to charge $150 for labor and over $300 for the part. We found the part listed for cheaper elsewhere and asked if they could just do the labor if we brought in our own part, they said YES but that labor would be $160.
As soon as we actually purchase the part and headed into Firestone for the labor, they changed their mind and said they could not do the labor unless the part was purchased there. That is a total lie and a scam! Horrible customer service and company policy. I am appalled and this company should not still be in business.

Due to how close we are and the limited options  for dining in our area we have been going to Merryman's on Main Street in Pitman.  It is in an old bank but has plenty of outside dining.   I don't know when Pitman stopped being a dry town so this is the first restaurant/bar in the town that we know of. The service is very good, the menu diverse and their beer selection includes local brews.  I would have given 5 stars were it not for the high prices.  We paid $17.00 for a flatbread pizza which did taste very good.  The wings are $14 for 8 split wings, once again done very well and tasty but a bit pricey.  My hope is that these prices are in effect to allow them to stay in business during the pandemic and employ people in a newer establishment but these prices may stop repeat customers.  We have been there three times, we love the ambiance but paying center city prices in this area is tough.

Garbage, wish I could post negative stars. Bought a round on GolfNow (a well respected site) for Sunday morning with my in-law, drove 20 min, they have a tourney and won't let us play nor give a refund. Lady was rude and her "apology" was more sarcastic than sincere. Contacted GolfNow when we got home and they straightened it out. Also said they've had to contact this course several times for this reason.
Shady operation, course is right in the middle of a neighborhood, rude people. Reno/Sparks/Tahoe have way too many nice courses with nice people for anyone to even come here.
Hey just moved back to area..Good basic pie..I will be back..Fair price and cooked with love
Thank you for the hospitality and patience as I waited for my partner. The massage was amazing!

Good tasting burgers however , very pricey and took over 20 minutes to pick up an online prepaid order. I thought when you place An order and pay for it AND designate a pick up time , the food would be ready to go.
Amazing food. We got the dry rub ribs and burnt ends and they were both amazing! Their rub is on point. Also got the pulled pork and macaroni and cheese and just as good. This is my new bbq joint!
Coffee good but bagel just ok. Nothing special here

Slow. Slow. Slow. We came in based off reviews on Yelp. It was 11 am, no other customers. Our server came right up to ask us for drinks. It was super cold and I asked for a hot drink with something fun in it, she said let me check with the bartender. I heard her ask and then they gave her a hard time with recommendations. She never came back with suggestions on what we could order for drinks. Then she disappeared for at least 15 min. No one came over during that time. We were just about to leave when finally the bartender came out to ask us what we wanted. Really?! We already told the girl and you were the one giving her lip. It was so cold outside and we really wanted to warm up so we just ordered two coffees and a shot of Kailua, $17!? Another 10 min later our drinks came. We wanted to eat but after how long the drinks took we decided coffee was it. Unbelievable poor service. We're on our way to K-Paul's for lunch instead. Management should be ashamed of that kind of service.
First time there-very fast service and good food!  Had my five year old and 19 month old-staff was very friendly and accommodating with the kids.  Big food for reasonable prices. Reuben was awesome!

It's a bit hard to find in the shopping center but certainly more than worth it! We had an excellent afternoon tea. I also had the tomato soup, which was lovely. The shop is charming, and the service is good. The tea selection was impressive. I'm looking forward to my next visit.
To expensive for bowling! I'm glad lazer tag was included in the all inclusive price. The drinks were a lil whack, but overall had a Good time with my family.

Modern feel but the food is pretty classic Viet.  I didn't try the fresh rolls but my friends said they were good.  Bahn Mi was superb with a fresh French roll that flakes when you take a bite and fresh herbs and meat filling the middle.  The Bun bowl was pretty large indeed and is recommended.  Grilled pork is sliced thin which is the way to go for these dishes.  Prices are very, very reasonable.  8 bucks for a large Bun bowl.  Great find.

I was driving by and I stopped in for a slice.  The service was excellent. The pizza is probably one of the best that I have had in Reno.  The chef made the crust crispy and the Italian sausage was awesome.  I am going back there for lunch tomorrow
Lots of upside potential here if they can pull it together. Dined w three for lunch, food was tasty and fresh. I will try again in a couple weeks.

I have been to Bella on and off for 5 years! I had to stop going when I moved to Lancaster for college and then NYC. Funny thing is, I still come home to go here when I can! I have had a few of the stylist because unfortunately due to my schedule I have to go to different girls sometimes, but each time my experience is great. Valerie and Morgan I have used plenty of times and they are both AMAZING! great, great salon and the girls are extremely nice.
Try the HUMONGO apple pie.  With or without ice cream, it's a treat to satisfy at LEAST 4 hungry-for-dessert people.
Great flavor, maybe the best southwest food I ever tasted. Fish taco is absolutely delicious. And the chicken tortilla soup - wow!
The food is tasty and reasonably-priced, and the country decor is well executed. This place deserves better than Penn students looking for a snack after a night of partying.

We went in with a fairly large party on short notice and wow did they deliver! The food was really good. This was my first time there. We had the chicken nachos and brisket. Our service was top notch, very attentive, friendly, everything came out correct. The food was priced reasonably as well. They really went above and beyond for us! The ambiance was really cute, we sat out on the patio. Highly recommend!!!

We ate there Saturday night. The bartender was good and gave advice. The menu is small, but we tried most of the items and they were all excellent. The kitchen did a fantastic of pacing our food our so we didn't feel rushed.  Overall great place for a group, romantic dinner or simply if you want excellent "fancy" food.
Fantastic food! I have eaten at both the bar and the pizza place, great service, great food, great prices..everything I have eaten has been homemade!! Like it should be...highly recommend

Beautiful store with a large selection of rental equipment! Mark the owner always helpful
and professional anytime we stop by the store . The staffs are always friendly and courteous !
Wouldn't go back if it was free terrible service and food tasted pre cooked might as well go to wing house if you want crappy microwaved food save your cash folks
Went to the show over Memorial Day weekend and had a wonderful time. Superb vendors and stores, great staff, delicious BBQ, and overall lots of fun!

If you're looking for good Mexican food, Sweet Taco is NOT the place.  I tried the pork taco and a brisket taco, both were flavorless and bland.  My dining partner tried the nachos, and they were a sorry affair with hardly any toppings and big chunks of lettuce, again, very bland.  The salsa (and I'm being generous calling it salsa) was incredibly bad, flavorless, and an odd color - almost tan.  Worst salsa ever.  Salsa is not difficult to make, so I can't image why they can't even pull a decent salsa together.  The chips served with the awful salsa were thin and crisp, and unfortunately, the best item they offered.  The guacamole had huge chunks of avacado in it and was passable, at best.  Our meals were so bad that we didn't even want to try the donuts, fearing it would be more of the same.  If you didn't like Taqueria Del Sol, you won't like Sweet Taco - all they did was change the name and add a few menu items.  Also, there are several bottles of hot sauce on each table.  I did not use any because the tops of the bottles were so crusted and sticky that it was unappetizing.  I guess they do not notice or do not care enough to clean the bottle tops occasionally.  I ate here once when it was Taqueria Del Sol, and I swore I'd never go back, well, they changed their name and fooled me a second time, but never again!

What a fantastic establishment! The environment is gorgeous, and the staff is spectacular. I recently brought a party of 36 to this restaurant, and we couldn't have been happier with the service or food. From start to finish, everything was stellar -- this is by far the best Brazilian steakhouse I've ever visited. If you're looking for a place to entertain a group of friends, family members, or coworkers, call ahead and ask for Amanda Umholtz to help make your arrangements -- she's the greatest!

This place is GREAT. I ordered the seafood gumbo and a basket of okra, delicious! The gumbo comes in a large bowl and I had to take the rest home. The okra was cripy and flavorful not slimy at all. What I liked best was the clean environment and friendly staff. They suggested the gumbo and I am glad they did. I am a dedicated customer now :D

Went here for lunch after walking out of restaurant across the street. Service was quick, friendly. Had the fruit tea, nice. The sweet potato with coconut was nice. All the other food lacked seasoning. Not true Caribbean flavors, the chicken was tasteless, seasoning  wasn't there.The black bean and corn salad dish too lacked flavor, needed lime juice, ginger, curry, something to pick up the flavor.The jerk sauce although nice was/is not true jerk. The corn muffins were a bit dry.  With the right chef this place could be great. Decor, service, price all were great.. just need a chef to update the ingredients on the menu items

I grew up just outside of Philadelphia. A place where a good hoagie is a given.  I was surprised when I moved to the Trenton area that finding that good hoagie would be so hard. (finding good pizza is much easier)  My search ended at Chiarello's. They understand what goes on an Italian hoagie. Bologna should never be an option. The rolls are always fresh. I was told by someone working there that they get more than one roll delivery per day so they can always have the freshest bread.
Price is reasonable, delivery is fast, food is good. I've only had pizza and garlic knots but they're my go - to pizza place.

It want to busy when we went at 11 am on a Friday, and there were only 2 wait staff on, despite about 12 tables being full. Service, however, was prompt, friendly, and over all left a good taste in my mouth. Unfortunately, the food did not. I must say, they have some of the best priced big dishes in town. $10.99 for 3 eggs Benedict and a heaping pile of what could have been delicious potatoes. But, I guess what they do is not purchase, or use, seasoning in the kitchen. They also don't believe in proper plating. 8 thick, full spears of asparagus (slightly under done) was the bed on which my 3 perfectly poached, yet cold, eggs were placed on.

Stopped by today for a Reuben & Cuban sandwich.  They were ok.  Better than average but not nearly as good as some of my favorite sandwich shops.  I'd return again if I was in Dogtown, but if I was to go out of my way, I'd drive to Fozzie's, 9th Street Deli, Adriannas, or Blues City first.

So far I have tried this place two times.  I was driving around with a friend after a late class one evening and saw that this place was open.  I never noticed its existence seeing that I study at coffee groundz every once in a while.  Boy am I glad i found this place!  

The lasagna is an absolute must!  It is a homemade recipe by the owner's grandmother since the early 1900's and it is amazing!  It takes them a while to make it, I would say about 10 minutes because they are literally making it on the spot from scratch.  Most people place their orders ahead of time and take it to go because there are only 2 tables in there.  I think the whole concept of this place was fast italian food on the go.  The lasagna comes with 2 big pieces of garlic bread.  The lasagna is literally big enough to feed 2 people.  It is very filling and my new favorite lasagna in this city!  I usually do not like ordering lasagna at italian restaurants because I seem to never find one that truly satisfies me.

The second visit I made here, I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza with a small salad.  The pizza was pretty delicious as well.

The owners are extremely friendly.  I think it might be a young female and her brother?  The father is also there and extremely nice and had great stories to tell from his days working in Hollywood.

Overall, great food, great service.

Also, mondays are $1.00 lone star beer nights when you purchase food!

I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

You pay $30 for two giant deli sandwiches, with $1.50 premium for sweet potato fries.

The quality and quantity of the food justifies the price, but there's just nothing about this that makes me want to come back. The food, the interior, the wait time, the service: nothing was bad or good.

If I had to go again I wouldn't complain but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Up until today I thought Eiffel was a pretty cool club CONSIDERING it's New Orleans and most of the clubs are not well regulated and are too smokey. - after co collaborating with a goof friend, it was decided that we rent the VIP section for her Graduation party. The section was $350 and we rented two. Fine. It came with 2 bottles of Ciroc- blah blah. Well when we arrived, we also had food trays for our guests to be placed on the tables in the section we paid $700 for. When we arrived, the we asked the Manager Rife Whiting if we could bring the trays. He replied "no problem. Place them on your tables in your section." Somewhere between transferring the trays in and walking past him again, he said "well there's really no food policy. We've never allowed food. It's $20 per tray". Mind you, we had 5 trays in our section. I turned and said, "$700 for the section and another $100 for the trays? If there isn't a food policy, where did this fee come from?" I kid you not-- he told me, "well I'm the manager and I can make up whatever I want to when I want to and if you dont want to pay this fee you can either take your food back to your car or I will take it for you." --- at that point. The situation escalated and my friends had to calm me down. That's bogus. It's not even about the made up fee but the tone and abuse of position. That was the last time Eiffel will ever be recommended by me.

The star rating does not go high enough for this delightful dining experience. This was amazing food cooked with love and joy. Everything was perfect and amazing don't plan on a rush visit this food is meant to be savored

This place is great such a friendly environment and the staff are awesome. I got a pedicure and tips put on they accommodated my knees. I would recommend this place to everyone who wants good service and great employees.

I would like to apologize for my previous review as it turned out the owner was running late and did arrive shortly after I sent the review. My Mom and myself were upset making the trip to find the store closed since I had not been able to take my Mom since May. 

I thought I deleted the negative review but had not. The owner was very courteous helping both my Mom and another customer at the same time. She was very patient and trimmed the wig to my Mom's satisfaction. Wig World has a wonderful selection and I would recommend them to anyone in need of a wig.

Went here for lunch today after years and it didn't disappoint, food very incredible! The toasted coconut marg is delicious and the cauliflower tacos are AMAZING! Best cauliflower I've had restaurant wise. Can't wait to go back

We went through the drive through at 9:15pm and their signs say they close at 10pm. There were 8 employees in the window that we could see and some even looked at us in our car and pretended they didn't see us!!!! What? We waited and then just went somewhere else. They were all just sitting around talking. Are you open or not??

My husband and I had a quick meal last night. Just a burger and the football game. Food was good, service was friendly and efficient. But after I paid the bill with cash, our waitress ignored us to the point of turning her head when she walked by. I have a very low guilt threshold so immediately thought the tip was too small. In the car, I recalculated. I hadn't misread the total. But just now, we realized that I might have miscounted the bills and left only a two dollar tip. We were traveling so I can't just run in with the difference anytime soon. I just want her to know that it was a mistake. I appreciate that she works hard and I'm very sorry.

Recently purchased a king size bed from Ricardo and Lee. Both of these gentlemen were extremely knowledgeable about the beds in the store and helped us to pick the right bed for our comfort and budget. They also made sure that we got the best deal possible. This is the second bed we purchased here and would recommend them to all of our friends and family.

If it's not the usps not delivering, how about this one. Package was supposed to be delivered yesterday to our home. No door tag on my door. My girlfriend made arrangements to leave work so she could be home at the delivery time of 10:30 am today. When I left for work at 10:00 am, there was a door tag on the door ACROSS from my door!!! So not only did my gf race home for nothin there was no delivery!!! No door tag on my door, no package. Get this, they stated we need an adult signature which is why we needed to be home. But last time we got this delivery it was left in a secure pickup box similar to an amazon storage self pick up. Why do we need a signature this time beats the hell outta me. 
WTF!!! Good one FedEx

This place has a great drink selection and wonderful food. The service was very good - friendly and attentive. My server, I unfortunately don't remember her name, gave me useful suggestions. I had the roasted duck and chevre salad. It was amazing! I generally don't eat all of the food I order, and I would have licked the bowl if I thought no one would notice. Highly recommend.

Called to ask about the services they provide and the woman who pick up said " Sir, we do a lot of services and I don't have time to go over them." Thought that was rude and unprofessional. I'll take my business somewhere that has the time. Thank you!
The pork and chive dumplings were delicious. The noodle soup wasn't too salty and the greens in the soup were flavorful. The service was fast and casual. Great experience!

Came here with a group of 5 to have a rather late dinner - not a lot of places were still open.

We had a mix of drinks, burgers, sandwiches and salads.

Was it remarkably great? No. Was it great for the price/size/location? Totally! If I was looking for a late-ish night meal I'd be happy to come back.
The salads are so good! Fresh ingredients. You pick what you want on it. Surreal is so nice- the whole staff is friendly! Mango dressing is amazing. The turkey chili is on point as well.

No drinks special. No free wifi (it says on their site and ad) slow service.  Food is ok nothing special.  Came here because a friend wants to watch greenbay game. Beers here are flat.  Taste like overnight left over beers.  Over all. Don't come here unless you have to  watch games that's not on tv.

1. the potatoes
2. the buttermilk biscuits
3. the pancakes
4. the homemade ketchup

wonderful atmosphere, great staff, huge portions. 
that's all you need to know.

I really liked the place. Service was great, the waitress was very receptive of our table and always came around us with a smile. The wait wasn't long at all. We ordered several dozen oysters. We ordered their chargrilled oysters and raw oysters. Great flavor! We were extremely happy with the oysters since the last time we had great oysters was in Hawaii.
Impact Carpet Cleaning did wonders to our carpets! We hired them twice for our last apartment and our house. They made our carpets look brand new. I would definitely hire them again!!

Had the Cashew Nut Chicken which was decent enough but nothing special. It took close to 45 minutes before the first person in our party of 8 got her food and another 30 minutes before the last person did, which made the meal very uncoordinated. Things like that happen from time to time but the restaurant was almost empty and it didn't look like they were all that busy. Service was brusk and unfriendly, though efficient.

Normally my experience here is amazing; however today it was horrible. We were told that our wait would be 20 mins but it was a lot longer. My husband decided to walk to grab champagne. He wasn't gone long at all, but they kept putting people in front of us because he wasn't here. I was here and we told her he was leaving, that was her opportunity to tell us that the entire party had to be here to be seated. When I addressed it she was rude and condescending. I hope that the managers will take time to teach their staff customer service. This was a bad experience and I'm highly disappointed because I love Sabrina's.

I would give this spot a 3.75/5.00 if possible. Since I can't, I rounded up to 4.00/5.00 for the delicious wine and great atmosphere.

On my visit to Nashville, a friend who has lived in Nashville for 3 years suggested going to Rumours. It is labeled a Wine Bar for a reason - the waitress recommended a medium body French Pinot Noir that was easy to drink and did not break the bank. The wine went down like water, resulting in splitting two bottles between two people.

We paired the wine with the cheese plate, the meatballs, & the mussel bowl with spaghetti. The cheese plate came with four wedges of cheese, including a delicious goat cheese, tomato marmalade, nuts, and an array of bread and crackers. I enjoyed all of the cheeses, except the Dijon, and would recommend asking to substitute this cheese for an additional goat cheese or the server's suggestion.

The mussel bowl came fresh to order in a white wine & capers sauce topped with feta cheese. I will most definitely order this plate on my next visit to Rumours and highly recommend it to any guest.

Lastly, the meatballs were tasty but tiny. I expected the serving size of 4 meatballs as it was on under the small plates section on the menu. I was surprised that the 4 meatballs were roughly 1 inch in diameter. Still, the carrot-apple-fennel slaw complement the dish perfectly. At $8 a plate, I would suggest a try if you like meatballs but recommend ordering at least 2 for tables of more than 2 people.

Two bottles and a few small plates later, we stumbled out vowing to revisit the next time that I visit. I hope to go back when the weather is a nicer to sit in the gorgeous outside area.

Horrible customer service.  Customers should be allowed to try on another size.  The sales associate actually refused to get me another size, which is not what I have experienced at other stores.  I wasn't asking for anything out of the ordinary, I only took in 2 bras and wanted ONE of them in a different size.  The store wasn't busy so I don't understand her reluctance. You can give me advice on how it should fit, but don't make me stand there peeking out of the fitting room doorway, half dressed, trying to justify why I just want to *try* the next size up.  I know how I want my lingerie to fit and will go elsewhere where I won't be put in such a humiliating situation.

A little place to grab a quick slice and for $1.25 you can't beat it. Fast, convenient and cheap plus the pizza is actually good. The owner is an old school Italian kinda guy and I had the joy of shooting the shit with him while he heated the slice up.
